loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with 4 children, ages 25, 20, 18 and 15 years old. Mwanaidi owns a small grocery store and she sells clothes. She started in 1990. Every day, she works from 7am to 12.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food for her business

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is 28 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 8 and 1 years old. Kibibi is a tailor and she sells clothes. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Six women from Banh Chhkol village will be sharing a group loan in Banh Chhkol village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Chan O. has been selected to be the group leader. She is a pot seller in the local market. She has five children, two of whom are working in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in school.

Previously, she had already obtained a loan from AMK (Angkor Micro-Finance Kampuchea) to buy firewood to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Pheorn Chao, is a subsistence farmer and he also helps his wife to sell pots.

Mrs. Chan O.’s family lives in a house which does not have a toilet. Thus, now she wants a new loan to build a toilet in the house. This would greatly improve the hygienic conditions and decrease illness incidence.

loans.use: To build a toilet.

loans.name: Saumu's Sahare Tanga Group

texts.en:
Saumu is 27 years old and is a single woman. Saumu sells clothes. She started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Halima B. is 42 years old, she has 7 children. Her husband is working in Russia. Halima sells homemade kefir and milk. Now, she has 4 cows, and she gets from them 5 liters of milk per day; she milks the cows twice a day. Halima's daughter helps her take care of the animals.

Halima decided to purchase more cows. This is why she came to Microinvest.

Халима Бобомуротова женщина в возросте 42 года замужем, имеет 7 детей, муж на заработках в России. Сама Xалима занимается бизнесом по продаже домашнего кефира и молока. Oна имеет сейчас 4 коров с которых получает в день с каждой по 5 литров молока, доит их в день 2 раза , утром и вечером. По уходу за скотом ей помогает дочь. Поэтому Халима решила увеличить колличество скота в кредит. Для чего она и обратилась в Микроинвест.

loans.use: To purchase more cows

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46125

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 55 years old and is widow with 2 children, ages 17 and 13 years old. Mwanaidi owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 12.30am to 7.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food for her business..

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 7 and 2 years old. Fatuma sells charcoal and firewood. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi's Cassanora B Group

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is 33 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages18 and 14 years old. Mwanamkasi sells clothes. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 4.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Fatuma and Tima, who sell bananas and fish.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 49 years old. She has 4 children studying in school. After her husband died, she became responsible for them. She has a small sewing shop in her rented house. She applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some new fabric in order to increase her income and save for a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine and some new fabric

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with 4 children, ages 10-20 years old. She and her husband also take care of 4 other children, ages 10-20 years old. Mwanamkuu sells clothes. She started in 2004. Every day, she works from 3am to 19pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.ru:
Djumagul T. is 34 years old, married and has five children. She has been raising and selling cattle since childhood and currently she also sells kurut (salty yogurt cheese balls), which is very profitable. All Djumagul's children attend the school in her kishlak (mountain village). Since their kishlak is close to the mountains they have problems with potable water. Djumagul's family saves water in large cisterns, but it has to stand for a while before it can be consumed. They also have problems with electricity, and can only have two hours of electricity per day. There is no natural gas in kishlak. But the residents of the kishlak have gotten used to these living conditions a long time ago and do not protest, since everyone is hoping that things will fix themselves soon enough. Djumagul currently has 3 cows and 4 rams and to increase the number of animals in her heard she has turned to Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Джумагул Туранова женщина в возросте 34 года замужем имеет 5 детей, она с детства занимается откормом и продажей скота, а также она продает национальный курут , с чего имеет хороший доход.Все ее дети учатся в средней школе кишлака. Их кишлак находится вблизи гор,у них проблемы с питьевой водой.Они воду запасая в бочках сначала перед употреблением ее отстаивают.Также у них проблемы сосветом , в день элэнергия подается 2часа в день.Газ вообще еще не проведен. Но население этого кишлака уже привыкли к таким условиям и не выражают надовольства,т.к. надеются что скоро все пойдет к улучшению. Сейчас она имеет 3 коровы и 4 барана,чтоб увеличить численность скота Джумагул обратилась в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Fattening and sale of cattle

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46131

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en:
Zaki is a 56 year old man. He has three children. He lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Zaki owns a mini market. This is the fifth time he has requested a loan at Al Majmoua. He is planning to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business with the loan.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Aunaka

texts.en:
Aunaka is 23 years old and is a single woman. Aunaka sells coal. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more coal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more coal for her business.

loans.name: Noor M

texts.en: Noor M is 50 years old. He lives in District 17, Kabul, Afghanistan and is the father of 6 children. He has a metal-working business. He makes various designs from metal and sells them at the bazaar. He has requested an individual loan from AFSG  to complete his stock and  move ahead in his business in future.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Masoli

texts.ru:
Masoli is a 44 year old man who is married and has six children. He is a professional house builder and works on private construction sites as a part of a work team. In his free time Masoli raises cattle. His son Azam, who is 18, helps him with this task. Currently the two have 5 rams and 2 cows in their barn. Masoli is planning to use the loan to purchase more animals, since he believes that raising more animals will increase his profits.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Масоли мужчина в возросте 44 года женат имеет 6 детей , по профессии строитель, работает на стройке на заказ с бригадой.В свободное время занимается уходом за скотом.Также ему помогает сын Азам ему 18 лет.Сейчас у него 5 баранов и 2 коровы.Взяв займ он хочет купить еще скот.Он считает что чем больше скот тем больше прибыль.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a 38 year old woman. She lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Fayza sells used clothes. This is the first time she has requested a loan at Al Majmoua. With the loan, she is planning to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her clothing business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 27 years old and is a single woman. Mariam sells clothes. She started in 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 29 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 8 years old. Martha sells fish. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 12.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 28 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 10, 6 and 2 years old. Aisha sells firewood. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina is a married woman with 4 children. Anjelina owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 30 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 3-11 years old. Mwanaisha owns a small grocery store. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Meoun Mi Group

texts.en:
Five women form a group in Banh Chhkol village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Meoun M., 50, is the group leader. She sells pots and vases in the village. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are pot and vase makers, while the others are attending school.

Last year, AMK had provided Mrs. Meoun M. with a loan for buying land to re-sell for a profit. Her business is very profitable and the family is reasonably well off. Since last year she made a profit by re-selling land, she now would like to get another loan to try again to buy a piece of land to re-sell for a profit.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mrs. Sokha Chean decided to pay $13 in advance.

This Group Has An End Of Term Loan. This Means That Principal Is Due At The End Of The Loan. AMK Allows For Pre-payments, Thus Some The Members Might Pay Some Principal Before The End Of The Loan. So Mrs. Sokha Chean Decided To Pay $13 In Advance.
Mrs. Sokha Chean Decided To Pay $13 In Advance.

loans.name: Habibullah

texts.en:
This is Habibullah, son of L. M.. He is a man whose business is  a spare parts shop in Kabul city.
He lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He presently has a lot of economic problems and he couldn’t solve these problems with his own money, so he wants to buy some more spare parts for his shop. He believes this will allow him to progress in his business.
 Therefore he has requested a small loan in the amount of US$ 625 from AFSG.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for re-sale

loans.name: Theour Kheom Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Theour K. was born in 1954 and now lives in Banh Chhkol village. She is the group leader in a group of four women members of the village. She is a pots and firewood seller. She is married with four children, one of whom is working in a garment factory, while the others are studying in state school. Her husband, Mr. Eourn Kong, owns a husbandry business. He looks after cows, which he then sells for a profit. Additionally, he helps his wife when he has free time from his work.

Mrs. Theour K. has already requested a loan from AMK in the past to buy firewood to re-sell in the village. Presently, she wants to expand her business so she has asked for a loan. With part of it, she will buy more firewood to sell. With the rest of the money, she would like to buy a piece of land and re-sell it for a profit.

loans.use: To buy the land and firewood.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She sells chicken. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more chicken for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for her business.

loans.name: Maria's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 15,10 and 5 years old. Maria sells clothes. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
Mama N. is 59 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the village bank Alwar CMT in Ziguinchor for 6 years. Her commercial activity consists of buying and selling palm oil, honey, brushes, lemons and dried fish. With the profits she will make, she will help with household finances. Mama would like to bolster her economic activity with this loan which will be repaid at the end of a period of 6 months in one single payment.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mama N., 59 ans, mariée, mère de 06 enfants est membre du banc villageois de Alwar CMT à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans. Elle mène une activité de commerce qui consiste à acheter et revendre de l’huile de palme, du miel, des balaies, du citron et des poissons secs . Avec ses revenus elle contribue à l’entretien de la famille. Mama veut renforcer son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase honey, lemons, brushes and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou D. is 54 years old, married and the mother of one daughter. She has been a member of the village bank Niaguiss Nema in Ziguinchor for two and a half years. She would like to purchase oil, rice and sugar to stock her store which is currently seeing good times. The profits she makes will help her to improve her family's standard of living. She is asking for her 6th loan, which will be repaid at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Aissatou D., 54 ans, mariée, 01 fille en charge est membre du banc villageois de Niaguiss Néma à Ziguinchor depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter de l’huile, du riz et du sucre pour renforcer sa boutique qui marche bien. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer le bien être familial. Elle sollicite un 6ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase rice, oil, sugar and coal to stock her store.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou S. is married and has been a member of the village bank Niaguiss Nema in Ziguinchor for four years. She would like to buy merchandise such as oil, rice, sugar, milk, tea and coffee to stock her store she runs with her husband. The profits will help her to satisfy the needs of her family. She is asking for a loan that will be repaid at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Aissatou S., mariée est membre du banc villageois de Niaguiss Néma à Ziguinchor depuis 4ans. Elle veut acheter de la marchandise comme de l’huile, du riz, du sucre, du lait, du thé, et du café pour renforcer sa boutique qu’elle gère avec l’aide de son mari. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer à la satisfaction des besoins de la famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To stock her store with rice, sugar, milk, coffee, and tea

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.ru:
Savriniso P. sells goods next to the local market, since there was no space left inside. She sells small household items such as cosmetics and female and child hair accessories, writing supplies and candy. Savriniso's business has been expanding and she has found another area to set up a stall where there are a lot of customers. Her oldest grandson is managing that market stall but there are not enough goods for both places. Savriniso also has to travel to the big markets outside the city to resupply on certain weekdays.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Савринисо торгует возле рынка так как внутри базара не осталось мест. Она сторгует разными мелкими вещями, ее товар это : бижутерии женские и детсике, канцелярские товары и конфеты с жевачками. У нее успешно развивается бизнес , она нашла еще одну точку , где много покупателей, но товара для этого мало, там сидит ее старший внук. Также она по определенным дням в неделю ездит на большие рынки, за пределами города.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46150

loans.name: Bisaboat

texts.ru:
Bisaboat S. has opened her shop by the bus station in order to attract a lot of clients. She sells cigarettes, bubble gum and matches. She has a lot of experience in sales. Before opening her own store Bisaboat was a saleswoman in a large department store. With time she learned a lot about commerce and started her own business. Bisaboat knows which goods are popular and will sell in large quantities. When she herself is away from the store, either buying more goods or due to personal reasons, her mother takes care of the store for her. Her mother also helps her expand this business and when Bisaboat was short on money her mother helped solve her financial problems. But her mother is old now and instead of borrowing fm her, Bisaboat decided to turn to Microinvest and has not regretted it.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Шокирова Бисабоат открыла точку возле остановки для привлечения множества клиентов. Она торгует сигаретами, жвачками и спичками. Она хорошо знает свое дело. Перед тем как открыть свое дело, она была продавщицей в большом магазине. Со времен она научилась коммерции и начала свое дело. Она знает, какие товары покупают в большом виде. Когда она отлучается- ездит за товаром или по своим делам, ее замещает мама. Мама помогает в развитии бизнеса, когда у нее не хватало денег мама помогала решить эту финансовую проблему. Теперь, когда мама состарилась, она решилась обратиться в Микроинвест и не пожалела.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Teddy's Chapakazi A Group

texts.en:
Teddy, age 29, is married with 3 children (ages 10, 6, and 4). She has a shop where she sells clothes, which she began 1 year ago. She works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $99 from this business.

Teddy has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital. She hopes for a new loan to buy more clothing for her shop. Teddy will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell general items, fruits, and vegetables.

In the picture, Teddy is standing second from the left.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy Boatema is thirty-one years old and a businesswoman who is very glad that she started her own grocery shop six months ago. She enjoys selling and takes pride in meeting the needs of her customers. She is the mother of two children, and she works hard to earn a living for the family. Mercy wants the loan to expand her operation to include additional items like rice, sanitary towels, soft drinks, assorted biscuits, etc., to increase profit. It is her fervent wish to provide better living conditions and a quality education for her children through the business. Mercy has a personal guarantor to repay the loan in case of default.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, boxes of assorted biscuits, sanitary towels.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46153

loans.name: Qadrbi

texts.ru:
Qadrbi J. lives in the city of Vahdat in Tajikistan. She is 52 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a high school degree and makes her living as a farmer. Qudrbi grows wheat, potatoes and other vegetables. She then sells her harvest at the market and to wholesalers at a lower price. This provides the local markets with vegetables and grain and helps the salesmen make a living as well. Right now it is potato planting season in Tajikistan and Qadrbi wants to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds. For that she needs to take out a loan which she is planning to pay back in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Джонова Кадрби жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 52 года , замужем и имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее.Занимается земледелием. Выращивает пшеницу , картошку , другие овощи. После получения урожая продает его на рынке , оптовикам по более низкой цене. Это дает возможность обеспечить рынок товаром , а так же заработать продовцам. Сейчас время посева картофеля ей нужно закупить удобрения и семена овощей. Для этого она хочет получить кредит . который сможет погасить в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles A. is forty years old and a refrigerator repairman. He works very hard to meet the demands of his various clients. However, Charles is constrained by capital to acquire the needed equipment and raw materials like dryers, copper rods, compressors, etc., to improve the business. He wants to use the loan to buy more dryers, copper rods, compressors, etc., to enable him serve his customers. Charles has seven apprentices under his training, to enable them also to learn the trade to earn a living. He has a personal guarantor to repay the loan in case of default. Charles is the one wearing a gray round-neck shirt in the photo, with one of his apprentices.

loans.use: To buy more copper rods, dryers, compressors, etc.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 44 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 8 years old. Dorcas is a tailor and a hair dresser. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Baroat

texts.ru:
Baorat started her business with the help of her children. When times where hard her daughter was selling hair bands, pens and other small items allowed in school to her friends. With time Baorat found out about it and decided to sell such small items in a stall near her house. Nowdays she manages the shop instead of her daughter and offers various small items that are necessary in everyday life. Recently her daughter has gotten married and Boarat had to take shop money to fund the wedding. To help support the shop Baorat has turned to Microinvest for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Бароат начала свой бизнес с помощью детей. Когда было тяжело ее дочь мало по мало предлагала своим пордугам на продажу заколки , ручки и что можно было принести с собой в школу. Со временем Бароат узнала об этом и решила не долеко отсвоего дома торговать разными мелочами. Теперь вместо дочки она сама торгует , на ее прилавке есть все мелочи необходимые для каждого человека. Не давно она выдала дочь замуж и ей пришлось использовать деньги с оборота. Для этого она обратилась в Микроинвест и получила необходимую ей сумму.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46157

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is forty-eight years old and the mother of four children with three of them in school. She is a retailer of tiger nuts. Tiger nut is a perennial juicy root nut. It is used to prepare local drinks, cakes and traditional medicine. She wants to use the loan to buy bags of tiger nuts to avoid price hikes as the country enters into planting season. Janet hopes to finance the education of her children to university level with the savings from her business. Janet has a personal guarantor to secure her loan in case of default.

loans.use: To buy more bags of tiger nuts.

loans.name: Anora

texts.ru:
Anora T. lives in the town of Vahdat with her family. She has five children, married, she is 38 years old. She does not hold a job, but makes her living by agriculture. The whole family is helping her all together. Currently she has sowed wheat on her piece of land. She needs finances to buy fertilizer. The prices on fertilizer have been high in time for the sowing season and this is why Anora needs a loan to buy the fertilizer and use the rest of the money to pay for the rent of the land. She will pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Табарова Анора проживает в городе Вахдат. Живет со своей семьей. У нее 5 детей и муж, а возраст 38 лет. Нигде не работает , но зарабатывает деньги путем земледелия. Вся семь вместе с ней дружно помогает ей .Сейчас на своем участке она засеила пшеницу. Но ей нужны средства , чтобы закупить удобрения. В связи с приходом посевного сезона , цены на удобрения поднялись и поэтому она хочет получить кредит , который поможет закупить удобрения, а оставшуюся часть денег отдать за аренду земли. Погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel B. is forty-eight years old and a businessman. He says with the help of Sinapi he now has his own shop. He is a retailer of used tires of various sizes and has been for the last year. He is a father of three children and the children are currently in school. He wants to use the new loan to expand his operation to include brand new tires to increase his income and also to provide decent shelter for his family. Daniel has a personal guarantor to secure the loan in to repay the loan in case of default.

loans.use: To buy more vehicular tires.

loans.name: Naim

texts.ru:
Naim works as a taxi driver. He has recently married and has been working day and night to be able to feed his new family. The taxi drivers are keeping a watch where there's the most clientele, like around the market or the airport. As Naim says, the life of a taxi driver is not so easy. It might seems as they have a flexible schedule, no employers or bosses. Their main problem are traffic cops. As the drivers confess, the cops have been stopping them for any type of small offense. Naim takes of the taxi sign off his car for this reason in order to pass by them on road blocks. He needs the loan to make repairs to his car.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Наим работает таксистом. Он женат недавно, поэтому ему пришлось работать день и ночь что бы прокормить свою молодую семью. Таксисты дежурят неподалеку от тех мест, где много клиентов , например возле рынка или в аэропорту. По словам Наима, жизнь таксиста не так уж легка. Казалось бы, свободный график работы, отсутствие какого бы то ни было начальства. Портят жизнь таксистам и работники ГАИ. Как рассказали водители, в последнее время инспекторы их останавливают за малейшее нарушение. Поэтому он иногда снимает свою шашечную доску с такси , что бы проехать мимо ГАИшников. Он получил кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.

loans.use: Taxi service

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46161

loans.name: Sihaba

texts.en:
Sihaba is 30 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14 ,9, and 2 years old. Sihaba owns a general store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina A. is fifty-two years old and the mother of four children. Two of her children are in school. She has a grocery store as the main source of livelihood for her family. Regina is very grateful for the previous loan that enabled her to own her shop. She gives testimony of how the loan helped her to send her first two children to school. She wants to use the loan to buy more products like evaporated milk, toiletries, cereals, bottled water, etc., to increase her sales and profit. She has a personal guarantor to secure the loan in case of default.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of evaporated milk, toiletries, cereals etc.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a single woman with 5 children, ages 3-15 years old. Matilda sells charcoal. She started in 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Afadule

texts.en: Afadule A. is fifty-eight years old and the mother of five children. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells local foods like banku, which is prepared from maize and eaten with either peanut or palm nut soups. She has a lot of customers because her meals are very delicious and nutritious. Through the business, she has managed to send three of her children to learn apprenticeships to provide them with better skills to earn a living. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize, cartons of frozen fish, palm fruits, peanut butter, spices, etc., to avoid price hikes and also to increase sales. She plans to save from her income to build a house for her family. Afadule has a personal guarantor to repay the loan in case of default.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, beef, and frozen fish.

loans.name: Kamila

texts.ru:
Kamila M. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is in the plant growing business. She has a piece of land which he sows with vegetables. She has a large family. Her husband is in Russia for work and Kamila works on her field by picking potatoes with her nine children. Because of the cold winter the financial situation of Kamila's family became somewhat unstable and this is why she decided to apply to a loan on which is can buy the fertilizer and potato seeds. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мухаммадиева Камила проживает вгороде Вахдат. Занимается растениеводством. Имеет землю , которую засеивает овощами. У нее очень большая семья. Муж в России , зарабатывает деньги.А она в свою очередь со своими 9 детьми сеет и собирает картошку. В связи с холодной зимой , финансовое положение семьи Камилы немного пошатнулось , поэтому она решила прибегнуть к кредиту, который поможет ей купить удобрения и семена картолфеля. Погасить кредит Камила сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seeds

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana T. is forty years old and the mother of five children. She is a food vendor who sells banku at a local community. Banku is one of the best local foods, prepared from maize, and is enjoyed by most Ghanaians. She used to buy the maize on credit at a very expensive price, but thanks to the loan, she now buys with cash at a moderate price, she says. She wants to use the new loan to buy more bags of maize for keeping, as a result of increasing food prices, which can drain her profit. Alice, one of her children, is in the photo, since Juliana had gone to buy products from the market.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, palm fruits, peanut butter, vegetables, frozen foods, etc.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 46167

loans.name: Mwanapembe

texts.en:
Mwanapembe is 20 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 2 years old. Mwanapembe owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2008. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food for her business.

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru:
Safarmo D. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 42 years old, married and has three children. She has secondary education. She does not hold a job, but has her own piece of land which she sows with potato and other vegetables. As the sowing season has arrived, it's now time to plant potatoes, cabbage, cucumbers and tomatoes. Safarmo's family is also helping her. They work in the early morning before the sunrise and after dusk into the late night. Safarmo has a little trouble with finances at this time and this is why she turned for help. She needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Давлатова Сафармо живет в городе Вахдат. Возраст 42 года , замужем и имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Нигде не работает , но имеет землю, которую засеивает картофелем и другими овощами. Посевной сезон наступил, пришло время сеить картошку , капусту , огурцы и помидоры. Но занимается она не одна , ей помогает ее семья. Утром пока солнце не взошло высоко ,они на земле и вечером до ночи они все вместе работают. Сейчас Сафармо имеет небольшие проблемы с финансами, поэтомуона обратилась к нам за помощью. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит она планируетв течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Happiness's Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Happiness is 38 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14,10 and 9 years old. Happiness owns a small grocery store that she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Ester and Adventina, who have livestock businesses.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en: Kwadwo B. is thirty-five years old. He sells secondhand (used) shoes in one of the busiest local markets. "I used to obtain my supplies on credit at relatively expensive cost, but the previous loan provided me with working capital to obtain cash supplies. I am very grateful," says Kwadwo. He wants to use the new loan to build a small shop to store his goods to reduce frequent thefts that disturb his business. This will also provide him with enough space to increase his stock and make additional profit. Kwadwo is single and he hopes to increase his business income to provide him with the means to get married. He belongs to a community group called Love Trust Group. The group members agree in principle as social collateral to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus A. is twenty-eight years old, who works very hard to provide food for himself and his three younger siblings. Titus is single and he sells secondhand (used) shoes and other footwear in a market center. His previous loan enabled him start trading in used shoes and he is very thankful to Sinapi. Through the business, Titus is financing two of his brothers’ educations. He wants to use the new loan to buy more women's shoes and slippers to meet his clients’ preferences in the market and also to enable him make more profits. He is a member of a community group called Love Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes

loans.name: Hawa's Chapakazi B Group

texts.en:
Hawa, age 48, is married with 5 children (ages 30, 28, 20, 16, and 12). She has a mini studio business where she sells cassettes, CDs, and VCDs. She began this business 2 years ago. She opens the shop from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $42 from her sales.

Hawa has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenje Tanzania to increase her capital. She hopes for a new loan to buy more CDs, VCDs, and cassettes for her mini studio. Hawa will share this loan with her subgroup members, selling beverages, poultry, medicine, vegetables, fruit, and clothes.

In the picture, Hawa is standing first on the right.

loans.use: To purchase more CDs, VCDs, and cassettes for her studio

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is a self-employed taxi driver. A former military man, he decided to start driving a taxi to earn extra income after he retired. Igor works in the city of Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine. He partners with a radio dispatching company which helps to ensure he has a good supply of customers needing transportation. Igor is married and has two teenage children, a son and a daughter.

Igor has requested a short term loan to have some repairs done to the gear shift on his taxi as well as some other minor repairs. This is Igor’s first loan from Nadiya Ukraine. He was recommended by a fellow taxi driver. We are happy to be able to help Igor maintain his vehicle so he can continue earning a good income and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: Taxi repairs

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is an entrepreneur from Kahovka, a city on the wide Dnepr River that runs through the middle of Ukraine. Married with two children, Nataliya helps support her family with a small business selling cosmetics and personal care items. She has been in business for over eight years and currently makes about $200 in profit each month.

Nataliya has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven (US$ 525) to purchase new inventory to sell. The type of business Nataliya has selling small items involves a fairly high product turnover rate. This loan will increase the amount of inventory she can buy and will help her continue to make a profit.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Vasilina

texts.en:
Vasilina has a small clothing business at a busy market in Kahovka, Ukraine. In business for eleven years, she has gained much valuable experience and met the clothing needs of many customers along the way. Vasilina is married and has a fourteen-year-old daughter. She currently makes about $300 per month in profits and has about $3000 worth of inventory on hand.

Vasilina has requested a short term loan to help purchase additional merchandise to sell in her kiosk. The spring and summer are busy times of the year for clothing vendors like Vasilina as the weather improves and customers get out to shop and update their wardrobes. This loan will help Vasilina obtain necessary inventory so she can earn a good profit and continue the success of her business.

loans.use: Purchase new invenory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cooking equipment for catering

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is an experienced business owner from Simferopol, Ukraine. She has been self-employed for over 12 years. She currently has two small stores at a market near a busy intersection in Simferopol where she sells a variety of household goods, personal items, and cosmetics. Victoria has benefited from having an established business and being properly registered with the government to operate. Other businesses that were not properly registered were closed down which has led to reduced competition for Victoria.

Victoria has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven (US$ 525) for two purposes. One is to pay for some shelving that she was required by the market management to have installed. She also plans to purchase additional inventory to sell in her stores.

loans.use: Pay for shelving and buy inventory

loans.name: Veronica's Upendo Mloganzila B Group

texts.en:
Veronica, age 58, is married with 2 children (ages 26 and 18). She has a shop where she sells alcohol and soft drinks, which she began 3 years ago. She works from 10:00 AM to 11:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $833 from her sales.

Veronica has taken out 4 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to pay for her son’s school fees, build a small house, and increase her capital. She hopes for a new loan for school fees and to open a retail shop. Veronica will share this loan with her subgroup members, selling grains, vegetables, fruit, and house chemicals.

In the picture, Veronica is standing second from the left.

loans.use: For school fees and to open a retail shop

loans.name: Hanane

texts.en:
Hanane is a 33 year old woman. She has five children. She lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh, with her family.

Hanane is in the agriculture business. This is the first time she has asked for a loan at Al Majmoua. With the loan, she is planning to buy agricultural inputs to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 32 year old woman. She lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Amal is in the agriculture business. This is the first time she has asked for a loan at Al Majmoua. With the loan, she is planning to buy agricultural inputs to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. sells shoes, sandals, shirts, and others. She is divorced and has 5 dependents. She is running out of stock.

She is requesting additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Samaher

texts.en:
Samaher is a 38 year old woman. She has five children. She lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh, with her family.

Samaher is in the agriculture business. This is the first time she has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. She is planning to buy agricultural inputs to sustain and develop her business with the loan.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a 30 year old man. He lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Hisham owns a van that is used for student transportion. He also owns an aluminum workshop. This is the first time he has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. With the loan, he is planning to do work on his house. He will use his business profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: To do work on his house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 37 year old man. He has one child. He lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Abbass is a car blacksmith. This is the sixth time he has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. With the loan, he is planning to develop his business by starting to sell cars, in addition to doing his work as a blacksmith.

loans.use: To develop his business by starting to sell cars

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 37 year old woman. She lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Souad sells clothes to earn a living. This is the first time she has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. With the loan, she is planning to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Senija

texts.en: Senija is a 46-year-old woman from the village of Turkovići, near the town of Gračanica. She lives with her son, husband, and her father-in-law. Her husband works in Slovenia. His monthly salary is 1 000 KM (about US$ 825). This is Mirsada's first loan through MCO WWI in the amount of 1200 KM (US$ 975) and she intends to buy one more cow in order to expand their small business by selling milk and milk products.

loans.use: To buy one more cow

loans.name: Sevlija

texts.en: Sevlija was born in 1976 and  she is married. She lives with her husband in a small village near the town of Gračanica.  Her husband works as a builder in a construction firm. His monthly salary is 700 KM (about US$ 575) and he has a full-time job. Sevlija has one cow and she sells milk and milk products. She wants to buy another cow to produce more milk in order to increase monthly income for her household.

loans.use: To buy a second cow

loans.name: Rehema's Faraja A Group

texts.en:
Rehema, age 45, is married with 2 children (ages 19 and 14). She raises chickens for a living and has been doing this since 1998. She works daily from 5:00 AM to 8:00 PM at this job and makes a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

In the past, Rehema has taken 4 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to make cement blocks for construction on her chicken farm and for a tailoring business. Now she hopes for a new loan to continue having the blocks made.

In the picture, Rehema is on the right, wearing red.

loans.use: To continue making cement blocks for her chicken farm

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Artesanas Group

texts.es:
The group is composed of 18 hard-working women from the Cerro Real neighborhood of the city of Caacupé. They are currently in the 18th cycle of the Enterprising Women program. They manage an average line of credit of gs. 833,000 per member.

The first meetings of the group took place in the home of Zulma Figuredo. Zulma commented to us that in the beginning it was difficult to organize a meeting where all the members could be present, since they all work and it was complicated to find a schedule that was convenient for everyone. Notwithstanding, the first meeting was held on a weekend and all of them demonstrated great interest in the program. They were able to manage their time so they would be able to meet on weekends and to solidify the final details so as to form what is known as “Mujeres Eprendadoras Artesanas” (Enterprising Women Artisans).

This is one of the oldest loan groups, in addition to being one with the most additional projects completed so as to increase their savings and, of course, the idea is to always maintain a savings fund for exceptional cases in which the members might need it, for example unforeseen health problems or other disasters.

The loans they receive will be invested in the purchase of products for making chipás (a food typical of Paraguay), such as manioc starch, cooking oil, and cheese. It will also be used to buy merchandise for small grocery stores, such as yerba (an herb used to make a kind of tea), sugar, soft drinks, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 18 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Cerro Real de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo se encuentra actualmente en el 8vo. Ciclo del programa Mujeres Emprendedoras, y a la fecha todas manejan una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 833.000 por cada integrante.

Las primeras reuniones del comité se realizaron en el domicilio de la señora Zulma F., Zulma nos comentó que en principio fue un poco difícil concertar una reunión en donde todas las integrantes estuviesen presentes ya que todas trabajan y fue complicado encontrar un horario que les convenga a todas, pero no obstante la primera reunión se realizó un fin de semana y todas demostraron un gran interés por el programa, tal es así que administraron su tiempo para reunirse entre semana y concretar los últimos detalles para que se forme el comité al que llamaron “ Mujeres Emprendedoras Artesanas”

Este comité es uno de los más antiguos, además de ser uno de los que más actividades adicionales realizan con el objetivo de fortificar sus ahorros y por supuesto, la idea también es la de mantener siempre un ahorro extra para casos excepcionales en que las integrantes necesiten, como por ejemplo imprevistos de salud o siniestros.

Los préstamos que reciban serán invertidos en la compra de productos para la elaboración de chipas (comida típica de Paraguay) como ser almidón, aceite, queso, como así también para la compra de mercaderías para despensa como yerba, azúcar, gaseosas entre otros productos

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise such as manioc starch, vegetable oil, cheese, sugar, yerba (an herb used to make a kind of tea), milk, cookies, beef, soft drinks, beers, beverages of all types. It will also be used to buy clothing for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy jeans, sweaters, active wear, sports shoes, coats, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
V. started a business in order to increase her family’s income because her six children are all grown and have their own lives. She currently has stomach cancer and, even though her children and husband work, the treatment is very expensive, which is why she became determined to start her own business. She began two years ago and, because she has always been an enterprising person and likes sales, she decided to open a general store. Little by little she has made it grow and has generated an income from it.

She is requesting a loan for $500, which she plans to repay in six months, to continue to expand her business and thereby increase her sales and income. With your help V. will be able to continue her treatment.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

V. inició el negocio para incrementar los ingresos familiares debido a que sus 6 hijos ya son adultos y tienen su vida hecha, actualmente ella se encuentra enferma de cáncer en el estomago y aunque sus hijos y esposo trabajan, es muy costoso el tratamiento por lo que resolvió iniciar su propio negocio. Comenzó hace 2 años ella siempre ha sido una persona emprendedora y tiene el gusto por las ventas, por lo que decidió abrir una miscelánea, poco a poco ha podido hacerla crecer y ha conseguido ingresos con ella.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para seguir ampliando su negocio y de esta manera poder incrementar las ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Con tu apoyo V. podrá continuara con su tratamiento.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam has a small mill where she prepares chocolate and sells it in the city of La Paz and El Alto. She works with a salesperson and she makes the production alone and when she has a lot of work she hires an employee to help her with the production. Her house is located in the San Sebastian area of the city of La Paz. This is the second time that she has requested a loan with Kiva and IMPRO. Her record qualifies her as “Client 1” meaning she pays in time. The requested loan will be used to buy production supplies – powdered milk, brown sugar, boxes and bags - and this way she will be able to increase her production. Her work, responsibility and experience in the business give her the opportunity to gain access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Miriam tiene un pequeño molino donde elabora chocolate y lo vende en la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto. Trabaja con un vendedor y la producción la realiza ella sola y cuando tiene mucho trabajo contrata a un empleado por producción. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de San Sebastian de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Kiva y en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago se su obligación. El crédito que solicita será utilizado para Compra de insumos – leche en polvo, azucar morena, cajas y bolsas - y así poder incrementar su producción. Su trabajo, responsabilidad y experiencia en el negocio le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Buy production supplies for the production of chocolate ( powdered milk, brown sugar, boxes and bags ).

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas De Almada Group

texts.es:
The group is composed of 20 hard-working women from the A. neighborhood of the city of Caacupé. The group is currently in the 5th cycle of the Enterprising Women program. A large number of the participants are recycling artisans—they transform car tires into items such as planters, flip flops, mats, and vases, among others.

The group is composed of 20 hard-working women from the A. neighborhood of the city of Caacupé. The group is currently in the 5th cycle of the Enterprising Women program. A large number of the participants are recycling artisans—they transform car tires into items such as planters, flip flops, mats, and vases, among others.

Others have traditional small grocery stores where people can buy food and household products, such as: meats, canned goods, rice, flour, sugar, and cleaning products, among others. Last, but not least, are the women who are street vendors who sell clothing and accessories for women, and others who sell cheese and manioc starch exclusively.

Their products are exhibited next to the main road that links Caacupé to the city of Tobatí and visitors like them very much. The group has participated in various fairs held in the city of Tobatí and their products were well liked by the tourists, who marveled at the ingenuity and delicate work of the artisans. This brought about good sales for their products.

The 20 women are managing an average line of credit of gs. 750,000 each. The group was created thanks to the services offered by the Fundación Paraguaya through Freddy Bordón, who is the advisor for the women’s groups in the Caacupé office. This is how he was able to bring together all the artisans of the neighborhood and form the group that bears the name “Mujeres Progresistas de A.” (Progressive Women of A.).

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 20 señoras trabajadoras del barrio A. de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo esta actualmente en el 5to. Ciclo del programa Mujeres Emprendedoras, gran parte de las integrantes son artesanas recicladores y su trabajo lo realizan en la transformación de la cubierta de vehículos en objetos como, planteras (macetas), zapatillas (fit flops), alfombras, floreros, entre otros.

Otras poseen tradicionales despensas en donde la gente puede ir a comprar comestibles o insumos para el hogar como: carnes, productos enlatados, arroz, harina, azúcar, productos de limpieza, entre otros. Por último están señoras que realizan ventas ambulantes de diferentes mercaderías como ropas y accesorios para damas y otras que se dedican a la venta exclusiva de queso y almidón.

Sus productos son exhibidos al costado de la ruta principal que une Caacupé con la ciudad de Tobatí y la misma son muy apreciadas por los visitantes.El grupo como comité ha participado en varias exposiciones realizadas en la ciudad de Tobatí y sus trabajos fueron apreciados por turistas que quedaron maravillados por el ingenio y el trabajo delicado de las artesanas, esto trajo consigo un buen movimiento de ventas de sus productos.

Las 20 señoras están manejando una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 750.000 por cada integrante, este comité fue creado gracias a la promoción de los servicios que ofrece la Fundación Paraguaya por intermedio de Freddy Bordón quién es el asesor de comités de mujeres en la oficina de Caacupé y fue así como se logró juntar a todas las artesanas del barrio, formando el grupo que lleva por nombre “Mujeres Progresistas de A.”

loans.use: To buy tire automobile tire inner tubes for recycling and merchandise such as: sugar, yerba (an herb used to make a kind of tea), milk, cookies, manioc starch, and beef. It will also be used to buy women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Lisbith

texts.es:
Mrs. Lisbith R. Solso is a partner of the Communal Bank “Sarita Colonia”. She lives in the San Martín region and Mariscal Cáceres province, in the Juanjui district. She sells new and used clothes in her home and nearby communities, where the residents like this style of clothing.

With a loan of 1,000.00 soles, she’ll buy new styles of clothing for men, women, and children, in different sizes, to be shipped from Lima. She will pay back the loan in 6 months. Lisbith is an enthusiastic and persevering woman who is sure of herself. She lives with her husband and children, who motivate her to work hard. She dreams of one day having a well-stocked store, and expanding into grocery products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Lisbith R. S. ,es socia del Banco Comunal “ Sarita Colonia ” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui su negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada esta ubicada en su propia casa en el Jr .José María Aguirre , desde donde se desplaza a las comunidades cercanas a vender sus productos a los moradores que gustan de este tipo de prendas de vestir. Con el crédito recibido de S/.1000.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará prendas de vestir nuevas y usadas para damas caballeros y niños en diferentes tallas y modelos los mismos que vienen en fardos, que lo envían desde la ciudad de Lima. Lisbith es una mujer entusiasta y perseverante , segura de si misma vive con su esposo e hijos, quienes son su principal motor para seguir adelante, sueña con tener una tienda bien abastecida, además va ha implementarla con productos de abarrotes .

loans.use: With a loan Lisbith will buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Maria  Yolanda

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Yolanda M. I. belongs to the Communal Bank “Sarita Colonia”. She lives in the Mariscal Cáceres province of San Martín, in the Juanjui district. She started her business in the parking lot of Juanjui-Tarapoto and serves people coming from the interior of the province. Maria’s clientèle is fluid but her continued sales are assured by her clean store and good treatment of her customers.

When Maria separated from her spouse and found herself facing the world with just her children, she decided to set up a business selling traditional food so that her family could get ahead. With a loan of 1,000.00 soles, Maria will buy cooking supplies such as: rice, sugar, soups, vegetables of all varieties, ground beef, chicken, pork, and fish. She’ll use these supplies to prepare a variety of food so that she can pay back the loan in 6 months.

Maria is a young woman of 40, enthusiastic and persevering. She’d like a better future for her children and dreams of building her own house with rooms that she can rent out in order to ensure a future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Maria Yolanda M. I. pertenece al Banco Comunal.” Sarita Colonia”, vive en la Región San Martín , Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui, desarrolla su negocio en un puesto ubicado en el paradero de autos Juanjui – Tarapoto que realiza servicio a los pueblos del interior de la provincia, por la que la clientela es bastante fluida y sus ventas están aseguradas por el buen trato e higiene de su negocio. Al separase de su esposo y al verse sola enfrentándose a la vida con sus hijos decidió iniciar con este tipo de negocio venta de comida tipo menú, para así sacar adelante a su familia Con el crédito de S/ 1000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, le servirá para adquirir los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como: arroz, azúcar, menestras al por mayor, verduras en todas sus variedades por kilos, carnes de res, pollo, cerdo y pescado también en kilos, que le permitirá preparar comida variada para atender a sus clientes. Maria es una mujer joven de 40 años, entusiasta y perseverante quiere un futuro mejor para sus hijos por lo que sueña con construir su propia casa y tener cuartos para ser alquilados y asegurándolos así un porvenir .

loans.use: Con el prestamo comprara mas insumos para la preparacion de sus alimentos

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza Rodríguez T. belongs to the Communal Bank “Ayaymaman”. She lives in the San Martín region and province of Moyobamba, in the Moyabamba district. Maritza sells candy made out of peanuts and sugarcane that she makes herself. She started the candy business in her house, and sells the candies in the main streets and markets of Moyabamba. Maritza has wanted to work this business since she was a child, because her whole family makes and sells sweets. Because of this, it was an easy business for her to start.

With a loan of 1,700.00 soles, she’ll buy the supplies necessary to make the peanut candies, marzipan, and chocolates. These include 50 kilo bags of peanuts and plastic bags to wrap the sweets in. Maritza will repay the loan in six months.

Maritza is 38 years old, and has two older children and two young children. Her husband supports her candy business and she’s very well known. She has a good clientele because her products are high quality and she’s always friendly.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Marizta R. T. pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Ayaymaman”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Moyobamba y distrito de Moyabamba, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces confitados a base de maní y chancaca (azúcar natural de de caña) negocio que lo desarrolla en su propia casa, para luego venderlos por las principales calles y paraderos de carros de la ciudad de Moyabamba. Desde muy pequeña estuvo ligada a este tipo de negocio ya que toda su familia se dicha a la elaboración y venta de estos dulces, por lo que a ella no le fue difícil desarrollar este trabajo. Con el crédito de S/. 1700.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses comprará los insumos necesarios para la preparación de confinados de maní, alfeñiques y turrones como: chancaca en atados, maní en quintales (bolsas de 50 kilos) y bolsas plásticas para el embasado de estos productos. Tiene 38 años, 2 hijos mayores y 2 dos pequeños, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, es muy conocida y tiene una buena clientela por la calidad de sus productos y la amabilidad que brinda al vender.

loans.use: With a loan she'll buy more inputs to make her products

loans.name: Marli

texts.es:
Mrs. Marli N. T. is a partner of the Communal Bank “The Great Pajaten”. She lives in San Martín, a province of Mariscal Cáceres in the Juanjui district. Mrs. Marli sells beef jerkey, sausage, pork rinds, and other products at her stall in the Juanjui market. She started the business 16 years ago, and now it is well known for its high quality products. Mrs. Marli’s reputation has earned her a good clientele.

With a loan of 3,000.00 soles she’ll buy: live pigs to be sacrificed, processed, and converted into dry meat and stuffed sausages. The pork products will serve as inputs into typical dishes of the San Martín region. She will repay the loan in six months. Mrs. Marli is 55 years old and lives with her son. She likes to work because it keeps her active and allows her to have a peaceful lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora MarlI N. T. es socia del Banco Comunal . “El Gran Pajaten“ , vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres , distrito de Juanjui, se dedica a la venta de cecina, chorizo, chicharrón y sus derivados en su puesto del mercado central de la ciudad de Juanjui. Hace 16 años que se inicio en este negocio, hoy es muy conocida por brindar productos de muy buena calidad, lo que le ha servido para ganarse una buena clientela. Con el crédito de S/.3000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: cerdos vivos para ser sacrificados, procesados y convertirlos en carne seca y embutidos, y servir de insumos para la preparación de estos platos típicos de la región. San Martín. La señora Marlith tiene 55 años, vive con uno de sus hijos, le gusta el trabajo que hace y desea continuar en el, porque le mantiene en actividad y le permite vivir con tranquilidad.

loans.use: With a loan, she'll buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Nora Isabel

texts.es:
Mrs. Nora Isabel R. D. S. is a partner in the Communal Bank “Ayaymaman”. She lives in the province of Moyabama in the state of San Martín. Nora sells vegetables and other groceries in the “Ayamaman” market in the city of Mayabamba.

With help from her father, who has experience buying and selling products, she decided to help her husband make rent by moving her business into their home. With a loan of 1700.00 soles she’ll buy a wiD. range of groceries to offer her clients, such as: 50kg bags of rice, sugar, a variety of soups, grains like corn and coffee and vegetables like potatoes, onions, tomatoes, avocados, bags of cabbages, and bunches of plantains. Nora will repay the loan in 6 months.

Nora is 44 years old and has 4 children, 2 of whom are still small. She has always been optimistic and a fighter. She yearns to have a store in her home, in order to be closer to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Nora Isabel R. D. S., es socia del Banco Comunal “Ayaymaman” vive en el del distrito y provincia D. Moyabamba , departamento D. San Martín, se dedica a la venta D. verduras y abarrotes en general, su puesto D. ventas se ubica en el mercado “Ayaymaman” D. la ciudad D. Moyabamba. Apoyada por su papa quien tenia experiencia en la compra y venta D. productos decidió poner su negocio en su propia casa para así poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Con el crédito D. S/. 1700.00, para ser pagado en 6 meses, comprará, diversos abarrotes como: sacos D. 50 kg D. arroz, azúcar, menestras D. diversos variedades, granos como maíz, café y verduras como papas, cebollas, tomates, paltas, repollos en sacos y plátanos en racimos, para tener surtido sus productos y ofrecer a su clientela. Tiene 44 años, 4 hijos, 2 D. ellos aun pequeños, se muestra siempre como una persona optimista y luchadora, anhela instalar en su propia casa un Cafetín y así estar mas cerca D. su familia.

loans.use: Purchase more wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Esterfila

texts.es:
Señora Esterfilia C. G. belongs to the communal bank called 'Ayaymaman'. She lives in the region of San Martin, Moyobamba. Her food stand is located in Jr. Serafin at the local supermarket called 'Erick'. She sells vegetables from the region which are purchase daily by the people in the city.

When she separated from her husband, she decided to open up her own business which took a lot of effort, but she did it anyways to support her children and to offer them a better future. Due to her good customer service, her clientele has grown.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase different types of vegetables in big quantities such as lettuce, tomatoes, onions, potatotoes, sweet potatoes and yuca so that she can have enough to satisfy her clients' demands.

Señora Esterfilia is 58 years old. She's a hard-worker since she works every day non-stop. She accomplishes each goal she has set for herself without any limitations. She's dedicated to what she does and hopes that in the near future she can have her own store from home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esterfilia C. G. ,pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ayaymaman”,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Moyobamba y distrito de Moyabamba, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Serafín en un puesto del mercado “Erick”, se dedica a la venta de verduras de la región y de la costa, que diariamente es comprado por los moradores de la ciudad. Al separarse de su esposo ,decidió iniciar este tipo de negocio con mucho esfuerzo y seguir adelante para el sustento de sus hijos gracias a su buen trato supo ganarse su clientela . Con el crédito de S/.2,500.00,el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversas verduras como: camote, repollo, tomates, cebolla, papa , yucas en sacos, para así tener abastecido su puesto y satisfacer la exigencia de sus clientes. La señora Esterfilia tiene 58 años, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera, que es una mujer emprendedora y que para cumplir sus metas, no hay límites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación, es así que en el futuro piensa tener una tienda de abarrotes, en su casa.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.en:
Maria Dolores R. (44) lives in San Lorenzo in a neighborhood called Cerrito. She is married to Pastor Severiano Vergara (64) and both have 4 children; each one of them works independently.

As the owner of DESPENSA ÑA MARIA, Maria Dolores plans to enlarge her grocery store in order to offer a wider variety of products and attract more customers. The difference between Maria Dolores’s grocery store and the competition is that since she is a lovely person, everyone in the neighborhood knows her and wants to help her. Consequently, they prefer to buy goods from the Despensa Ña Maria instead of others' grocery stores. In rural areas in Paraguay, the Despensas could be considered as a meeting point, where people not only buy products but also gather and gossip. That is why is Despensas are a very profitable business in those areas.

loans.use: to enlarge her grocery store

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David works as driver in public transportation, the motor of his car has a lot of mechanic problems. He needs to buy a new car since it’s his source of revenue which he uses to covers the expenses of his family and his three children who are in a public school. His house is located in the Pasankeri area of the City of La Paz. The loan will be used to change his car to keep on working in the inter-city public transportation industry. This is the fourth credit with IMPRO, the evaluation performed allows the requested loan by David to be approved. David is our client since 2003.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

David trabaja de transportista publico, tiene su movilidad que tiene muchas fallas en el motor y necesita comprar una nueva movilidad ya que es su fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su familia y sus tres hijos que están estudiando en un colegio estatal; su vivienda esta ubicado en la Zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito requiere para cambiar de herramienta de trabajo para continuar trabajando con transporte publico inter-ciudad. Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por David. David es cliente nuestro desde el año 2003.

loans.use: Buy a new car to keep on working in public transportation.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Señora Maritza P. D. Ramírez is a member of the communal bank called 'El Gran Pajaten'. She lives in San Martin, Juanjui. Her store is located in Puerto Amberes where she sells groceries and school supplies.

With the support of her husband and her children and her perseverance and dedication, her store is a success. When she first started, she only had a few things to sell but now she has a wiD. variety of products to sell.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, detergent, body soaps, cleaning supplies, refreshments, snacks among others so that she's able to fulfill her customers' high demand.

Señora Maritza is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and one son. They are her main motivation. She hopes to one day be able to plant cacao trees in her land to make chocolate goods to sell and thereby proviD. another source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Maritza P. D. Ramírez, es socia del Banco Comunal. “El Gran Pajaten “ , vive en la región D. San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres , distrito D. Juanjui, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Prolongación Dos D. Mayo - Puerto Amberes , y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y útiles escolares. Con el apoyo D. su esposo y sus hijos, la constancia y dedicación propia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente, ya que cuando se inicio solo tenia un andamio casi vació, ahora oferta variedad d productos. Con el crédito D. S/.1300.00 el cual será pagodo en 6 meses, comprará: arroz, azúcar en bolsas , leche, aceite, en cajas, detergentes, jabones y útiles D. limpieza en general, gaseosas, golosinas diversas, entre otros, para surtir su negocio y cubrir las expectativas D. sus clientes. La señora Maritza tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo, quienes la impulsan a esforzarse cada día más a lograr cumplir con sus metas trazadas, desea para el futuro sembrar en su chacra cacao para la elaboración D. chocolates ya que sería otro ingreso para su hogar .

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Señorita Elizabeth C. Rojas is a member of the communal bank called 'Ayaymaman'. She lives in San Martin in the district of Moyabamba. She sells groceries such as bread, snacks, refreshments, etc. Her store is located in her house where the neighbors go to buy their groceries on a daily basis.

She studied accounting and with her mother's guidance she decided to get involved in the business world so that she can make her own money.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase basic food supply such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, bread, canned food, detergent, toilet paper among other things so that she can fulfill her clients' orders.

She's 24 years old and single. This business is to help her mom with the bills. She would eventually like to open up a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Elizabeth C. Rojas,es una socia del Banco Comunal “Ayaymaman”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Moyobamba, distrito de Moyabamba, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, panes, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, en su bodega ubicada en su propia casa A.v. Graú Nº 535 , donde acuden diariamente a comprar los vecinos del barrio. Estudió contabilidad y con la orientación de su mamá decide ingresar al mundo del negocio que es otra fuente para su ingreso económico. Con el préstamo de S/. 1700.00 que pagará en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, conservas, panes , detergentes y papel higiénico entre otros, para así poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Tiene 24 años es soltera pero su decisión hacia el negocio fue para ayudar a su mamá en lo económico, su meta en el futuro es tener un restaurante

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Lloily

texts.es:
Señorita Lloily D. R. belongs to the communal bank called "Ayaymaman'. She lives in the region of San Martin in Moyabamba. She sells candy made out of sugar cane and peanuts. She works from home. She sells her candy in different stores throughout the city.

She decided to follow the family tradition. Her mother also makes candy which is a familiar trade in this area. She only does this part-time since she goes to school to become a high-school teacher.

Wth this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase basic ingredients such as peanuts, sugar and plastic bags for packaging.

Llloily is a young woman full of goals and dreams. She dreams to one day industrialize this business and sell this type of candy throughout the country.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita LLoily D. Rodríguez pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Ayaymaman”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Moyobamba y distrito de Moyobamba, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces confitados a base de maní y chancaca (azúcar natural de de caña) negocio que lo desarrolla en su propia casa, para luego ser distribuidos a las principales bodegas de la comunidad y otras provincias del departamento. Decidió iniciar su negocio por tradición familiar ,su mamá también se dedica a este tipo de actividad muy propio de la zona, comparte su tiempo estudiando en la universidad para ser profesora de educación secundaria. Con el crédito de S/. 2000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses comprará los insumos necesarios para la preparación de confinados de maní, alfeñiques y turrones como: chancaca en atados, maní en quintales (bolsas de 50 kilos) y bolsas plásticas para el embasado de estos productos. Llloily, es una mujer muy joven llena de ilusiones y metas por lo que sueña convertir este negocio en una industria y así poder comercializar sus productos con otras regiones del país.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to make candy

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46207

loans.name: Herbert

texts.es:
Hebert works with his sister and has a shop of sweets and cereals that they both commercialize wholesale. This activity is the source of income that covers the expenses of his mother and brother. His house is located in the Villa Bolivar "D" area of the City of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for the shop (sweets, cereals, refreshments, etc.). This is the fifth credit with IMPRO and the evaluation performed allows the requested loan to be approved. Herbert is been an IMPRO’s client since 2002.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hebert trabaja con su hermana y tiene una tienda de golosinas y cereales que comercializan al por mayor, siendo estas actividades su fuente de ingresos con las que cubre la manutención de su madre y hermano; su vivienda esta ubicada en la Zona de Villa Bolivar “D” de la Ciudad de El Alto.
