El crédito requiere para comprar mercadería para la tienda (dulces, cereales, refrescos, etc.). Es el quinto crédito con IMPRO y la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado. Herbert es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for his grocery store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Isabel F. R. belongs to the communal bank called "Ayaymaman'. She lives in the region of San Martin in Moyabamba. She sells candy made out of sugar cane and peanuts. She works from home. She sells her candy in different stores throughout the city and they have become very popular.

She studied to become a nurse technician, but she was never able to do it since she got married and had a family. Her mother-in-law taught her how to make this type of candy and she's been making it for the past 3 years. She's had a lot of success by doing this.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase basic ingredients such as peanuts, sugar and plastic bags for packaging.

Isabel is 24 years old with 2 small children. She's a very responsible and independent woman. She's very happy with what she's doing. She has the support of her husband. She's very well-known in the area, and she also has a big clientele due to her good customer service and high quality products. She would like to one day be able to expand her business to other areas in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Isabel F. R. pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Ayaymaman vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de Moyabamba y distrito de Moyabamba, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces confitados a base de maní y chancaca (azúcar natural de de caña) negocio que lo desarrolla en su propia casa, sus productos lo distribuye en las bodegas de los distintos barrios de la ciudad y son muy solicitados por sus clientes. Es enfermera técnica de profesión, pero nunca lo ejerció, al casarse y buscando el bienestar económico de su familia, con el apoyo de su suegra quien le enseño la elaboración de estos productos a base de azúcar decidió dedicarse a este negocio hace 3 años con mucho éxito. Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1500.00 , el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará los insumos necesarios para la preparación de confinados de maní, alfeñiques y turrones como: chancaca en atados, maní en quintales (bolsas de 50 kilos) y bolsas plásticas para el embasado de estos productos. Isabel tiene 24 años, 2 hijitos pequeños, es una mujer responsable y capaz de tomar sus propias decisiones, esta contenta con lo que hace, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, es muy conocida y tiene una buena clientela por la calidad de sus productos y la amabilidad que brinda al vender, desea ampliar su negocio a otras provincias de la región.

loans.use: to purchase basic ingredients to make candy

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos P. Dure (58) is married to Adelina Escobar (50). The couple lives in Bertoni - San Estanislao and they work as partners. While Amos sells, house by house, natural medicines and other products such as thread, elastic bands and buttons, Adelina stays at the grocery store they have in their house. Both have been in this business since 2000. They are characterized as being very hardworking people and good partners who always help each other in difficult situations. They want to take out a loan in order to buy more products and hence to satisfy the huge demand they have.

loans.use: Purchase of products such sugar, flour, pasta, soda, natural medicine, eggs, meat, bread, etc.

loans.name: Bethy

texts.es:
Señora Betty D. Castillo D. T. is a member of the communal bank called 'Ayahmaman' located in the district of Moyobamba in San Martin. She sells delicious different types of soups from door to door and also at the local supermarket located in Moyobamba.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase beans in huge quantities in all different varieties in the region. She will also purchase vegetables that she will add to her soups to offer to her daily clients.

Betty is 55 years old. She loves her children and takes good care of them. She works to offer them a better life. She hopes to one day offer internet access (booths) and to sell ice-cream from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Betty D. Castillo D. T., es socia D. Banco Comunal “Ayaymaman”, ubicado en la provincia y distrito D. Moyobamba, departamento D. San Martín, se dedica a la venta D. menestras cocinadas en sus diferente variedades las mismos que ofrece en su puesto D. ventas ubicado en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Moyabamba. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará menestras en sacos tanto los que se producen en la región D. la selva como: fréjol huasca, Chiclayo, y lo que se produce en la región D. la costa y sierra como: fréjol canario, caballero, alverjas, pallares, habas, lentejas, para ofrecer diariamente a su basta clientela. Betty tienes 55 años, es una mujer muy preocupada por sus hijos, trabaja para sacarlos adelante, anhela tener cabinas D. internet y venta D. refrigerios en su casa.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Elsa Teodita

texts.es:
Elsa Teodita V. Saavedtra lives in the department of San Martin, province of Moyabamba, district of Moyobamba. Her business is located in one of the markets of the city called Ayaymaman and she is dedicated to the sale of fruits that are produced in our region of the forest.

The idea for her business arose from the need to move her family forward and to support her husband to improve their income. She joined the "Ayaymaman" Communal bank where they gave her the opportunity to be able to undertake her business for which she is very thankful.

With the loan of 1500 soles which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest it in the purchase of more fruits, such as: bags of oranges, sapotes (a native fruit), pineapples, bunches of bananas, avocados, pears, lemons in hundreds, boxes of papayas and more.

The lady Elsa is 34 years old and has 3 children that, along with her and her husband, are their company; they work together, sharing their lives.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Elsa Teodita V. S. , vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Moyabamba, distrito de Moyobamba, tiene ubicado su negocio en uno de los mercados de la ciudad denominado “Ayaymaman” y se dedica a la venta de frutas que se producen en nuestra región de la selva.

La idea del negocio surgió ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a la familia y apoyar a su esposo para mejorar sus ingresos, ingresa al banco Comunal “Ayaymaman” en donde le dieron la oportunidad de poder emprender su negocio por el que esta muy agradecida.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas, como son: sacos de naranja, sapotes, piñas , racimos de plátanos, paltas, limón en cientos, cajas de papaya y otros;

La señora Elsa tiene 34 años, 03 hijos que están con ella y su esposo quienes son su compañía, trabajan juntos, compartiendo sus vidas .

loans.use: To buy fruits, such as: bags of oranges, sapotes (a native fruit), pineapples, bunches of bananas, avocados, pears, lemons in hundreds, boxes of papayas and more.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio lives on Maria Auxiliadora de Villa Cooperativa street in the city of El Alto. She has a son 2 years of age. Her husband works as a security guard in a commercial store.

She is dedicated to the sale of children’s clothes made of wool, which she markets in the city of El Alto.

The loan is destined for the purchase of merchandise, thus to enlarge her income and to support her husband to obtain a monthly income that meets the family needs.

This is the second loan with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies us to offer her the loan. Rocio has been a client of IMPRO since the year 2006.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Rocio vive en la calle Maria Auxiliadora de Villa Cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto, tiene un hijo de 2 años, su esposo trabaja como personal de seguridad en una tienda comercial

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños confeccionada en lana, la cual comercializa en la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería y así aumentar sus ingresos y colaborar al esposo para obtener unos ingresos mensuales que alcancen para sus necesidades familiares.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito. Rocio es cliente de IMPRO desde al año 2006.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Salicia

texts.es:
The Lady Maria Salicia M. Campo belongs to the " Ayaymaman" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, province of Moyabamba, district of Moyabamba. She developed her business in a stall of the Supply Market of this City where the household members shop daily, both inhabitants of her own locality and visitors from nearby places

Because of the separation from her husband, she has had the courage to proceed alone and to go forward with her children, a beginning that was very difficult. She decided to sell food on foot and, thanks to the support of the communal bank to which she belongs, she was able to install her business in a stall in the Ayaymaman market, thus offering better attention to her clients.

With the loan of 800 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy the necessary accessories for the arrangement of her stall with majolicas (brightly glazed earthenware) and she will buy the supplies for food preparation such as rice, sugar, stew in kilograms, vegetables of all varieties per kilogram, beef, chicken, pork and fish also in kilograms. That will permit her to prepare various foods for the attention of her clients.

Maria is a happy and enthusiastic woman of 54 years. She wants to forge a better future and a tranquil old age when she longs to have a business in her own house.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Maria Salicia M. Campo , pertenece al Banco Comunal ”Ayaymaman”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Moyabamba y distrito de Moyabamba , desarrolla su negocio en un puesto de ventas del Mercado de Abasto de esta Ciudad a donde diariamente acuden su comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o visitante de lugares cercanos

A raíz de la separación de su esposo tuvo la valentía de afrontar sola y sacar adelante a sus hijos, en un inicio le fue muy difícil, decidiendo vender comida en forma ambulatoria y gracias al apoyo del banco comunal a la que pertenece se pudo instalar en el mercado Ayaymaman brindado así una buena atención a sus clientes .

Con el crédito de S/ 800.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará los accesorios necesarios para el arreglo de su puesto de venta con mayólicas y comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como: arroz, azúcar, menestras en kilos, verduras en todas sus variedades por kilos, carnes de res, pollo, cerdo y pescado también en kilos, que le permitirá preparar comida variada atención a sus clientes.

Maria es una mujer entusiasta y alegre con sus 54 años, quiere forjarse un futuro mejor y una vejez tranquila por lo que anhela tener un negocio en su propia casa .

loans.use: To buy the necessary accessories for the arrangement of her stall with majolicas (brightly glazed earthenware) and to buy supplies for food preparation in larger quantities such as rice, sugar, stew, vegetables of all varieties, beef, chicken, pork and fish.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46214

loans.name: Roilith

texts.es:
The Lady Roilith R. T. is an associate of the “Vision2000" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, Province of Pillory, district of San Hilarión. Her second-hand clothes sale business is located in her own house on Jr. José Olaya Street from which she draws from the nearby communities to sell her products to the inhabitants that like this type of articles of clothing.

She lives with her husband and 3 children, who motivate her to improve her work each day and thus to contribute to the income of the family. With the loan received of 1900 Soles which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy articles of used clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children in different sizes and styles that come in bales, that are sent from the city of Lima.

Roilith is an optimistic and happy woman that has learned to take her own decisions. She dreams of having a business buying and selling rice flour that is in strong demand in the area.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Roilith R. T. es socia del Banco Comunal “Vision2000” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda esta ubicada en su propia casa en el Jr. José Olaya S/N desde donde se desplaza a las comunidades cercanas a vender sus productos a los moradores que gustan de este tipo de prendas de vestir.

Vive con su esposo y 03 hijos quienes le motivan a desarrollar su trabajo cada día y así contribuir con los ingresos económicos de la familia.

Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1900.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará prendas de vestir usadas para damas caballeros y niños en diferentes tallas y modelos los mismos que vienen en fardos, que lo envían desde la ciudad de Lima.

Roilith es una mujer alegre y optimista, que ha aprendido a tomar sus propias decisiones, sueña con tener un negocio de compra y venta de polvillo de arroz que tiene muy buena demanda en la zona.

loans.use: To buy used clothing in bales for resale.

loans.name: Marilud

texts.es:
The Lady Marilud P. Izuza is an associate of the "Puerto Rico" Communal Bank. She is dedicated to the business of selling articles of clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children. Her store is located on Jr. Ambrosio Saavedra Street of the district of Puerto Rico, department and province of San Martin. She has been developing this business for 3 years.

The loan of 1000 soles that will be repaid in 6 months, will be invested in the purchase of dresses, polos and pants for girls and children and pants, jeans and polos of different marks for ladies and gentlemen. To supply her business she tries to satisfy her clients in all their inclinations and to be always up to date with the fashion.

She is 29 years of age and has a son. She is known for being genteel and very attentive with her clients, being concerned herself with advancing her family and being an example for her son.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Marilud P. Izuza es socia del Banco Comunal “Puerto Rico”, se dedica al negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. Su tienda se encuentra ubicada en el Jr. Ambrosio Saavedra S/N del distrito de Puerto Rico, departamento y `provincia de San Martín tiene desarrolla este negocio hace 03 años.

El préstamo de 1000.00, que será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de vestidos, polos, pantalones para niñas y niños, pantalones jean y polos de diferentes marcas para damas y caballeros. Para surtir su negocio busca satisfacer a sus clientes en todos sus gustos y estar siempre actualizada con la moda.

Ella tiene 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Se caracteriza por ser gentil y muy atenta con sus clientes, se preocupada por sacar adelante a su familia y por ser un ejemplo para su hijo.

loans.use: To buy dresses, polos and pants for girls and children and pants, jeans and polos of different marks for ladies and gentlemen for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Blas

texts.en:
Blas Rene I. Benitez is a young man who at 18 years old has his own business. Taking advantage of the increasing demand for electronic devices, Blas decided to rent a place where he could sell different electronic products including cell phones, MP3s, and pen drives. Blas want to take out a loan in order to buy electronic devices, to amplify the variety and the number of products he offers.

In the future Blas plans to buy a property to establish his store. Blas's incentive is the desire for a brighter future.

loans.use: Purchase electronic devices

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
The Lady Mariela G. J. is an associate of the “Dynamic Women” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Picota. She is dedicated to the business of selling articles of clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children, as well as underwear. Her store is found located on the Av. Grau Nº 551 of the district of Picota. She has had this business for 7 years.

With the loan of 2500 soles that will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of underwear by the dozens for girls, jeans of different marks for ladies, gentlemen, children and girls, sports polos for gentlemen, sports blouses for ladies, and dress pants for children and adults. To supply her business she tries to satisfy her clients in all their inclinations and to be always up to date with the fashion.

She is 38 years of age and is a native of Piura. She has 3 children who, along with her husband, are dedicated to this business. She is known for being genteel and very attentive with her clients. She is concerned with moving her family ahead and being an example for her children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Mariela G. J., es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Dinamicas” vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota, se dedica al negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, así como ropas interiores. Su tienda se encuentra ubicada en la Av. Grau Nº 551 del distrito de Picota. Tiene este negocio hace 07 años.

Con el préstamo de S/.2500.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropas interiores por docenas, para niñas pantalones Jean de diferentes marcas para damas , caballeros, niños y niñas , polos deportivos para caballeros, blusas sport para damas , pantalones de vestir para niños y adultos Para surtir su negocio busca satisfacer a sus clientes en todos sus gustos y estar siempre actualizada con la moda.

Ella tiene 38 años de edad, es natural de Piura , tiene 03 hijos y juntos con su esposo se dedican a este negocio. Se caracteriza por ser gentil y muy atenta con sus clientes. Preocupada por sacar adelante a su familia y por ser un ejemplo para sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy underwear forr girls,  jeans of different marks for ladies, gentlemen, children and girls, sports polos for gentlemen, sports blouses for ladies, and dress pants for children and adults for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Cori Sandra

texts.es:
The lady Cori belongs to “Las Shipibas” Communal Bank, located on Jr. Calleria 445 of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 20 years old and a single woman. With the first loan of 300 soles received from Manuela Branches Cori decided to invest in a small store of hair colors.

Currently her business has grown. She rises very early to attend her business. With the cordial and kind treatment that she gives her clients, they remain very satisfied.

With this loan of 800 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy colors of different brands, shampoos, creams, cosmetics, etc.

Cori is a very enterprising young woman. With her loans she is paying for her studies and capitalizing on her business in order to be able to continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Cori pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr. Calleria 445, D. Distrito de Calleria D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 20 años, es soltera. Cori con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña tienda de tintes para el pelo.

En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido, se levanta muy temprano para atender su negocio, con el trato amable y cordial que da sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará tintes de diferentes marcas, champús, cremas, cosméticos, etc.

Cori es una joven muy emprendedora, con sus prestamos esta pagando sus estudios, y capitalizándose en su negocio para así poder seguir progresando.

loans.use: To buy hair colors, cosmetics, creams, shampoo, etc for her business.

loans.name: Bella Judith

texts.es:
The lady Bella belongs to “Las Shipibas” Communal Bank located on Jr. Guillermo Skylights Mz. 189 Lt. 10 of the District of Yarina Cocha of the Department of Ucayali. She is 38 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a machine operator, but the income that he has does not meet their daily needs, so Bella decided to invest in a food sales business with the first loan of 300 soles received from Manuela Branches.

Currently Bella is dedicated to domestic work and the preparation of her foods in the mornings. In the afternoon she leaves to sell her foods in the different zones of our city and at night she rests for the next day’s work.

With this loan of 1,800 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: 1 bag of rice, meats, sugar, vegetables, seasonings, oil, salt, eggs, carbonated water, etc.

Bella says that the loans are a big help, because they permit her to grow her business and to give a better education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bella pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo Lumbreras Mz. 189 Lt.10, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es operador de maquinas, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Bella con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad Bella por las mañanas se dedica a las labores domesticas y preparación de sus comidas, en las tardes sale a vender sus comidas en las diferentes zonas de nuestra cuidad, y por las noches descansa para la jornada del día siguiente.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, carnes, azúcar, verduras, condimentos, aceite, sal, huevos, gaseosas, etc.

Bella dice que los prestamos son una buena ayuda, porque le permiten crecer en su negocio y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy rice, meats, sugar, vegetables, seasonings, oil, salt, eggs, carbonated water, etc.  for the preparation of foods for sale.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis Giménez is a 34 year old man from Santani, married to Mercedes Servin (33), and father of two children. Denis is the owner of a store located in a market known as “Mercado Municipal de la ciudad de San Estanislao”. He sells cell phones and cell phone accessories.

According to his clients, what makes Denis’ business different form others are the low prices he offers.

The credit requested will be used to buy more cell phones to further sales.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Señora Alicia belongs to the communal bank located in Calleria, Ucayali. She's 38 years old with 3 children. She's married and her husband is an accountant, but his salary doesn't cover the daily family expenses. With the first loan Alicia obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small convenience store.

She opens up her store about 8:00 in the morning while she also does house chores. Her store offers a lot of products to sell. Her children help her run the store. They are very happy and proud of their mother's accomplishments.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase more merchandise such as rice, sugar, bread, milk, detergent, body soap and shampoo, etc.

Alicia feels that she's very stable financially. She can now help with the expenses, fix her house and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Alicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalinas 2, ubicado en el Jr. Roca Fuerte 238, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años es madre de 3 hijos, es casada, su esposo es contador pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Alicia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad atiende su bodega a partir de las 8 am, y la comparte con las tareas domesticas, su negocio esta mas surtido, vende diferentes productos, sus hijos la ayudan y están contentos con los logros de su madre. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará abarrotes como: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, panes, leche, detergente, jabón, champú, etc. Alicia se siente mas estable económicamente, ahora puede aportar a su hogar, arreglar su casa, y ampliar mas su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Jenny Estela

texts.es:
Señora Jenny belongs to the communal bank located in Calleria in Ucayali. She's 49 years old with 5 children. She's a widow. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to buy food ingredients to sell food dishes.

In the morning, she does all the house chores and cooks all the meals she will later sell. Her children support her in everything. She's very happy with her business because she can socialize with all kinds of people and make friends.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase rice, meat, sugar, vegetables, condiments, cooking oil, salt, eggs and local meat, etc.

Jenny is very happy because everything is going well with her business. She always pays her loan on time. She feels more independent than ever.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jenny pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalinas 2, ubicado en la Av. Centenario 142, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años es madre de 5 hijos, es viuda. Jenny con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comida. En la actualidad Jenny por las mañanas se dedica a las labores domesticas y preparación de sus comidas, sus hijos la apoyan en todo, ella se siente muy contenta con su negocio por que le permite poder conversar con la gente y hacer muchas amistades. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará, 1 saco de arroz, carnes, azúcar, verduras, condimentos, aceite, sal, huevos, carne regional, etc. Jenny esta muy tranquila ahora por que todo le esta yendo bien con su negocio, es muy puntual en sus pagos, y ahora se siente mas independiente que nunca.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make delicious dishes to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria carries out her activities each day more animated and with more optimism now that she is experiencing the fruits of her constant labor. She dedicates herself to the fattening and trade of cattle and takes advantage of the lands around the stable Everyday she wakes up very early to feed the bulls and cows and she has decided in agreement with her husband to better the breed of her animals by buying a purebred..

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregoria acude a realizar sus actividades cada día más animada y con mucho optimismo ya que está, observando los frutos de su constante esfuerzo. Ella se dedica al engorde y comercio de ganado vacuno y así aprovecha la dicha de poseer tierras de cultivo ya que estas posibilitan la continuidad de su establo.Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para alimentar a sus toros y vacas y ha decidido en común acuerdo con su esposo mejorar la raza de sus pequeños inquilinos comprando un ejemplar de pura raza.

loans.use: To purchase a purebred bull.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene works hard daily to take care of her family and she decided to obtain small animals, for awhile she has been involved in raising bulls and cows and she has established her own modest stable. She desires to acquire a cow to increase her production of milk and therefore her income and wellbeing of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Irene, se esfuerza a diario para lograr el sustento diario D. su familia y decidió obtenerlos a través D. la crianza D. pequeños animalitos, hace mucho también decidió incursionar en la crianza D. toros y vacas y poco a poco estableció su pequeño y modesto establo.Desea adquirir una vaquita más para incrementar su producción D. leche y con ella sus ganacias y bienestar D. su familia.

loans.use: To purchase a little cow.

loans.name: Erma Irene

texts.es:
Erma is a member of the La Dalinas 2 Communal Bank, which is located in Alana Sisley Mz. H Lt. 9 in the district of Yarina Cocha. She is 41 years old and is the mother of 4 children. She is divorced. With her first loan of S. 300 from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sale of food.

Now Erma sells soda pops, jello and ice. In mornings she prepares the products that she will sell; in the afternoons she gets ready to go out and sell; in the evening she sells her food. She has many clients because of the good attention she pays them.

With this loan of S. 1,500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will expand her business with the purchase of a cart and ingredients for her popsicles and the meals she sells.

Erma is very happy, as her quality of life has improved thanks to the loans she receives from her communal bank, with the support of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Erma pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalinas 2, ubicado en la Asentamiento. Humano. Alana Sisley Mz. H Lt. 2, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años es madre de 4 hijos, es separada. Erma con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comida. En la actualidad Erma vende chupetes gaseosas, gelatinas, hielo y por las noches su comida, en las mañana se dedica a la preparación de sus productos que venderá y en las tardes se alista para salir a vender, goza de mucha de mucha clientela por la buena atención que les da a sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la ampliación de su negocio con la compra de un carrito salchipapero, y comprará insumos para sus chupetes y víveres para sus comidas. Erma esta muy contenta, su calidad de vida mejoro gracias a los préstamos que recibe de su banco comunal, con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is an enterprising mother who specializes is making blankets and decorations typical of her region. Elena also operates a radio station with her children, who inspired their parents to undertake this project. It was also because of their children’s studies in systems that they were able to begin broadcasting a program called “Radio Top 40”. The program is heard throughout the town thanks to the agreements they have secured with the town government and cooperative. The station reaches far and wiD. thanks to Internet and the efforts of the 14 young people who work tirelessly to broadcast, day in and day out, the programs requested by listeners.

Elena and her family would like to establish a television station from which they will be able to report the news in their community and city. The station also will help spread the word about the community’s artisanal products.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

ELENA, es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la producción D. mantas y diversos tipos D. adornos típicos D. la zona, además D. dedicarse a esta labor, tiene una emisión radial en la cual trabaja asociada con sus hijos quienes son los que motivaron a sus padres a iniciar este gran proyecto y gracias a los estudios D. sistemas D. sus hijos es que pudieron implementar lo necesario para la trasmisión D. “La Radio TOP 40”, que es escuchada en toda su localidad gracias a los convenios que han logrado adquirir con la municipalidad y la cooperativa D. su comunidad. Esta emisora es trasmitida con gran cobertura gracias a Internet y a los 14 jóvenes quienes trabajan arduamente para trasmitir día a día los programas solicitados por los oyentes.Ahora Elena y su familia desean instalar un canal televisivo desD. donD. ellos podrán informar los acontecimientos D. su comunidad y ciudad y también servir D. mecanismo difusor D. las bondades D. sus artesanos.

loans.use: Secure a rental agreement to broadcast a TV program from her community

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)
Correction due to overpayment for business 46227

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia is a member of the Las Dalinas 2 Communal Bank, which is located in Alana Sisley Mz. H Lt. 2 in the district of Yarina Cocha. She is 54 years old and is the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a teacher. With her first loan of S. 300 from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a small bodega.

Now Delicia has been able to make her bodega expand. She sells products she formerly didn't sell and is there all day with the aid of her daughter who tends to the house.

With this loan of S. 800, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy one sack of rice, 1/2 a sack of sugar, milk, bread, soap, detergent, shampoo, bananas, carbon, et cetera.

Delicia is a very hard working woman. Since she was very young she dedicated herself to her work in order to feel more independent. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos because she has supported her and treated her well.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Delicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr. Rio Tapiche ultima cuadra, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es maestro, es así que Delicia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad Bella ha sabido hacer crecer su bodega, ahora vende otros productos que antes no lo hacia, esta mas surtida y atiende todo el día con la ayuda de su hija ya a la vez se dedica a su hogar.. Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará, 1 saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, leche, pan, jabón, detergente, champú, lejía, plátano, carbón, etc. Delicia es una mujer muy trabajadora, empeñosa, desde que era muy joven se dedicó a trabajar para sentirse mas independiente, y esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por que es un apoyo excelente y el buen trato y apoyo que recibe de su promotora.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria is a member of the La Dalinas 2 Communal Bank, which is located in Alana Sisley Mz. H Lt. 9 in the district of Yarina Cocha. She is 45 years old and is the mother of 5 children. Her husband is a policeman. With her first loan of S. 300 from Manuela Ramos, Maria decided to invest in the purchase of a sound system.

Now she rents her sound equipment for a diverse range of social events, like barbecues, birthdays, promotions, weddings, et cetera. With the aid of her children she both does her domestic work and manages her business.

With this loan of S. 800, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy larger speakers, an equalizer and computerized music.

Maria shows that working with Manuela Ramos is a great support for women because it allows them to succeed and become more independent.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalinas 2, ubicado en la Asentamiento Humano. Alana Sisley Mz. H Lt. 9, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es policía. María con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra de un equipo de sonido. En la actualidad alquila su equipo de sonido para diversos eventos sociales, como parrilladas, cumpleaños, promociones, matrimonios, etc, con la ayuda de sus hijos realiza las labores domesticas, y el manejo de su equipo. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: parlantes mas grandes, un ecualizador, y música computarizada. María manifiesta que trabajar con Manuela Ramos es un gran apoyo para las mujeres porque pueden salir adelante y ser mas independientes.

loans.use: Purchasing speakers, equalizers and other products

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46229

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Vũ Thị N. and her husband are both 42 years old. They have 3 school aged children. Before she joined TYM fund, she worked in her rice filed and and raised pigs. Her annual income was only 300 USD. After joining TYM, she uses the loans to buy waste material, sorts it into different categories: plastic, metal ...She then resells the waste material to recycling companies. Her family income has increased to 200 USD a month. Her wish is to raise more money to invest into her business e.g. buy more material. She is into her 10th year as TYM fund member. She is requesting a loan of 950 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị N. và chồng chị năm nay đều bước sang tuổi 42. Anh chị có 3 con đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ, công việc chủ yếu của chị N. là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập một năm chỉ khoảng 300USD. Sau khi vào Quỹ chị đã sử dụng vốn vay thu mua phế liệu. Sau khi mua về, chị N. phân chia từng loại và bán cho các cở sở đúc đồng và làm đồ nhựa. Thu nhập hiện nay của gia đình là 200USD/tháng. Mong muốn của chị là được vay thêm nhiều vốn hơn nữa để tăng lượng hàng thu mua. Tính đến nay, chị N. đã tham gia Quỹ được 10 năm. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị vòng này là 950USD.

loans.use: Buy waste material

loans.name: Marbela

texts.es:
Marbela is a member of the Communal Bank of Las Americas, which is located in Psj. 27 de Mayo S/N in the district of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and is the mother of 3 children. Her husband works in civil construction, but his income is not enough to support his family. Consequently, Marbela used her first loan of S. 300 to set up a small shop of acquisition and sale of goods.

Now she continues with her sale of goods, but she has to travel to Lima to bring back clients' orders. With her income, she is building a room in her house where she can exhibit her products.

With this loan of S. 1,000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy clothes, sheets, bedspreads, blankets, decorations, et cetera.

Marbela has overcome many difficulties, but with the assistance of Manuela Ramos she is able to succeed and obtain many things.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marbela pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Americas, ubicado en el Jr. Vorgen de Fatima Mz. 23 Lt. 20, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja en construcción civil, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Marbela con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de mercadería. En la actualidad continua con su venta de mercadería, para ello tiene que viajar a Lima para traer sus pedidos que le hacen sus clientes y con las ganancias obtenidas esta construyendo un local en su casa para poder exhibir sus productos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: ropas, sabanas, colchas, cubrecamas, adornos, etc. Marbela supero muchas dificultades, pero con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos le ayuda a salir adelante y obtener muchas cosas.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery is a member of a company made up of enterprising mothers and fathers who specialize in raising guinea pigs in their homes. The members meet regularly and together take decisions about how to improve their business, as well as the hundreds of needs of the many communities and people who make up the group.

The unique qualities of guinea pig meat quickly have made it very popular in Peru and elsewhere. As a result, large-scale breeding has increased, but there are few breeders who maintain standards in terms of quality, size or feeding. That’s why Mery is very careful to feed her guinea pigs the best food, which she grows and harvests twice a year in her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

Mery, conforma una sociedad de madres y padres emprendedores que están dedicados a la crianza de cuyes en sus hogares, se reúnen constantemente y toman decisiones respecto a la mejora de su sociedad y a la atención de los centenares de requerimientos de muchas comunidades y personas en particular.La particularidad de su carne en poco tiempo se han hecho tan popular dentro y fuera de su país que la crianza se ha masificado pero pocos son los que mantienen los estándares de calidad, tamaño y alimentación, por esa razón Mery se preocupa por otorgarle los mejores alimentos que obtiene gracias a la siembra que realiza semestralmente en sus campos de cultivo.

loans.use: Capital increase to improve the nutritional quality of guinea pig food

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 46232

loans.name: Kathy

texts.es:
Kathy is a member of the Communal Bank of Las Americas, which is located in Psj. 27 de Mayo S/N in the district of Ucayali. She is 33 years old and is the mother of two children. Her husband is a carpenter. With her first loan from Manula Ramos S. 300 she decided to invest in the sale of frozen beverages.

Now her sales have increased; thanks to the climate in the city her drinks sell easily. She tends to her children, does the housework and takes care of her business at the same time.

With this loan of S. 1,000, which she will repay in four months, she will buy sodas of all prices and sizes, ice and jello.

With the money she has made, Kathy is thinking about putting up a small coffee shop in order to sell more products and thus generate more income for her family.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Kathy pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Américas, ubicado en el Psj. 27 de Mayo S/N, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es cubicador de madera. Kathy con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de bebidas heladas. En la actualidad sus ventas han aumentado, gracias al clima de la ciudad sus bebidas se venden facilmente , atiende a sus hijos y realiza las labores de su hogar y las comparte junto con su negocio. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: gaseosas de todos los precios y tamaños, hielo, gelatina. Kathy con las ganancias obtenidas esta pensando en poner una fuente de soda para así poder vender mas productos y así generar mas ingresos para su familia

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Vũ Thị Tẹo, 60 years old, became a TYM member in 1998. At first, she bought waste material to resell to recycling companies. It was hard work physically, everyday she had to cycle a few dozens kilometers to neighboring villages & towns. She was making 3-5 USD a day but it was all hard work. Since she is getting old, she is not able to continue this work anymore. Now she makes bamboo baskets and other everyday use items and sells to the locals. She makes about 3 USD a day. Her children are grown up. They do help her out when she has difficulty making the weekly payment. This time she is requesting a loan of 575 USD to stock up on bamboo so that she won't have to pay high price by using credit.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Tẹo, 60 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Khi bắt đầu tham gia, chị vay vốn đi thu mua phế liệu. Công việc khá vất vả, hàng ngày chị phải đạp xe đi vài chục cây số quanh thị trấn và các huyện lân cận. Nhờ chịu khó nên kinh tế gia đình có những chuyển biến tích cực. Thu nhập một ngày đi thu mua sắt vụn từ 3-5USD. Hiện nay, chị Tẹo đã nhiều tuổi nên không đi thu mua phế liệu được nữa. Chị dành vốn mua tre về đan rổ rá, thúng và các đồ dùng gia đình. Sản phẩm làm ra được bán cho nhân dân địa phương mang lại cho chị mỗi ngày 3USD. Hai con chị đều đã trưởng thành nên luôn hỗ trợ mẹ trong việc hoàn trả mỗi khi có khó khăn. Vòng vốn này chị Tẹo muốn vay thêm 575USD mua tre để đan. Như vậy chị sẽ không phải đi mua chịu nguyên liệu với giá cao.

loans.use: Buy bamboo

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is a member of the Las Americas Communal Bank, which is located in Jr. Emancipación Mz. G Lt. 30 in the Ucayali district. She is 48 years old and is the mother of one child. Her husband is a mechanic. With her first loan, Norma decided to invest in a small sowing shop.

Now, she continues with the production of children's clothing. Because her work is so detailed, she has many customers. In the mornings, she devotes herself to domestic labors; in the afternoons, she works on the production of her goods.

With this loan of S. 800, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy cloth, threads, decorations, ribbons, elastics, buttons, et cetera. Norma is very happy because she never expected that her love for sowing would lead to the creation of a source of income and friendships, which give her much satisfaction.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Américas, ubicado en el Jr. Emancipación Mz. G Lt. 30, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es mecánico. Norma con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en un pequeño taller de costura. En la actualidad continua con la confección de sus prendas para niños (as), por el buen acabado y trazo de sus prendas goza de mucha clientela, en las mañanas se dedica a las labores domesticas, y en las tardes a las confección de sus prendas. Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro telas, blondas, hilos, adornos, cintas, elásticos, botones, etc. Norma se encuentra muy feliz, no pensó que su gustó por la costura seria su fuente de ingreso y un negocio en el cual ha hecho muchas amistades y le da muchas satisfacciones.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Hồng, 47 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 1997. She lives with her husband and their only 20 years old son. Earlier she took out loans to invest in raising few pigs and some poultry. Her husband did farming. The family economy was adequate but they would like to improve. They decides to switch to bronze casting, a traditional handicraft in her area, that would provide work for everyone in the family. She goes out to buy copper, her husband and her son at home to cast bronze. The average income is 200USD a month. She would like to apply for a loan of 700USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị Hồng, 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1997. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và người con duy nhất năm nay 20 tuổi. Trước đây, chị vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn gà còn chồng làm ruộng. Kinh tế cũng đủ ăn nhưng chị Hồng luôn muốn cải thiện cuộc sống hơn nữa. Sống vùng quê có nghề đúc đồng truyền thống, những vòng vốn gần đây chị Hồng đầu tư mở cơ sở đúc đồng để cho con và chồng ở nhà làm. Bản thân chị đi thu mua đồng trong thị trấn và các huyện phụ cận. Đến nay gia đình chị Hồng có mức thu nhập 200USD/tháng. Đây tuy chưa phải là số tiền lớn nhưng là một sự khích lệ cho sự cố gắng của chị Hồng cũng như mọi người trong gia đình. Vòng vốn tiếp theo chị Hồng xin vay 700USD để tăng lượng đồng thu mua.

loans.use: Buy copper for casting

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, a selfless mother, is an excellent breeder of bulls. She began this work many years ago with her husband. Their efforts and persistence have enabled them to achieve their business goals. The weather of late hasn’t been in their favor. But they are sure that the arrival of the new season and purchase of a small bull and feed will help them get through the harsh weather.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

Gladys, es una abnegada madre de familia y una excelente criadora de toros. Se inició en esta labor hace muchos años en compañía de su amado esposo y gracias a su actividad y compromiso han podido llevar a cabo sus propósitos empresariales, el clima en esta temporada no los ha favorecido mucho pero están seguros con la llegada de una nueva estación y la compra de un torete más y alimento balanceado suficiente podrán hacerle frente a las inclemencias del tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase of feed and a small bull

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.en:
Osvaldo Dario Z. (33) owns a blacksmith's shop in a neighborhood called Monte Alto in San Stanislao (SANTANI) city. He decided to open “Marangatu” blacksmith's shop eight years ago. Since then Osvaldo's clients have been very satisfied with his work. What makes his products different from others is their originality and creativity. Moreover, he sells them at a very low price, and their quality is outstanding.

Osvaldo’s reputation is excellent, everybody in town knows him as a creative and artistic person who makes beautiful things. What makes Osvaldo work very hard is the desire to give his family a better quality of life. He lives with his parents, has no children, and is married. The loan provided will be used to build a roof for his blacksmith's workshop that will protect his workshop from the rain and the sun.

loans.use: construction of a  roof over his workshop

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Xuyến, 40 years old, has been with the TYM Fund for 10 years. She lives with her husband and their three teen children. Her husband farms and she goes out to buy scrap material to recycle. It is a hard work but that earns her a steady income and she can fulfills the weekly repayments comfortably. The daily income is 6-7USD. The family’s economy gradually improves. Their children have a little more for their education. She would like to apply for a loan of 575USD to buy more material.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị Xuyến, 40 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ đến nay đã được 10 năm. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 3 người con đều trong độ tuổi vị thành niên. Chồng ở nhà làm ruộng còn chị Xuyến chọn công việc thu mua phế liệu. Công việc vất vả nhưng giúp chị có thu nhập thường xuyên để trang trải những chi phí trong nhà và trả tiền tuần. Trung bình mỗi ngày chị thu nhập khoảng 6-7USD. Kinh tế gia đình dần được nâng lên, các con chị Xuyến cũng được học hành đầy đủ hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay thêm 575USD để có thể mua được nhiều hàng hơn. Chị hy vọng sẽ tăng thêm được thu nhập hàng ngày của mình.

loans.use: Buy wasted material

loans.name: Zayda

texts.es:
Zayda is very talented at making beautiful embroidered costumes in different styles, but always with her own personal touch. It all began 10 years ago when she decided to use her skills to earn a living and to support her family. Zayda inherited her skills from her mother who instilled in her from a young age the value of hard work. Through her hard work and daily efforts she is able to contribute to her children’s upbringing. To continue with her work and to increase production, Zayda needs to purchase additional supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

Zayda posee gran talento para realizar bellos trabajos de bordado de trajes típicos de diversos estilos y siempre con su toque distintivo. Todo comenzó hace 10 años cuando decidió crear una fuente generadora de ingresos para su familia a través de su habilidad. Ella heredó estas habilidades de su madre que desde niña le inculcó el valor del trabajo.Gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo diario puede contribuir notablemente con el desarrollo de los suyos y para continuar con su labor desea adqurir mayor cantidad de insumos a fin de elevar su producción.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to continue embroidering traditional costumes

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz comes from a family that specializes in handmade embroidery and for as long as she can remember she has been involved in this work. She has received training and developed her skills since she was a little girl. Now that Luz has reached adulthood, she is ready to earn a living doing this work. She sells her embroidery to dance troupes which are common in many schools and high schools in her region.

Luz would like to increase her embroidery sales, with the goal of putting the additional income toward the education of her six-year-old daughter, who is studying in a prestigious primary school. To improve her embroidery she needs to acquire different colored threads and wool, which, when purchased in large quantities, are less expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

Luz proviene de una familia que se dedica a los bordados artesanales y siempre ha estado ligada a este trabajo por esa razón su entrenamiento y habilidad se desarrolló desde su niñez y ahora que es una persona adulta esta preparada para afrontar la vida con esta ocupación. Oferta sus bellos bordados a los elencos de danza típica de las diversas escuelas y colegios de su zona, y su deseo es ampliar sus posibilidades de ventas a fin de solventar satisfactoriamente con las ganancias que obtenga de su inversión la educación de su pequeña hija de 6 años que está estudiando en una prestigiosa escuela de educación primaria, para poder mejorar sus bordados requiere adquirir hilos de diversos colores y lana en grandes cantidades ya que a mayor cantidad menor es el precio.

loans.use: Purchase of thread and wool in various colors

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Sơn, 52 years old, lives with her husband and their two children in township Lâm, ý Yên. She joins the TYM Fund in 1999, takes out small loans to invest in few domestic pigs and rent rice paddy for farming. After awhile, the family’s economy had improved but still in hardship. Weekly payments were difficult to meet. She sees many people in the area making money by going out to buy scrap material and resell to casting shops, she switches. Every morning she takes a bike out to collect scrap metal. Her husband and two children would do the same. The monthly income is hefty at 200USD. She would like to apply for a loan of 575USD to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Sơn, 52 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại thị trấn Lâm, huyện ý Yên. Bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1999, chị Sơn vay vốn về chăn nuôi lợn và làm ruộng. Sau một thời gian kinh tế gia đình có nhiều thay đổi nhưng việc hoàn trả tuần đôi khi vẫn gặp khó khăn. Thấy nhiều chị em trong cụm vay vốn đi thu mua phế liệu, chị Sơn cũng chuyển sang đầu tư vốn vào nghề này. Buổi sáng chị đạp xe đi thu mua phế liệu, buổi chiều chị mang về bán lại cho các cơ sở đúc đồng. Hiện nay khi 2 con đã trưởng thành, anh Bạt, chồng chị cũng tham gia đi thu mua cùng. Thu nhập của 2 anh chị khoảng 200USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị Sơn xin vay 575USD để có thêm vốn thu mua phế liệu.

loans.use: Buy scrap material

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor started her embroidery work out of great love for her children and thanks to the advice and support of her best friend. Because of her hard work and daily efforts she is able to contribute to her children’s upbringing, which gives her such joy and satisfaction. Flor would like to increase the number of embroideries she makes, for which she needs capital to invest in fabrics and thread in different colors.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

Flor, emprendió su labor de bordados movida por el inmenso amor de sus pequeños niños y gracias a los consejos y ayuda de su mejor amiga, gracias a su desempeño y esfuerzo diario contribuye con el desarrollo de los suyos y ha ido albergando en su corazón muchas alegrías y satisfacción. Ha planeado mejorar la cantidad de su producción de bordados para lo cual requiere de un capital de inversión que será utilizado en la adquisición de tela e hilos de diversos colores.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and thread in various colors

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny is a hardworking person and for this reason she is dedicated to more than one activity. She raises animals and manages a small store in her own home. Along with her husband she has worked for seven years and they are sure that success will come with time and depends on the efforts of each one of them to achieve it. They want to improve the conditions of breeding their animals and increase the quantity of products of their small store.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Jenny es una persona muy trabajadora y por esa razón se dedica a más de una actividad. Cría animales y administra una pequeña tienda en su propio domicilio. En compañía de su esposo lleva siete años de labor y están seguros que el progreso es se dará con el tiempo y depende del esfuerzo de cada uno de ellos para alcanzarlo. Desean mejorar las condiciones de crianza de sus animalitos e incrementar la cantidad de productos de su pequeña tienda.

loans.use: Increase in capital to upgrade her two activities

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vũ Thị Cúc, 41 years old, lives with her husband and their three school aged children in township Lâm, ý Yên. She joins the TYM Fund in 1999, takes out small loans to buy scrap material. Her husband is a general laborer. After awhile she saves enough to buy a truck for her husband to collect trash in the area. He also do moving for people and shipping for small businesses. The monthly income is hefty to 200-250USD. The family’s economy is much improved compared to time before joining the Fund. The household is filled with more things and their children also have more for their education. She would like to apply for a loan of 625USD to invest in her business, buying diesel fuel and maintenance on the vehicle.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Vũ Thị Cúc, 41 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ năm 1999. Chị sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại thị trấn Lâm, ý Yên. Sau khi tham gia, chị đầu tư vồn thu mua phế liệu còn chồng chị đi làm thuê. Nhờ chịu khó nên gia đình chị Cúc đã để ra được một số tiền. Năm 2006, chị Cúc bàn với chồng mua ôtô và nhận việc thu gom rác thải của thị trấn. Ngoài thời gian thu gom phế thải, anh Đạt, chồng chị đi chở thuê hàng nên thu nhập tăng lên đáng kể. Mỗi một tháng gia đình chị Cúc thu từ 200-250USD. Kinh tế gia đình thay đổi rất nhiều so với trước khi tham gia Quỹ: trong nhà chị Cúc có thêm nhiều vật dụng đáng giá, các con chị được học hành đầy đủ hơn ... Công việc đang tiến triển thuận lợi, vòng vốn này chị Cúc xin vay 625USD để sửa chữa và mua dầu chạy xe.

loans.use: To buy diesel fuel do maintenance on the truck.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly learned the techniques of embroidery from her loved mother, who conveyed them with great love and care. Now, thanks to this she can satisfactorily alleviate the needs of her only son. She is very content and satisfied with her labor and has decided to increase her working capital to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly, aprendió de su amada madre las técnicas de bordado que ella le trasmitió con sumo amor y cuidado. Ahora gracias a esto ella puede aliviar satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su único hijo.Está muy contenta y satisfecha con su labor que ha decidido incrementar su capital de trabajo para elevar su producción.

loans.use: Increase in capital to increase production

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dương Thị Hạnh, 26 years old, lives with her husband and their 4 years old son. This is her second loan with the TYM Fund. Before joining the Fund her family was in very difficult time, now it’s been improved. She is a seamstress and she needs some capital. People advised her to join the Fund. Her first loan was easy and well invested. She feels very comfortable with the weekly repayment plan and would like to continue. Her current income is 4-5USD a day. She would like to apply for a loan of 575USD to stock more material for her job..

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Dương Thị Hạnh, 26 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2007. Đây là vòng vốn thứ 2 chị được vay. Trước khi vào Quỹ, kinh tế gia đình chị Hạnh có nhiều khó khăn do mới xây dựng gia đình. Chị Hạnh làm hàng may phục vụ nhân dân trong vùng nhưng ít vốn nên công việc chưa mang lại nhiều kết quả. Được chị em tư vấn, chị xin vay vốn của Quỹ Tình thương. Sau vòng vốn đầu, chị Hạnh đã quen với việc hoàn trả tuần và nhận thầy hiệu quả do Quỹ mang lại. Hiện nay, mức thu nhập mỗi ngày của chị trung bình 4-5USD. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay mức tối đa là 575USD để mua thêm vải may. Chị Hạnh hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai 4 tuổi.

loans.use: Buy materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dương Thị Kiên, 22 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2007. She lives with her husband and their 1 year old son. She is a seamstress in need of capital. Taking advises, she applied a loan from the Fund. Her husband supported her decision. Her first loan was a success and well invested. Her current income is 4-5USD a day that she would like to improve. She is applying for a loan of 575USD to stock more material for her job..

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Dương Thị Kiên, 22 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 1 con trai 1 tuổi. Công việc chính của chị Kiên là làm hàng may mặc. Bên cạnh tay nghề thì công việc này còn đòi hỏi phải có vốn để mua vải. Theo gương những chị em trong thôn, chị Kiên xin vay vốn của Quỹ Tình thương. Chồng chị cũng rất ủng hộ và tán thành cho vợ tham gia. Sau vòng đầu sử dụng vốn hiệu quả, vòng này chị Kiên xin vay mức tối đa là 575USD. Chị hy vọng sẽ nâng được mức thu nhập 3USD/ngày hiện nay lên cao hơn.

loans.use: Buy material for making clothes.

loans.name: Glodomiro

texts.es:
Glodorimo is a youth with many ideals of improvement and with this progress in mind he has capitalized on an investment in a small center that raises bulls and he wants to continue with his work. For this reason he asks for a loan to acquire a greater quantity of balanced feed for his temporary tenants.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith , Kiva volunteer.

Glodomiro, es un joven con muchos ideales de superación y con su propósito de progreso en mente ha capitalizado su inversión en un pequeño centro de crianza de toros, desea continuar con su labor y por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de alimento balanceado para sus inquilinos temporales.

loans.use: Purchase of balanced feed

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a hardworking woman who has always fought to better the wellbeing of her young five-year-old. With this great desire inside of her heart she became qualified in the study of the food industry and makes yogurt and diverse dairy products that she sells in the areas of Porvener and Huancan every day going from door to door. She has worked arduously for five years and wants to have a small dairy products company in the future to increase her income. She will continue with her intensive work and asks for a loan to upgrade her business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre ha luchado por mejorar y otorgarle bienestar de su pequeño de 5 años, con este inmenso deseo dentro de su corazón se capacitó estudiando industrias alimentarias y elabora yogurt y diversos productos lácteos que vende por la zonas llamadas Porvenir y Huancán todos los días de manera ambulatoria de puerta en puerta; lleva 5 años de ardua labor y desea a futuro poder tener su pequeña empresa de productos lácteos para así mejorar sus ingresos, seguirá con su trabajo intensamente y solicita un préstamo para repontenciar su negocio.

loans.use: Increase in capital to upgrade her activity

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Phạm Thị Hồng, 50 years old, joined TYM fund in 2002. Her husband passed away long time ago. She has a son, he is 25 years old. She runs a woodshop fabricating wood furniture. She has built a good reputation, making furniture with quality. Her monthly income is 200 USD. This year the cost of living has increased so the price for wood has increased as well. She is seeking a loan of 1200 USD to stock up on wood for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Hồng, 50 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2002. Chồng mất đã lâu, gia đình chị chỉ còn 2 mẹ con. Hiện nay con trai chị 25 tuổi. Vốn vay của Quỹ được chị Hồng đầu tư mua gỗ về đóng bàn ghế và các mặt hàng khác. Đồ gỗ do xưởng của chị làm rất có chất lượng nên có nhiều khách đến đặt hàng. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Hồng khoảng 200USD. Năm nay, giá cả hàng hóa cũng như nguyên liệu đều tăng cao, chị Hồng muốn vay thêm 1200USD để mua được thêm nhiều gỗ đóng đồ.

loans.use: Buy wood to make table, chair …

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, with her dynamism and good humor prepares delicious dishes every day during the mornings, selling them in the evenings in a central street in her neighborhood. With her daily work and efforts she obtains the necessary income for her family. Two of her children still live at home and she is resolved to continue her labor to help them reach each one of their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria con su dinamismo y buen humor cada día elabora deliciosos platillos por las mañanas para luego venderlos por las tardes en una calle central de su barrio, con su desempeño y esfuerzo diario obtiene ingresos necesarios para su familia.Aún alberga dentro de su hogar a dos de sus hijos y está decidida a continuar con su labor para ayudarlos a alcanzar cada una de sus metas.

loans.use: Increase in capital to improve her workplace

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Dương Thị Tình is 40 years old. She joined TYM fund in 2007. She is married and has 2 school aged children. They used to be farmers before. Since joining TYM, they use the loan to start up a glass & frame shop. With hard work and determination, they had steadily built up their business. They sell out all the stock that they produce. Their living condition has improved. On average, their monthly income is 200-250 USD. This year, everything has gone up in prices. Mrs Tình is seeking a loan of 575 USD to buy glass & aluminum.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Tình, 40 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Trước đây gia đình chị Tình chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. Sau khi vay vốn, chị đầu tư vào việc đóng khung nhôm kính. Nhờ chịu khó học hỏi, tích lũy kinh nghiệm nên chất lượng sản phẩm ngày càng được nâng cao. Hàng làm ra đều được tiêu thụ hết, đời sống gia đình được nâng lên. Bình quân thu nhập hàng tháng của cửa hàng từ 200-250USD. Năm nay giá thành nguyên vật liệu đang tăng, chị Tình muốn vay 575USD để mua thêm nhôm, kính làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy aluminum and glass

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila has always worked in various activities with the aim of creating a stable source of income. For six months she has worked for a local business located in a cafeteria which offers meals to many people. As a result of the dedicated attention that she provides they have increased their sales and have many plans to continue building her small working space. To accomplish this she asks for a loan since she is demonstrating her commitment and strength now.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Dalila siempre ha trabajado en diversas actividades con el propósito de crear una fuente de ingresos estable e instaló hace 6 meses en un local comercial ubicado en un una cafetería en la cual ofrece menús a muchas personas y por la atención dedicada que brinda han aumentado sus ventas y tiene muchos planes de seguir implementando su pequeño espacio de trabajo, para lograrlo solicita un préstamo ya que su compromiso y esfuerzo están manifestados desde ahora.

loans.use: Build a small workplace

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngô Thị Bính, 55 years old, lives with her husband and their youngest child. The oldest is married and moved out. She joins the TYM Fund in 2002. The family raised pigs and farmed a rice paddy. The income was modest at 300USD a year, less than a dollar a day. When she joins the Fund she changes to making gloves and her husband sells agriculture products. The income is much better at 220USD a month. Therefore, the family’s economy is improved. She would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to invest in her business, buying material for making gloves and agricultural goods for selling.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Ngô Thị Bính, 55 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2002. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và người con út, con đầu của chị Bính đã có gia đình riêng. Trước khi vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chủ yếu là nuôi lợn và làm ruộng, thu nhập chỉ khoảng 300USD/năm. Sau khi vào Quỹ, chị Bính chuyển sang may găng tay còn chồng con chị lấy hàng nông sản về bán phục vụ nhân dân trong vùng. Thu nhập của cả gia đình hiện nay là 220USD/tháng. Kinh tế gia đình phát triển, việc hoàn trả tuần cũng thuận lợi, vòng vốn này chị Bính làm đơn xin vay 1200USD mua vải và hàng nông sản.

loans.use: Buy fabric and agricultural product

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Driven by her desires to get ahead and her great desire to continue with the family business, Elsa decided to dedicate herself to the making of wool sweaters by machine. With the support of her parents and siblings, they have formed a small company that now has prospered quite a bit. Right now they are focusing on making school sweaters and when that season ends they will focus on making sweaters for women and men of diverse styles. She is always aware of the latest styles and designs and wants to take advantage of this period that has just recently started to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

Movida por los deseos de superación y el gran deseo de continuar con el negocio familiar, Elsa, decidió dedicarse a la confección de chompas de lana a máquina. Con apoyo de sus padres y hermanos han formado una microempresa que hoy ha prosperado bastante y se dedican ahora a la confección de chompas escolares, cuando esta temporada acaba se dedicarán a la confección de chompas para damas y caballeros de diversos modelos y siempre pendiente de las ultimas tendencias y diseños, quiere aprovechar esta época que hace poco ha dado inicio y aumentar su producción.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase her production

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is a very hard-working and diligent woman that takes pains to maintain the economic stability within her home. She plants potatoes, corn and wheat in her fertile crop lands and although many times the losses from climatic changes have been substantial, she perseveres in her work because there are also very good times. She would like to adquire a larger quantity of chemical and natural fertilizers to raise the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

CATALINA, es una mujer muy empeñosa y muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por mantener la estabilidad económica dentro de su hogar, se dedica a sembrar papa, maíz y trigo en sus fértiles tierras de cultivo y aunque muchas veces la pérdida por los cambios climáticos ha sido cuantiosa, persevera en su actividad porque también hay épocas muy buenas. Desea adquirir mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes naturales para elevar la calidad de sus productos.

loans.use: Buying chemical and natural fertilizers to raise the quality of her products

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
At many times the harvest in the fields don't reward the effort of Alejandra and her family and many times this is shown by substantial economic losses. Despite this Alejandra didn't give up or become discouraged and opted for several different options for economic development. One of them is still agriculture, with the cultivation of corn or wheat being options that offer earnings, another is the raising of animals such as cows and finally she offers her labor in the crop fields of other persons. She would like to adquire a bull to finance her second occupation and this is the reason she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

En muchas oportunidades la cosecha en el campo no retribuyó el esfuerzo de Alejandra y su familia y esto muchas veces se manifestó en cuantiosas pérdidas económicas, a pesar de estos hechos Alejandra no se rindió, ni desanimó y optó por varias opciones de desarrollo económico, una de ellas sigue siendo, la agricultura, teniendo como opciones el cultivo de maíz y trigo que le ofrecen ganancias, la otra opción es la crianza de animales tales como la vaca y finalmente ofrece su mano de obra en el campo de cultivo de otras personas.Desea adquirir un toro para afianzar su segunda ocupación y a esa razón atiende su solicitud.

loans.use: Buying a bull

loans.name: Santos Margarito

texts.es:
Santos O. has been a farmer for 15 years in the municipality of Condega in Estelí, Nicaragua. Through his many sacrifices he is characterized as a great worker who has helped maintain his household.

Mr O.' family has passed through some very difficult economic times. Ceprodel has helped him with credits that have allowed him to improve his situation through the purchase of and investment in fertilizer for his crops. Once again Mr O. asks for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other products to improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos O. se dedica al negocio agropecuario desde hace 15 años en el municipio de Condega en Estelí de Nicaragua. Con mucho esfuerzo se ha caracterizado por ser un gran trabajador que ha logado mantener su hogar compuesto por su esposa e hijo.

Es de mucha necesidad recalcar que a través de los años la familia del señor O. ha atravesado difíciles circunstancias económicas sin embargo, Ceprodel le ha apoyado con créditos que le han permitido mejorar dicha situación por medio de la compra de semillas para siembra e inversión en los cultivos. Una vez mas el señor O. solicita un préstamo en Ceprodel para la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos que den lugar al trabajo en el cultivo.

loans.use: To improve his crops

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ms Guadalupe R. has worked for more than 20 years as a stock farmer in the municipality of Condega in the city of Estelí. She is a married mother of two school-aged children. Both children have been recognized as very good students and because of this Ms Guadalupe is very proud of them.

Her crops and livestock demand great attention. This demand has reversed her economic situation, and thus she seeks a loan from Ceprodel to obtain credit that will allow her to acquire products to assist her with her crops, like fertilizers and other products that will improve her harvest yield. Also, it is important to purchase livestock, like calves, in order to maintain her raising of these animals.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Guadalupe R. se dedica desde hace veinte largos años al negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí. Es madre casada y con dos hijos en edad escolara el cual se han destacado por ser muy buenos estudiantes y por ello la señora Guadalupe se siente muy orgullosa de ellos.

El negocio requiere de mucha asistencia en los cultivos y en el ganado, esto requiere por su puesto inversión económica en el negocio, para ello muy sabiamente busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la adquisición de los productos para la asistencia de los cultivos como fertilizantes y otros que cuiden del buen desarrollo de la cosecha. Además le es de necesidad la compra de ganado como lo son los terneros para llevar a cabo su crianza y así lograr mantener su familia en perfectas condiciones.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and livestock

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa is a very hard-working person and this diligence and effort was a very important legacy that her parents left her so that she would continue getting ahead now that she is part of the support for her own home. She works doing agricultural tasks but her efforts have been more concentrated in breeding animals, specifically cows and bulls that she is now selling after a period of feeding them. She gets up very early in the morning to take them to distant grazing fields and later returns as the day is ending, but always with satisfaction in her heart. She would like to improve her livestock and augment her production, which is the reason why she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Justa es una persona muy trabajadora, ese empeño y esfuerzo fue un legado muy importante que le dejaron sus padres para que continúe adelante ahora que ella es parte del sostén D. su propio hogar.Se dedica a las tareas agrícolas pero sus esfuerzos se han centrado mas en la crianza D. animales, específicamente D. vacas y toros que ahora comercializa después D. un tiempo D. engordarlos, ella se levanta muy temprano por las mañanas para llevarlos a lejanos pastizales y luego regresa cuando el día está acabando pero con la satisfacción en su corazón, desea mejorar su ganado y aumentar su producción por la cual solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase of capital to improve her livestock and increase the vegetable production in her crop fields

loans.name: Menyikwa Enterprises Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Joyce K. is an average young Kenyan. She is married with four children of her own. She also cares for the child of her late sister.

Joyce started her tailoring business three years ago after completing her tailoring course in Kisii Town. Before venturing into the business, Joyce worked on commission for a friend in Getembe market, in the town of Kisii. From this job, she accumulated savings to start her own business. She started with one sewing machine but she has worked hard to expand her business and currently has two sewing machines.

With the little profit she gets from her business, she is still able to provide food, clothing, and shelter and pay school fees for her children. Her greatest joy would be to see her children go to secondary school for higher education, if possible.

With the help of her loan, Joyce will be able to purchase more clothing materials for her business and thus to increase her monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials to expand her tailoring business

payments.comment:
Dear Kiva Lender,
