Chồng và 2 con chị thay phiên quản lý và lái xe đưa đón khách. Thu nhập của cả gia đình tăng lên rõ rệt, một tháng chị C. thu khoảng 250-300USD. Đông khách, ôtô hoạt động nhiều nên chị C. muốn xin vay 950USD để sửa chữa và mua xăng dầu chạy xe.

loans.use: To repair her car and buy gas

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 45 year old widow and mother of four living children. She lives in Sagam Siaya in Kenya. She runs a jaggery business that she started in 2000. She buys her products from Mumias Sugar Factory and then supplies the goods to her customers. She requires $800.00 to purchase more supplies.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar products to sell

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Bùi Thị Vân, 34, participates in TYM fund since 1998. She is married and has 2 school aged children. Her main occupation is buying/collecting waste material to resell to recycling companies. This is very hard work physically. Everyday she has to cycle long distance to collect/buy the waste material from the people. At the end of the day, she has to sort it into different categories to sell to the recycling companies. She makes 3-5 USD a day, this provides her with cash flow to cover the everyday expenses and the weekly payment toward the loan. This time she is seeking a loan of 450 USD so that she would be able to buy a lot more waste material.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Vân, 34 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1998. Chị Vân đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Công việc chính hiện nay của chị là thu mua phế liệu. Đây là một công việc vất vả, hàng ngày chị phải đạp xe đi hàng chục km thu mua hàng. Cuối ngày chị phân loại và bán lại cho các cơ sở sản xuất và tái chế nguyên liệu. Nhờ chịu khó nên mỗi ngày chị Vân kiếm được khoảng 3-5USD. Thu nhập thường xuyên giúp chị chi trả những chi phí sinh hoạt hàng ngày và tiền tuần. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 450USD để có thể thu mua được nhiều phế liệu hơn.

loans.use: Buy wasted materials

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en:
Yusta is a married and has 7 children, 3 to 20 years old. She and her husband also take care of 5 other people. Yusta earns income selling clothing; she started this business in 2006. Every day, she works from 12 am to 4 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$110 from the sales.

Yusta now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for a sales business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50 year old entrepreneur. She is a widow and lives with her eight children in Midhine Siaya in Kenya. She runs a small shop adjacent to her home that she started in 2006. She sells basic commodities, such as bread, rice, flour, cooking oil, sugar, eggs, milk, salt, and soap. She requires $700.00 to add more stock to her shop.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Soch

texts.en: Mrs. Soch H., 36, earns about $3.66 per day making bricks. Her husband, Srey Pek is a farmer and earns around $4.96 per day. They live with three children in Thmey Village, in the Siem Reap Province. Their children are young and attend school so they are responsible for family’s expenses. To increase income, they need to expand their business. H. is seeking a loan of $1,100 to purchase pieces of wood to stock and fuel oils for machine using in their business. This loan can expand their business and increase income for supporting expenses.

loans.use: To purchase pieces of wood to stock and fuel oils for machine using in their business

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un H., age 33, lives with her old mother in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has two businesses to meet the daily expenses. First, she owns a plot of farmland and grows cashew nut trees. Cashew nuts are one of the favorite crops and are served around the country. People cook with cashew nuts and also serve them when they drink beer or wine.

Second, she rents a musical instrument to the villagers. She earns the most in the dry season, from January to May. In April, farmers have already harvested their crops, and most couples get married in that month.

Her combined income from both businesses is around four dollars per day. Her elderly mother, Neang Houn, age 65, helps her daughter every day with planting cashew nuts.

Mrs. Un H. would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a small tractor to transport the musical instrument. Whenever she rents her musical instrument, she needs to rent a trailer or horse-cart to transfer musical instrument to the renter's site. This cost decreases her income, and so she isn't able to save a lot of money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor to transport the musical instrument to renters.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 28 year old poultry farmer. He is married and lives with his wife and one child. His wife works as a social worker with Millennium Development. Martin started his poultry business in 2005. He keeps only local breeds (for meat and eggs), which are preferred most locally and he currently has 100. He requires $500.00 to build a bigger structure, purchase chicken feeds, and add more chicks.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To build a bigger structure, add more chicks, and purchase feeds.

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Cao Thị Vượng is 53 years old. She lives in Lương Bằng, Kim Động with her husband and their son. She owns a store selling all kind of nước mắm. She has been in this business for 15 years. All her products are of good quality and she has gained her customer's loyalty and trust. Her husband works with her overseeing the operations. Her family income is 200-250 USD a month. She plans to expand her business so she is seeking a loan of 1200 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Cao Thị Vượng, 53 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và con trai tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Kim Động. Chị có một cửa hàng chuyên bán buôn bán lẻ nước mắm các loại. Chị Vượng làm công việc này đã được 15 năm. Sản phẩm của cửa hàng luôn bảo đảm về chất lượng và uy tín nên có đông khách đến đặt mua. Anh Sơn, chồng chị, cũng tham gia trực tiếp vào việc kinh doanh. Thu nhập của gia đình hiện nay khoảng 200-250USD/tháng. Với mong muốn mở rộng quy mô cửa hàng, vòng vốn này chị Vượng xin vay 1200USD để mua hàng bán.

loans.use: Buy fish sauce

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đào Thị Lừng is 54 years old. She lives in Lương Bằng, Kim Động with her 3 children. Her husband passed away long time ago. Raising 3 children and providing them education all by herself was very difficult. Her main occupation is fish farming, raise pigs and cultivate fruit plants. With hard work, she was able to make ends meet. After joining TYM fund in 2003, she used the loans to invest in her pig raising business with success. Today, her monthly income is 150-180 USD. All her 3 children are grown up and they do help out their mother. Mrs Lừng would like to get a loan of 950 USD to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Lừng, 54 tuổi, sống cùng 3 con tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Kim Động. Chồng mất sớm, một mình chị lam lũ vất vả nuôi các con ăn học. Công việc chính của chị là chăn nuôi lợn, nuôi cá và trồng cây ăn quả. Luôn chịu khó làm lụng nên thu nhập cũng đủ nuôi sống gia đình. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ vào năm 2003, có thêm vốn, việc chăn nuôi sản xuất ngày thêm thuận lợi. Một tháng chị Lừng kiếm được khoảng 150-180USD. Hiện nay cả 3 người con đều đã trưởng thành và có thể hỗ trợ mẹ, chị Lừng muốn được vay thêm 950USD để đầu tư mở rộng dự án của mình.

loans.use: Buy pigs, fishes and food for them

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Sin L. is 49 years old and since 2000, she has had a small stand selling groceries in front her house. She also makes Khmer cakes and sells them with the groceries, earning around $2 profit per day. Her husband, Sreng Sris, age 55, has worked as a construction worker for over 10 years. Sometimes he travels outside the village to do construction work. He is a hard-working person and also a good husband. Usually he earns about $2.50 a day. Sin L. would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a construction tools, such as buffer machine. The rest of the loan will be used to purchase more groceries to sell. (Picture: husband and wife)

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đoàn Thị Hà is 54 years old. She is a 6th year TYM fund member. She sells fruits at the local market. This type of work is typical for the women in the region. It provides her with cash flow so it is suitable for her to make the weekly payment toward the loan. On average she makes 6-7 USD a day. Her children are all grown up and they can help her out financially so she feels comfortable to apply for bigger loan. This time she is seeking 625 USD to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đoàn Thị Hà năm nay 54 tuổi. Chị đã tham gia Quỹ TYM được 6 năm nay. Công việc hiện tại của chị là bán hàng hoa quả ở chợ. Đây cũng là một nghề phổ biến với người dân trong vùng. Việc bán hàng vừa giúp chị Hà có thu nhập thường xuyên lại thuận tiện cho việc hoàn trả tuần. Bình quân mỗi ngày chị Hà lãi từ 6-7USD. Các con chị Hà đều đã lớn và luôn hỗ trợ mẹ nên chị không cảm thấy ngại khi vay những mức vốn lớn. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 625USD để mua thêm hàng về bán.

loans.use: Buy fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Wool and Materials

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đoàn Thị Trâm is 54 years old. Her husband passed away long ago due to illness. She lives with her 3 children in Kim Động, Hưng Yên. She breeds cows for a living. This type of business requires a lot of capital. For this reason she joined TYM fund. Usually, she buys cows, raises them until they produce calves then she sells the calves. Each year, she sells a few batches of calves. Each batch brings her a few hundreds dollars. When the cow gets old, she sells it. She started with 1 cow, today she has 2. Her children are grown up so they are able to help her. She is seeking 1200 USD to buy more cows and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đoàn Thị Trâm năm nay 45 tuổi. Chồng bị bệnh mất đã lâu, chị Trâm sống với 3 con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Nghề nghiệp chính của chị là chăn nuôi bò sinh sản. Công việc này đòi hỏi nguồn tài chính lớn nên chị Trâm đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương để có thêm vốn. Thông thường chị Trâm mua bò cái về nuôi, sau một thời gian bò đẻ sẽ đem bán. Một năm chị bán vài lứa, mỗi lứa thu về vài trăm USD. Khi bò đã già chị bán đi và mua con khác. Từ chỗ chỉ chăn nuôi 1 đến nay chị Trâm đã có 2 con bò sinh sản. Hiện nay hai con đều đã trưởng thành và có thể hỗ trợ mẹ, chị Trâm làm đơn xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm bò và thức ăn chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim M., age 37, is a mother of three children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has a small stand in a busy market selling local fruits such as mangoes, oranges, longan and so on. She makes about $5 of profit a day. Her husband, Sim Thon, is 45 years old and works as a farmer. He earns around $2.50 per day from selling his outputs.  All of the children are at school. Mrs. Kim M. would like to borrow some money from Kiva to purchase another plot of farmland to increase her farm yield. As now inflation rate in Cambodia has increased the price goods including rice. So it means the more rice crops she and her husband have  the more income they can generate to support their  family and finance their children’s education as well. Moreover, some parts of the loan she also uses to expand her fruit business.

loans.use: To purchase another farmland to expand her rice crops.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong C. is 47 years old and has lived in Phnom Penh since she was born. She works raising pigs to support her family. She makes about $8 in revenue per day. In the suburban areas as well as in the provincial or rural areas, people like raising pigs because this j, and sometime for trade.

Also, she owns a grinding mill, which she occasionally rents to the local people to earn extra profit. One of her daughters is a weaver and earns around $3 a day; another child is now employed, and another child is a student.

She would like a loan from Kiva to purchase more piglets. The rest of the loan will be used to build a small building for the grinding mill.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Qurbonali

texts.ru:
Qurbonali lives in the town of Yavan. He is 34 years old, married and has four children. His family is large and they happily live all together. Qurbonali works in construction, but also does animal husbandry. He breeds cows and calves. At this time he wants to buy a pedigree calf to breed more pedigree calves and for this he needs a loan. It will help him breed strong pedigree calves which will later be sold for meat. It will also supply the residents of his town with quality meat. He plans to pay off the loan within 5 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бердыев Курбонали живет в городе Яван . Возраст 34 гоад, женат и имеет 4 детей. Семья большая , но живут они дружно и весело. Курбонали работает на стройке , но дполнительно занимается животноводством. Разводит коров и бычков. Сейчас он хочет купить породистого бычка Для получения породистого потомства. Для этого необходимо получить кредит. Это поможет ему разводить породистых , крепких бычков , которых он сможет продавать на мясо. Это так же даст возможность обеспечить население качественным мясом. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 5 месяцев

loans.use: To buy a calf

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout S. H.’s family has lived in the city of Phnom Penh. One child attends school; another child is a blacksmith, and earns around $50 a month. Hout S. H. is works in a garment factory and makes $2.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker around Phnom Penh city, and he makes $3 per day.

Hout S. H. and her husband also make Khmer wine (rice wine). Rice wine is one of the popular wines for the local people, especially in rural areas because it is inexpensive and doesn't affect people's health.

This business has been doing well. Hout S. H. requests a loan from Kiva to purchase some equipment to make rice wine. The rest of money from the loan will be used to purchase more piglets to breed.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru:
Daler D. lives in Yavan. He is 22 years old and is married but doesn’t have children yet. He studies at the Tajik Pedagogical University. In order to pay for his education and help provide for his family, Daler started buying and selling cattle. He buys young bull-calves, fattens them for 40-45 days and then resells them at the local market. He wants a loan to increase his turnover, which in turn will increase his profits. He plans to repay his loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Давлатов Далер проживает в городе Яван. Живет со своей женой . Ему 22 года и детей пока не имеет. Учится в Таджикском Педагогическом университете . Для того чтобы оплачивать обучение и прокормить семью, он занимается купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает их около 40-45 дней , а потом продает на рынке . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около 5 лет. Хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Это поможет ему увеличить товарооборот и получаемый доход .Погасить кредит планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem K., her husband, and children have resided in Phnom Penh for over ten years. Mrs. Yem K. is a weaver and she weaves by hand. In Cambodia, hand weaving garments are more expensive than those made by machine. It usually take about 15 days to complete one dress. One dress sometimes can cost more than one hundred dollars. The more silk and decorations that are used, the more expensive the dress. People wear this type of dress on their wedding day, Khmer New Year, and in other ceremonies.

Her husband, Noun Phal, age 49, is a construction worker who builds houses around the Phnom Penh area. He earns around $4 a day. One child works at a garment factory, one is a taxi-driver, one is a weaver like her mother, and another is married and lives outside the home. To expand her weaving business, Mrs. Yem K. requests a loan from Kiva to purchase silk, beads, and sewing needles. All of these materials cost around $100. With the remainder of the loan she plans to purchase construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase silk, beads, and sewing needles for dressmaking

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Alisher S. lives in Yavan. He is 21 years old and is not married. He lives with his parents. The family is large and everybody has to work to help provide for the family. Alisher is involved in animal husbandry. He has a small business: he is raising cattle. Alisher wants to obtain a loan to increase his turnover. This additional financing will help him increase his profits. He will be able to repay his loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Сатторов Алишер житель города Яван. Возраст 21 год , не женат. Живет с родителями. Семья большая и всем приходится много раболтать , чтобы прокормить семью. Занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит мелко-рогатый скот и бычков. Хочет получить кредит, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Дополнительное финансирование путем получения кредита поможет ему увеличить доход. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Rajabmo

texts.ru:
Rajabmo I. lives in Yavan. She is a widow with four children. In order to provide for her children after her husband passed away, Rajabmo started trading milk and dairy products. She purchases milk from her neighbors and makes cottage cheese and sour cream which she sells at the regional market. She wants to get a loan to purchase a cow to be able to make dairy products from her own milk. This will help to cut costs and increase her profits. She plans to repay her loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Исмоилова Раджабмо жительница города Яван. Вдова , и имеет 4 детей. Для того , чтобы прокормить детей , после смерти мужа Раджабмо занялась торговлей молоком и кисло-молочных продуктов. Скупает молоко у соседей , производит творог и сметану и вывозит в район для реализации. Сейчас хочет купить собстенную корову , чтобы производить продукты из собственного молока. Это поможет сократить расходы и увеличить доход. Для этого ей нужно получить кредит. Погасит кредит сможет в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Huon Sum Group

texts.en: Mrs. Huon S. was born in 1967 and now lives in Svay Kambet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is married and has three children, one is a garment worker and the other two are students. She is the group leader of a four member group. She is a subsistence farmer and works in the field near her house. Her husband, Vy Thy, is a security guard.  However, his salary is not good enough to support the expenses of the family. Last year, Mr. Vy Thy was ill and could not work, which made things more difficult. This household never received a loan from MFI before.  This loan will allow Mrs. Huon S. to finish building the house she has started on.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira Muminović was born in 1975 and she lives with her husband in a small suburb of the town of Živinice called Đurđevik. Her husband works in a local community. His monthly salary is 500 KM (about US$ 410). They have two children.

With part of this loan in the amount of 1000 KM (US$ 825) Amira will purchase thread for crochet, and she will use the rest of the loan to buy chickens for fattening. Amira makes handicrafts which she sells to generate additional income and with that work she fills her free time. Her wish is to improve their family income through a poultry business.

loans.use: To buy thread and chickens

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Hour S. is a weaver, and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. Silk dresses are very expensive because they are hard to make and it takes time to complete each dress. A well-made silk dress with good decoration and silk can cost about $100. Hand woven fabric is more expensive than machine-made, and people prefer hand-made fabric. People wear silk dresses during the Khmer New Year and other traditional ceremonies.

Hour S. earns an average of $9 per day. Her husband teaches the Khmer language. He earns about $1.50 per day, which supplements the household income. They have two children, who are students.

To expand the weaving business, Hour S. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase silk, beads, and sewing needles.

loans.use: To purchase silk, beads, and sewing needles

loans.name: Suyarhon

texts.ru:
Suyarhon Nazarov lives in the town of Yavan. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. He is in the retails business. He has his vendor space on the Yavan market where he sells dry fruits and nuts. He buys the products from wholesellers and brings it from different parts of Dushanbe. This helps supply the market with these type of products which the locals can buy without having to travel outside of town. Suyarhon want to increase commodity circulation and needs a loan. He plans to pay it off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Назаров Суярхон житель города Яван.Возраст 34 года , женат и имеет 2 детей. Занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на рынке города Яван. Торгует сухофруктами и орехами. Скупает товар у оптовых продавцов , привозит из разных мест города Душанбе. Это помогает обеспечить рынок данным видом продукции и покупать они могут не выезжая за приделы Явана. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот он хочет получить кредит. Погасить его сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Fazal Haq

texts.en:
Fazal Haq, son of M. D., is 22 years old and he lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a retail food shop in Kabul city. He has already taken one short-term loan from AFSG and repaid it successfully. Now he wants to take a second loan in the amount of 42000 Afghanis (US$ 875) to buy more inventory for his shop, so he has applied to AFSG for this purpose.
He hopes that through this loan he can continue to expand his small business .

loans.use: To buy food for his shop inventory

loans.name: Fahra

texts.en:
Fahra was born in 1964 and she is from Đurđevik, a small suburb of the town of Živinice. Her husband works in a coal-mine and his monthly salary is 700 KM (about US$ 575). They have a small shop selling mixed goods but they get most of their income from agriculture.

This is Fahra's second loan through MCO WWI in the amount of 600 KM (US$ 500) and her wish is to buy more raspberry seedlings in order to increase her yield so she can produce jam and sell it at the market. Her wish is to improve her monthly income because she has 3 children and her husband’s salary is not enough for 5 of them.

loans.use: To buy more raspberry seedlings

loans.name: Rom Prak Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom P., 46, lives in Chom Teav village. She is married and has two children, one of whom is a student while the other is too young to study. She is the group leader. She is a farmer and works with her husband, Tith P., in the field that is next to her house. Last year, Mrs. Rom P. obtained a loan from AMK to help her with her plantation. In the village, it is difficult to get water since the river is far. Therefore, Mrs. Rom P. is requesting a loan so that she can dig a well. This will enable her to produce a better crop.

The man in the picture is the husband of one of the members who could not be present.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Marziya

texts.ru:
Marziya K. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 47 years old, married and has 7 children. She is in the business of selling milk. She has a cow that brings about 10 liters of milk. In order to increase the amount of profit from the business Marziya wants to obtain a loan and purchase another cow. This way there will be more milk and she will be able to make dairy products. She plans to repay teh loan within a 6 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Комилова Марзия жительница города Яван. Возраст 47 лет, замужем и имеет 7 детей. Занимается продажей молока . Имеет одну корову, которая дает около 10 литров молока. Для того , чтобы увеличить доход и обеспечить население свежим молоком Марзия хочет получить кредит и купить еще одгну корову. Молока будет больше , она сможет дополнительно производить кисло-молочные продукты. Погасить кредит она сможет в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sareourn Chork Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sareourn C. is the leader of a four person loan group in Chom Teav village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 43 years old, married and without children. She and her husband, Huoy Huy, are subsistence farmers and work together to cultivatable their land. They generate a small income to support themselves. Previously, Mrs. Sareourn C. obtained a loan from AMK to improve her agricultural production. Now she is asking for a loan to buy land in order to build a house for her family in the village.

loans.use: to buy land

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mrs. Ngit Seng decided to pay $13 as an extra repayment.
This is the repayment on June 2008.
Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim S. is 49 years old, and have lives with husband and children in Kampong Cham province. Mrs. Sim S. is a farmer and makes around $1 per day. Her husband Ros Ren is 47 years old and works as a construction worker. Usually he earns about $3 per day (pictured here).

Two children are married and live away from home. Two children work in the garment factory and each earns $80 a month; and two children are local workers.

Sim S. requests a loan from Kiva to purchase more farmland. This will allow her to produce more to support the family. Recently, in Cambodia the price of rice is very high because of inflation. So when she produces more rice, she can earn more money to support the family.

loans.use: To purchase farmland to plant more rice

loans.name: Agness's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Agness is married and has two children. She and her husband also take care of one other child. Agness earns income keeping cows and goats; she started her own business in 1993. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$150.

She now hopes for a loan to be able to buy and feed more livestock. Agness will share this loan with her sub-group members Jesca and Elizabeth who own charcoal sales businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Sokhom Urn Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom U. lives in Chom Teav village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 23, married, and without children. She is the group leader of a four women group in her village. She is a farmer and works with her husband, Mr. Yet Nguon. Both of thE. are very hard workers, but they only make a small income. Previously, Mrs. Sokhom U. obtained a loan from AMK that she used to improve her crop. Presently, she is applying for a loan because she would like to live separate from her parents.  Therefore, she hopes to buy a piece of land to build a new house for her and her husband in the village.

loans.use: to buy land

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mrs. Ran Seourng decided to pay $12 as an extra repayment.

This Group Has An End Of Term Loan. This Means That Principal Is Due At The End Of The Loan. AMK Allows For Pre-payments, Thus Some The Members Might Pay Some Principal Before The End Of The Loan. So Mrs. Ran Seourng Decided To Pay $12 As An Extra Repayment.

loans.name: Bibisobira

texts.ru:
Bibisobira N. lives in the city of Yavan. She has a very large family: she has 7 children. She has a piece of land on which she grows vegetables. She sells the vegetables on the market. She has a sales location on the market where she sells vegetables, herbs and fruits when they are in season. Right now is the season for fruits and Bibisobira wishes to increase turnover. This business is the main source of income for the family. The growth of the business will help her take better care of her family as well as provide the local population with fresh fruit. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Насриддинова Бибисобира жительница города Яван. Имеет очень большую семью. Унее 7 детей . Они живут дружно и весело. Имеет участок земли , засеивает его овощами , а урожай продает на базаре. Роме того имеет торговую точку на районном рынке , где продает овощи , зелень , а в сезо6н и фрукты. Сейчас ей необходимо увеличить товарооборот , в связи с тем , что пришел сезон фруктов. Ее бизнес является главным источником дохода ее семьи , поэтому развитие бизнеса просто необходимо. Кроме того Яван – это город , где растут не все фрукты ягоды , поэтому она помогает обеспечить население фруктами привозимыми из других мест . Для этого ей необходимо получить кредит , который она сможет погасить в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase turnover

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Prech Huy Group

texts.en: Mrs. Prech H. is the group leader of four member group in Chom Teav Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 28 and the mother of three children. One of her children is a student while the others two are too young to work or study. She sells coconuts in the village. Her husband, Mr. Ri Sok, is helping her out by going to buy the coconuts. Last year, in order to improve her business, Mrs. Prech H. requested and obtained a loan from AMK to buy a motorbike to transport coconuts. Her business is very successful and she wants to expand it by obtaining another loan.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Saidato

texts.ru:
Saidato N. lives in the city of Yavan, is married and has 6 children. He is 47 years old. He is a farmer. He would like to obtain a loan in order to purchase a milk cow. His wife will sell the milk to the neighbors. This will provide the family with additional income. In addition to that the neighbors will be able to purchase milk at a lower price than the one on the market, which will in turn better their quality of life. Saidato plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Неъмонов Саидато из города Яван.Женат , имеет 6 детей. Ему 47 лет . Он не имеет образования , но занимается земледелием и животноводством. Планирует получить кредит , для того , чтобы купить корову , которая будет давать молоко. Получаемое молоко будет продавать его жена соседям . Это поможет получать дополнительный доход для семьи. Кроме того продажа молока соседям по ценам ниже рыночных - это будет большая помощь населению.Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is married and has two children, ages 16 and 15. Digna earns income selling used clothing and milk; she started her own business in 2007. Every day, she works from 7 am to 6 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$40 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of second-hand clothing for sale

loans.name: Rim Sum Group

texts.en: Mrs. Rim S. was born in 1975 and now lives in Tang Tbeng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is the group leader of a four member group. Mrs. Rim S. is a farmer and is married to Mr. Vith S., who is a lumberjack. They have four children, two of whom look after the cows while the other two attend school. Last year, Mrs. Rim S. obtained a loan from Brasac Co. Ltd. to buy a rice field. She sold some of  her cows and now would like to buy new ones.  This is why she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed

payments.comment: This group has an End of Term loan. This means that principal is due at the end of the loan. AMK allows for pre-payments, thus some the members might pay some principal before the end of the loan. So Mrs. Rim Sum decided to pay $11 in advance.

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.ru:
Zebonisso S. lives in the city of Yavan. She is in the business of raising lambs and reselling them on the market. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. At first she breeds and raises the animals and then resells them to the butchers. Zebonisso wants to purchase several additional grown animals while the prices have not gone up. For this purpose she wishes to obtain a loan. This will help her increase turnover. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Саидова Зебониссо живет в городе Яван. Домохозяйка. Но занимается откормкой барашков для продажи мясникам. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около 10 лет. Сначала разводит животных , откармливает , а затем продает мясникам. Пока цены на животных не выросли Зебониссо хочет купить дополнительно взрослых овец. Для этого она должна сначала получить кредит. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот и и доход клиента. Погасить кредит Зебониссо сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase several lambs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en:
Yusta is married and has two children, ages 21 and 14. Yusta is a fish seller; she started her own business in 2003. Every day, she works from 7 am to 5 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$250 from the sales.

Yusta now hopes to receive a loan to buy more fish for her sale.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for sale

loans.name: Abdul Habib

texts.en:
This is A. H., a young man who’s  25 years old and is the owner of a spare parts shop. He lives in Kabul right now.
He wants to buy some materials for his shop to improve his small business and find more customers, so he has applied to AFSG to take out a 50,000 Afghanis (US$ 1050) short-term loan to achieve his purpose.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Hajara Namugenyi's Group

texts.en:
Hajara, age 48, is the leader of this 5-person group. Hajara is married with 5 children. Their ages range from 13 to 6. All of them are in school.

She is servicing a loan for 800,000 shillings. She buys goats and sheep from villages for sale to butchers. The challenges she faces are the long distances she has to travel to the villages; the high transport costs; that sometimes the animals die on the way; that quarantines due to breakouts of animal diseases cause increases in prices; fatigue; and staying away from home for 3 or 4 days in a week.

Her benefits include being able to take her children to school and providing for her family. She plans to start buying cows for her business and for keeping at home. She also plans to build a house to move from the wetland. Hajara has paid back over 10 loans successfully to MCDT in the past.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep from villages for sale to butchers

loans.name: Tupilike's Maelewano Group

texts.en:
Tupilike is 37 years old, married, and has three children, ages 20,19, and 15. She and her husband also take care of three other people, ages 60,19, and 15. Tupilike owns a small food store, and works there every day from 8 am to 11 pm, earning a monthly profit of about US$80 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items for sale. Tupilike will share this loan with her sub-group members Salome and Jenipha, who also earn money selling food.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Muhammad Muneer

texts.en:
Muhammad Muneer, son of  F. H., lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a retail food and mobile repair shop in Kabul.
He wants to develop his small business at present, but he needs capital to invest in it. Therefore he has requested a short-term loan in the amount of 42,000 Afghanis (US$ 875) from AFSG, to buy some necessary materials for his shop.
Muhammad Muneer intends to repay this loan over 12 months and he hopes that with this money he can improve his business.

loans.use: To buy some necessary materials for his shop

loans.name: Sarom Kring's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom K. is a loan group leader in Chy Prong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her group consists of four members. She is 36 years old, married and has two children.  Both of her children are attending school. She is a farmer and also owns a Chinese noodle shop. Her husband, Chamreun Chea, is a farmer and motorbike taxi driver who generates a small income. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sarom K. wants to start a new business: a grocery store. Therefore, she applied for a loan to buy some inventory for the new business. (Mrs. Sarom K. is not in the picture but her husband is.)

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Lucia's Msimamo Group

texts.en:
Lucia is married and has two children, ages 8 and 6. Lucia owns a small food sales business, which she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 7 am to 6 pm at her food store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$50.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items for sale. Lucia will share this loan with her sub-group members Halima and Tausi, who earn money selling bananas, charcoal, and clothes.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Khlot

texts.en: Mr. Khlot H. has a grind machine and makes about $6.5 per day. His wife, Mrs. Khun Hov makes about $2 per day breeding pigs. They live with their eight children in Phka Rumchek Village, Siem Reap Province. With growing family expenses, they need to expand their business. They seek a loan of $1,200 to purchase rice stock for resell. This loan will expand their business and improve their income to support their family sufficiently. (The Photo is H.’s wife)

loans.use: To purchase rice stock to resell

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat Q. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 44 years old, is married and has 5 children. She is a farmer. She rents a piece of land on which she grows wheat. Last year the harves was very poor due to natural causes. The profit from the business was very low. She has already planted the wheat for this year, but does not have enough to pay rent. She is in need of a loan that will help her with that. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Калбарова Саодат жительница города Вахдат . Ей 44 года , она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Занимается ратениеводством. Имеет землю , которую берет в аренду. Засеивает ее пшеницей. В прошлом году ее урожай не удался , из-за плохих природных условий.Прибыль она получила совсем маленькую . На этот год она уже засеила землю пшеницей. Сейчас ей необходимо оплатить арендную плату . поэтому она запланировала получить кредит, который поможет ей в этом. Погасить кредит Саодат сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Paying rent

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and has two children, ages 9 and 5. She owns a small food store, wich she opened in 2004. Every day, Veronica works from 7 am to 5 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$40.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items for her sale.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married and has two children, ages 6 and 2. Eva earns money selling fish; she started her own sales business in 2005. Every day, she works from 6 am to 5 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$70 from the sales.

Eva now hopes to receive a loan to buy more fish for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of fish (dagaa) for a sales business

loans.name: Hadija's Baraka Group

texts.en: Hadija is married and earns income managing a small stock of animals (cows). She started this business in 2004. Every day, Hadija works from 7 am to 6 pm, and is now hoping to receive a loan to be able to expand her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members Asha, Sauda, Sara, and Anna, who own food and charcoal sales businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Halima's Wavumi Group

texts.en:
Halima is married and has two children, ages 15 and 3. She and her husband also take care of one other person who is 58 years old. Halima earns money selling clothes; she started her own business in 2004. Every day, she works from 12 am to 12 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$50 from the sales.

Halima now hopes to receive a loan to buy more clothes for her sales business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Maria.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Chuon Ur Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuon U. is the group leader of a foU. member group in Kralanh village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 56 years old and is the mother of one child, who is a construction worker. She sells baskets for a living and her husband, Mr. Pov CH., helps her.

The family income is very little and they cannot pay for all of their expenses. Therefore, Mrs. Chuon U. wants to cultivate rice to supplement their income. Unfortunately, the family does not have cultivatable land. Mrs. Chuon U. is requesting a loan to buy a field for this purpose. (The man in the picture is the husband of Mrs. Nai H..)

loans.use: to buy land to cultivate

loans.name: Siwema's Tegemeo Group

texts.en:
Siwema is a single woman and has a child who is 7 years old. Siwema earns money selling charcoal; she started her business in 2007. Every day, Siwema works from 7 am to 5 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$190 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more charcoal for her sales business. Siwema will share this loan with her sub-group members Sophia and H. who also have charcoal sales businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Mari

texts.fr:
Mari B. is 52 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She is the president of an administration committee of a village bank Alwar CMT in Ziguinchor. She would like to purchase palm oil, lemons and nététou (traditional condiment) to sell. The profits she makes will help her have a larger hand in participating in the daily responsibilities of her family and the schooling of her children. She is asking for a loan that will be repaid at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mari B., 52 ans, mariée, 06 enfants en charge est présidente au sein du comité de gestion du banc villageois de Alwar CMT à Ziguinchor. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du citron et du nététou pour revendre. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge quotidienne de la famille et de la scolarité des enfants. Elle sollicite un 14ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil, lemons and nététou (traditional condiment)

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is married and has one child, age 12. Neema is a second-hand clothing seller; she started her own business in 2003. Every day, she works from 6 am to 5 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$150 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for a sales business

loans.name: Anisa's Tunda Group

texts.en:
Anisa is married and has one child, age 7. She owns a general store, which she opened in 2000. Every day, Anisa works from 7 am to 5 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more items for her sales business. Anisa will share this loan with her sub-group member Editha, who owns a fish sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr:
Sadio Touré is 51 years old and the mother of three. She has been in charge of the village bank Alwar CMT in Ziguinchor for 6 years. She would like to strengthen her position, which consists of buying honey, palm oil, brushes, lemon and dried fishes to sell. Her profits help her to improve her standard of living and that of her small family who is completely dependent upon her. Sadio is asking for a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a one time payment.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Sadio Touré, 51 ans, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Alwar CMT à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter du miel, de l’huile de palme, des balaies, du citron et des poissons séchés pour revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille dont elle a entièrement la charge. Sadio sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase honey, palm oil, brushes, lemons and dried fish.

loans.name: Sokheourn Kao Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheourn K. was born in 1960 in Kralanh Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is the group leader and her group consists of six members. She is married and has three children, two of whom are students while the third stays at home. She sells baskets and her husband, Kiri Ur, is a construction worker in the village. Between the both of them, they cannot generate an income that will allow them to improve their standard of living. In order to change their situation, Mrs. Sokheourn K. wants to expand her business.  Therefore, she applied for a loan to buy more raw materials to make more baskets to sell.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to make baskets

loans.name: Grace's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Grace is 53 years old and divorced. She owns a small restaurant, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6 am to 4 pm at the restaurant and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to increase the amount of stock in the restaurant. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Tausi, who has a business in honey sales.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to increase the stock in a restaurant

loans.name: Grace's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Grace is 53 years old and is divorced woman. Grace owns a small restaurant, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to increase the amount of stock for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tausi, who has business dealing in honey sales.

loans.use: To increase the amount of stock for her restaurant.

loans.name: Nanding Diarra

texts.fr:
Nanding Diarra Sané, 50 years old and married with 7 children in her care, is a member of the village bank of Niaguiss Néma in Ziguinchor. She would like to buy palm oil, lemon juice, and peanut paste for resale. With the income from this business, she will take care of health, clothing, and educational costs for her children. She is asking for her 12th loan, which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Nanding Diarra Sané, 50ans, mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Niaguiss Néma à Ziguinchor. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du jus de citron et de la pâte d’arachide pour revendre. Avec les revenus tirés de son commerce elle prend en charge les frais de santé, d’habillement et de scolarité des enfants. Elle sollicite un 12ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, lemons, and peanut paste

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance O. is thirty-five years old. She supplies and retails salt. She is married with two children and the children are in school. Constance is determined to support her husband in providing a quality education for her children through her business. She wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of salt to meet the urgent demands of her customers and also to increase her income. She belongs to the community group called Adoration. The group members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of salt

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is married and has 3 children, ages 18, 12 and 5. She and her husband also take care of one other person, age 60. Janeth owns a small restaurant, which she started in 1995. Every day, she works from 11 am to 12 pm at the restaurant and can earn a monthly profit of about US$80 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy various items for her restaurant business.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for a restaurant business

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is married and has two children, ages 25 and 18. She owns a small restaurant and also earns money selling charcoal; she started this business in 2003. Every day, Hadija works from 6 am to 8 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$250 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more charcoal and to increase the stock of goods for her restaurant business.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and a stock of goods for a restaurant

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca A. is thirty-four years old. She is single and owns and operates a hairdressing saloon. She lost her parents  in childhood and has since depended on her own efforts and skills to make a living. She believes it is an opportune time to expand and wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of raw materials like wigs and extensions, hair pomade, activators, shampoo, etc., to enable her to double her efficiency in serving her customers. At the moment, she is training four apprentices to equip them with skills to make a living. She belongs to the community group called Adoration Trust Group. The group members agree to support each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more hair products like wigs and extensions, shampoos, activators, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and has two children, ages 11 and 2. Veronica owns a small food store and a video show room; she started this business in 2001. Every day, she works from 7 am to 8 pm at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140 from the sales.

Veronica now hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items (rice, beans, and vegetables) for her food sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of more food items (rice, beans, and vegetables) for a sales business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. is fifty years old, married and the mother of three children. She operates a small grocery shop and sells items like bread, pastries, assorted biscuits and drinks. She is very resourceful and supportive of her family’s basic needs. She finances the education of her three children in junior and senior high schools. Hannah believes she can double her sales and income with larger capital. She wants to use the loan to buy additional groceries items to increase her stock. She belongs to the community group called Adoration Trust Group. Members guarantee themselves as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of assorted biscuits and canned soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying Chicks

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is thirty-two years old. She is a wife and the mother of four children, ages fourteen, ten, six and three. She retails food items like plantain, tomatoes, avocados, pears and fresh fish. Comfort dreams of owning her own shop to help the sale of her products and also provide good security. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of plantains, fresh fish and vegetables to increase her sales and income. She believes with increased working capital she can expand her business to materialize her dream. She belongs to the community group called Love Trust Group. Group members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fresh fish, vegetables, and plantains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purshase Stock

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana A. is forty-two years old. She is married with three children. She is industrious and very supportive of her family. She sells maize and smoked fish. She gets her supplies from Accra, a town 85 km away, and retails to her customers. The price of maize increases daily due to the recent food crisis and it drains her profits when she buys in bids. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize to enable her to sell at increased profit. She believes with increased income, she can expand her business. She belongs to the community group called Adoration Trust Group. Members agree to support each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and fresh fish.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate A. is fifty-two years old. She is married with eight children. Three of the children are currently in school. She has been selling smoked fish for the past fourteen years. Kate believes in hard work and dedication. She has been financing her children’s educations with income from her business. She deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more boxes of fish to increase sales and income. She belongs to the community group called Adoration Trust Group. The group agrees in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael A. is twenty-seven years old. She is a wife and the mother of two children. She has been a retailer of smoked and fresh fish for four years now. She enjoys selling and takes pride in serving her customers with assorted fishes for their afternoon and evening meals, and many homes enjoy her fish. Rachael believes she can increase sales and income with increased working capital. She wants to use the loan to buy more boxes of fish for her business operation to reach additional customers. She belongs to the community group called Adoration Trust Group. The group members guarantee each other, as social collateral, to repay the loan. Rachael's photo was taken during the group's meeting.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fresh fish

loans.name: Please

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 20 years old and is single woman with 1 child, age 7 years old. Mwanahamis is a vegetables selller, she started in 2006. Can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is single woman with 1 child, age 9 years old. Mwanahamis is a vegetables selller, she started in 2006. Can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Mwajabu's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu is 24 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 4. Mwajabu has been a clothes seller since 2006. Everyday, she works from 9am to 5pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Catherine, who owns a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa S. is 58 years old, married, and a member of the village bank of Niaguiss Néma in Ziguinchor. She buys palm oil and lemons at the weekly market and also fresh fish, which she transforms into smoked fish in Agnack. Awa goes to sell these products in Dakar. She has significant experience in this business, which she has run for several years. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Awa S., 58 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Niaguiss Néma à Ziguinchor. Elle achète de l’huile de palme et du citron dans les marchés hebdomadaires et le poisson frais qu’elle transforme en poisson fumé à Agnack. Awa va vendre ses produits à Dakar. Elle a une bonne expérience de cette activité qu’elle mène depuis des années. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, lemons, fresh fish, and wood

loans.name: Sarah Babirye's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is the leader of this group of 4 members. She is 42 years old and married with 4 children. They are aged 24, 20, 18, and 16. Two of them are in school. The community she lives in is semi urban.

Sarah's main challenge is residing and working in an area that is prone to floods in the rainy season. There is a ready market for her products because Bwaise is a slum that is highly populated.

She has been using the loans for paying school dues, increasing stock, and contributing to the welfare of her family. She managed to buy a refrigerator in which she keeps the drinks.

She plans to buy a plot of land and put up a house.

Sarah has paid back more than 10 loans.

loans.use: She plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph P. is a photographer. He is divorced and has 2 children. He wants to improve his services to his customers.

He is asking for additional capital to buy more photo materials to improve his services to attract more clients.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more photo materials to improve his services to attract more clients

loans.name: Magreth's Azimio Group

texts.en:
Magreth is 35 years old and is a divorced woman with 2 children, ages 16 and 12. She also take care of 1 other person, age 60. Magreth has owned a small restaurant and has been a charcoal seller since 1998. Everyday, she works from 6.30am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Oliva, who owns a general store.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and more restaurants items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Dianké

texts.fr:
Dianké B. is 44 years old, married with 6 children, and has been a member of the village bank of Yamatogne for 5 years. She has a canteen at the Saint Maure market in Ziguinchor, where she sells cloth, suitcases, and bags. Her income allows her to help her husband in meeting their household expenses. Dianké wants to strengthen her business and is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Dianké B., 44 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants est membre du banc villageois de Yamatogne depuis 5 ans. Elle a une cantine au niveau du marché Saint Maure à Ziguinchor ou elle vend des tissus, des valises et des sacs. Ses revenus lui permettent d’aider son mari dans l’entretien de la famille. Dianké veut renforcer son commerce et sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy cloth, suitcases, and bags to outfit her canteen

loans.name: Zubeda's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Zubeda is 38 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 18,14,9 and 4. Zubeda has been a artificial flowers and decoration seller since 2005. Everyday, she works from 9am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more decorations items and artificial flowers for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in clothes sales, sewing, shoes sales, charcoal and soap sales and the restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy more decoration items and artificial flower for her business.

loans.name: Beat Nassali's Group

texts.en:
Beat is the leader of this group of 5 members. She is 65 years old and divorced. She has 8 children who are working and 28 grandchildren, some of whom she pays school dues for. The community she lives in is semi urban.

Some of the challenges are lack of enough space for all her businesses and disease outbreaks, which sometimes kill many of her chickens.

She was able to pay school dues for her children and is now paying for grandchildren. She also constructed 2 chicken houses.

She plans to increase her stock, start rearing pigs, and acquire a bigger piece of land in order to expand her business.

Beat has successfully paid back more than 15 loans.

loans.use: She plans to increase her stock, start rearing pigs, and acquire a bigger piece of land.

loans.name: Safia's Jiamini Group

texts.en:
Safia is 30 years old and is a widowed woman with 4 children, ages16, 10, 7 and 4. Safia owns a small restaurant, which she started in 1998. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $100 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to perform maintainance of her restaurant. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in charcoal sales, fish sales, chicken sales and storekeeping.

loans.use:
For maintenance and repairs of her restaurant.




For maintainance of her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Her biggest plan is to educate all her children.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 13 and 7. Salma has been a charcoal and clothes seller since 2000. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $150 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Barbara's Group

texts.en:
Barbara is 50 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 19. Barbara has been a chick seller since 2000. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $150 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more chicks for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Esta and Fidolina, who have businesses dealing in grains sales.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Tabu's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Tabu is 53 years old and is a widowed woman with 2 children, ages 26 and 20. She also take care of 1 other child, age 6. Tabu owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Hadija, Maundu and Monica, who have businesses dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 36 years old and is married with 5 children. She sells food in Kabala town. With her previous loan from SMT, she diversified her business and increased her profit. She would like to expand her business and is requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000 ($350 USD).

Fatmata has been working hard to strengthen her business and increase her profitability. She needs additional capital to further expand her business so that she can continue on with her success.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mantanyaro I Group

texts.en:
Almamy K. is the leader of the Matanyaro l Group. He is 45 years old and is married with 3 children. Being the most educated person in the village, he took the lead to encourage the community to organize themselves, be honest, and work hard to produce more food.

All of the group members are engaged in farming and are requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875 USD), Le.500, 000 ($175 USD) each, for the production of vegetables and rice.

The Mantanyaro I Group is dedicated to the production of healthy vegetables and rice for their families and their village. They need additional capital to purchase the necessary inputs for their farms.

loans.use: To buy supplies for their farms.

loans.name: Hadija Nakakande`s Group

texts.en:
Hadijah N., of Kampala, Uganda, is a food seller and the leader of this group of five women. She is 42 years of age and married, with 7 children aged 21, 20, 19, 16, 14, 12 and 9 years old. Six of them are in school. Hadijah’s main challenges are the unstable prices of the items she sells. Otherwise, there is an available market for her business in this semi-urban community.

A veteran of ten fully repaid loans, Hadijah has used the money for paying school fees, increasing stock and contributing to the welfare of the family. One of her main plans now is to buy a piece of land and put up a house.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land upon which to put up a house.

loans.name: Kankallay Ii Group

texts.en:
Saccoh M. is 55 years old and the father of 6 children. His livelihood depends on farming and he has been farming since he was a boy.

Saccoh and the other 4 members of the group organized themselves so that they can access loans for their farm activities. As the leader of the group. and also village leader, he plays an important role in assuring repayment of the loan, since each member guarantees one another. The group is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875 USD) to expand their farm activities.

The members of the Kankallay II group have strategically organized themselves so that they would be able to access the much needed loans for their farms. This is an achievement for them and shows their committment to the farming enterprises as well as excellence.

loans.use: To expand their farms

loans.name: Arthasallay Group

texts.en: Members of the Arthasallay group need additional funds to buy supplies for planting and maintaining their farms. Wurie C. is the group leader. She is 55 years old and has 5 children. The group of 5 members also work together, helping each other on their farms. The group's aim is to expand their farms and produce rice, vegetables and pigeon peas for consumption and income generation. The group therefore is requesting a loan of Le.2, 500,000 ($875 USD).

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Elsa Felina's Group

texts.es:
Elsa, Maria and August have been members of Banco Comunal Tu Angel Lucy for 2 years, 4 months and 8 months respectively.

Elsa is single and is 38 years old. She produces biscuits and typical sweets made from eggs and cornflour, and sells them as a street-trader at the Santa Clara market.

Maria is married, is 47 years old and has 9 children, 5 of whom live with her. Maria sells vegetables at the 12th April market.

Augusta lives with her partner, is 26 years old and has one daughter. She produces biscuits and bread that is typical of her region, and sells them at the market where she also buys animals, cheese and cereals, which she then sells at the Ayacucho market.

Elsa, Maria and August need a combined loan of $875 to invest in the purchase of flour, sugar, pumpkins, casava and sheep.

Elsa, Maria and August have four dreams: that their children do well in their careers, to have their own homes, to improve their businesses and to upgrade their oven.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa, Maria y Augusta pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy hace 2 años, 4 meses, 8 meses, respectivamente.

Elsa es soltera y tiene 38 años, Elsa elabora biscochos y dulces típicos hechos a base de huevo y harina de maíz, sus productos lo vende de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara.

Por otro lado Maria es casada, tiene 47 años y 9 hijos de los cuales 5 viven con ella, Maria vende verduras en un puesto del mercado 12 de abril.

Mientras que Augusta es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hija, Augusta elabora panes típicos de la zona y biscochos que vende en las ferias y de las ferias compra animales, queso, cereales que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Elsa, Maria y Augusta necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 400 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, azúcar, zapallo, yuca, harina y ganado ovino.

Los sueños de Elsa, Maria y Augusta son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia, mejorar sus negocios y mejorar su horno.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of flour, sugar, pumpkins, casava and sheep.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Songambele Ukonga A Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 58, is divorced with three children, ages 39, 28, and 18. She runs a nursery school and also tutors preschool-aged children on the side. She started her school in 1995 and it brings her a salary of about $230 a month. The school is open from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. daily.

Elizabeth has taken three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she now hopes for a new loan to improve the quality of her school. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members have clothing and general item businesses.

In the picture, Elizabeth is the furthest on the right.

loans.use: To improve the quality of her nursery school.

loans.name: Amanda's Group

texts.es:
Zenaida, Amanda and Maria have been members of Banco Comunal Kuskanchik for 1, 2 and 1 year respectively.

Zanaida is married, is 54 years old and has 8 children. She sells clothes and toys at the various local markets. She also works as a street trader, selling ice cream in one of the streets in the city centre.

Amanda is married, is 52 years old and has 3 children. She sells vegetables at the 12th April market. She also has a grocery in her house.

Maria is married, is 39 years old and has 2 children. She sells clothes at the various local markets. She also works as as street trader, selling food at the Grau market. Zenaida, Amanda and Maria have four dreams: that their sons do well in their careers, to expand their businesses and to prosper in general.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Zenaida, Amanda y Maria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Kuskanchik hace 1, 2, 1 años respectivamente.

Zenaida es casada, tiene 54 años y 8 hijos, Zenaida venD. ropa y juguetes en las diferentes ferias D. la región. Además Zenaida venD. helados D. manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica D. la ciudad.

Por otro lado Amanda es casada, tiene 52 años y 3 hijos, Amanda venD. verduras en el mercado 12 D. abril. Además Amanda tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.

Mientras que Maria es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Maria venD. ropa en las diferentes ferias D. la región. Además Maria venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Grau.

Zenaida, Amanda y Maria necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 750 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pantalones, polos, muñecas, carritos, arroz, azúcar, detergente, huevo, buzos D. niños y ropa interior.

Los sueños D. Zenaida, Amanda y Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales, agrandar su negocios, surtir sus negocios y progresar.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of clothes, polo shirts, manequins, carts, rice, sugar, detergent, eggs, children‘s tracksuits and underwear.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46418

loans.name: Gorret Kibalama`s Group

texts.en:
Gorret K. is the leader of a group of four women in Kampala, Uganda. She is 50 years old and married with six children, all of whom attend school. The community she lives in is urban. Although Gorret has a stall in the market, to increase sales she also conveys her merchandise by foot, selling to neighbors, people in markets, etc. Sometimes she has to sell on credit.

A veteran of more than seven loans, Gorret has been using the money for paying school fees, increasing stock and contributing to the welfare of the family. She plans to open a boutique so she will no longer have to rely on walking from place to place to market her goods.

loans.use: She plans to open a boutique.

loans.name: Konkoba Group

texts.en:
The inhabitants of Kormaslaia village are purely subsistence farmers and are mainly growing vegetables, rice, cassava, sweet potatoes and peas. To ensure food security, many community members are looking for means of increasing food production.

The Konkoba Group, with their leader, Saio K., is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875) to grow rice and peas. They also need the loan to hire labour and purchase fertilizer. Saio M. K., the leader of the group, is 45 years old and married with 4 children.

The members of the Konkoba Group want to increase their yields of rice and peas this year. They need to be able to purchase fertilizers and hire labourers to assist them in the production and harvesting of their farms.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire labourers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma has been a member of Banco Comunal Kuskanchik for 3 years.

Vilma is 28 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. Vilma used to sell food but has her revenue dropped, she started selling vegetables at the Santa Berta market, an activity which she als discontinued as it didn‘t generate sufficient income. Vilma currently sells vegetables wholesale at the Ayacucho forest. She buys her goods at the grocery market in the city of Ayacucho and transports them to the forest in a rental car.

Vilma needs a loan of $1,100 to invest in the purchase of celery, carrots, onions, tomatoes and lemons.

She will use her savings to purchase land and build a house. Vilma has three dreams: to have her own car to transport her goods, to develop her business and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik hace 3 años.

Vilma es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Vilma en un inicio vendía comida pero como bajaron sus ingresos cambio de negocio y comenzó a vender verduras en el mercado Santa Berta actividad que dejo de realizar porque no le generaban buenos ingresos. Actualmente Vilma vende verduras al por mayor en la selva ayacuchana, sus productos los adquiere en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo transporta a la Selva en un carro alquilado.

Vilma necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de apio, zanahoria, cebolla, tomate y limones.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para comprar un terreno y construir su casa. Los sueños de Vilma son tener un carro para transportar sus productos, surtir más su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of celery, carrots, onions, tomatoes and lemons

loans.name: Halima's Songambele Ukonga B Group

texts.en:
Halima, age 47, married with three children, has a clothing business which she started in 2003. Working from 2 p.m. until 6 p.m. daily, she makes a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Halima took three loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to pay for family needs such as school fees and clothing. Having repaid these loans, she now hopes for a new one to purchase more clothing to sell and to pay her children's school fees. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members have businesses dealing in fish, milk, clothing, and general item sales.

In the picture, Halima is at the center.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell and to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Allah Nsor Group

texts.en:
Members of the Allah Nsor group are motivated to make a difference. Toh Dusu is the group leader and a very dynamic woman. She is a development-oriented and business-oriented person, who encourages her fellow women to be industrious and cooperative. Dusu is 33 years old and is married with 5 children.

All the group members are farmers and would like to produce rice and vegetables for consumption and for sale. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875 USD) to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds and to hire labourers. In order to have a successful season they need a loan to purchase all their necessary inputs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds and to hire labourers

loans.name: Carmela's Group

texts.es:
Carmela, Yrma and Sonia have been members of Banco Comunal Kuskanchik for 1, 1 and 4 years respectively.

Carmela is 68 years old, is widowed and has 5 children. She works as a street-trader, selling roast pork in a street in the city centre. She also has a grocery store at home.

Yrma is 22 years old and is single. She has a glassworks in rented premises. Together with her sister, she also has a restaurant which is located in a main avenue in the city of Ayacucho.

Sonia is 24 years old, lives with her partner and has one child. She sells meat at the market in Nazarenas.

Carmela, Yrma and Sonia need a group loan of $1,100 to invest in the purchase of sheep, pigs, sugar, rice, tuna and glass.

Carmela, Yrma and Sonia have three dreams: to have their own home, to get married and to expand their business.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Carmela, Yrma y Sonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Kuskanchik hace 1, 1, 4 años respectivamente.
