Carmela es viuda, tiene 68 años y 5 hijos, Carmela venD. carne asada D. cerdo D. manera ambulatoria por una calle céntrica D. la ciudad. Además Carmela tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Yrma es soltera y tiene 22 años, Yrma tiene una Vidriería en un local alquilado. Además Yrma junto a su hermana tiene un restaurante que esta ubicado en una avenida principal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Mientras que Sonia es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Sonia venD. carne en un puesto del mercado Nazarenas.

Carmela, Yrma y Sonia necesitan préstamos D. 1500 soles, 900 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado ovino y porcino, azúcar, arroz, atún y vidrios.

Los sueños D. Carmela, Yrma y Sonia son tener una casa propia, casarse, ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of sheep, pigs, sugar, rice, tuna and glass.

loans.name: Boddy

texts.en:
Boddy S. sells palm oil in Kabala town of Sierra Leone and has been in business for more than 2 years. With her previous loan, her profit increased and she was able to complete the construction of her house.

Now, she would like to expand her business and is requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 ($350 USD). Boddy would like to purchase larger quantities of palm oil for selling so that she can consistently meet her customers demand and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy palm oil to sell

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is a school drop-out. After the death of his father, he assumed the family responsibility and started a small business selling cosmetics. Most of his stock was purchased on credit and he could not make good profits, because he needed to repay the loan weekly.

With his previous loan, he started building his capital and he is looking forward having his own full business capital. He needs a loan of Le.3,000,000 ($1050 USD) to accomplish that. Alhaji is 22 years old.

Alhaji is hopeful that his future is bright. He wants to develop a good strong business for himself and his family. He needs additional business capital to buy more cosmetics with cash to avoid paying the high interest associated with buying on credit.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata sells utensils. With five children, 30-year-old Fatmata needs to work hard to generate enough income to meet their basic needs.

With previous loans, her income increased and she has joined savings clubs, where she saves every week for the future of her children and for possible investments. Fatmata plans to diversify her business and is requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000 ($USD). Fatmata has a plan for her future and needs additional capital to expand her stock of kitchen utensils.

loans.use: To expand her stock of kitchen utensils

loans.name: Wankaia

texts.en:
Wankaia is married with 5 children. She sells food items in the market town of Kabala. She needs to increase her stock of food items for purchasing so that she can consistently meet her clients' demands.

Her business is the main source of income for the family, because her husband is a daily labourer whose income depends on the availability of work. The 36-year-old would like to increase her stock and is requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 ($350 USD).

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Joyce Kagoye`s Group

texts.en:
Joyce K. is the leader of a group of five women. She is 42 years of age and married with four children, three of whom are in school. The community she lives in is semi-urban. The market for Joyce’s merchandise depends on the prices of her commodities, as it is dominated by low-income earners; her biggest challenges therefore are the rising prices of the items she sells. As well, she sometimes experiences shortages of cereals due to poor harvests.

A veteran of more than seven repaid loans, Joyce has been using the money for paying school fees (one of her children is a university graduate), increasing stock and contributing to the welfare of the family. She plans to continue increasing her stock so that she will be able to educate all of her children to university level.

loans.use: To continue increasing her stock .

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga sells spare parts for motorbikes and bicycles, and some building materials. The Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) loan program made it possible for him to diversify the business. Being one of the few spare parts shops in Kabala, the demand for the items is high and many small village retailers buy from him.

Kanga is no requesting a loan of Le.3, 500,000 ($1200) to increase his stock to supply his customers and increase his profit. Kanga is serving a very important customer need in his community. He requires additional capital so that he can continue to meet the needs of all his customers on an ongoing basis.

loans.use: To increase his stock of spare parts

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta is 24 years old and is married with 4 children. She has been in business for 4 years, and with previous loans, her business expanded and she can now purchase 3 bags of dried fish at the same time. She is happy that she contributes tremendously to meeting most of the family's expenses, thus supporting her unemployed husband.

Fanta would like to continue expanding her fish business and is requesting a loan of Le.1, 500,000 ($525 USD). Fanta is pleased that she can earn an income from selling her dried fish. She would like to expand that business and purchase additional bags of fish for selling in the Kabala market.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en: Mr. George O. is married and has 4 children. He lives in Benin City, Nigeria. He is 45 years old. George is involved in the sale of provisions and drinks. He learned this business for 3 years and has been in business since 2005. He needs a loan of $525 to enable him to buy more provisions and drinks to meet the high demands of his customers.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food items

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia A. is 48 years old. She is married with twin boys and 2 girls. She works hard in order to provide a decent living for her family. She sells smoked fish and spices, and many homes enjoy her fish because of good quality and taste. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger quantity of fish and spices to serve her many customers. She believes with increased sales and income, she can provide quality education for her children. She belongs to the community group called Adoration Trust Group. The group members guarantee that each member repays her loans and provides social collateral to repay the loan.
Sophia was at a group meeting when this picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fresh fish

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia A. is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She sells lingerie and other clothing materials. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she sells by hawking. She wants to use the loan to construct a wooden stand in the community market to ease the drudgery of hawking. She hopes this would provide her with a station to enable her to sell more and make a bigger income. She belongs to the community group called Adoration Trust Group. The group members guarantee that each member repays her loans and act as a form of social collateral.

loans.use: To buy more bales of lingerie and other clothing materials

loans.name: Aisha Namuli`s Group

texts.en:
Aisha is the leader of this group of four women. A fish seller, she is 35 years of age and married, with five children whose ages range from 3 to 24. The three youngest are in school and the remaining two are married. The community Aisha lives in is semi-urban. While there is a ready market for her merchandise, one of the challenges she faces is the high transportation costs involved in collecting the fish from the lakeshores and taking them to St Balikuddembe Market.

Aisha’s five previous loans, all of which she repaid, enabled her to pay school fees for her children, increase business by opening a new retail point, and contribute to the running of the home. She now plans to increase her stock and continue educating her children.

loans.use: She plans to increase her stock .

loans.name: Janet Ntege`s Group

texts.en:
Janet is the leader of a group of five women. She is 35 years of age and married with three children, all of whom are in school, aged 16, 14, and 7 years. The community she lives in is semi-urban.
Her main challenges are the hazards of the weather because she conducts her business of paper sales from a verandah in Kampala’s city center.  Otherwise, there is a ready market for her products.  Janet has paid back more than 10 loans which she has used for paying school dues, increasing stock and contributing to the welfare of the family.  

Her biggest plan is to educate all her children.

loans.use: Her biggest plan is to educate all her children.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
The Conima district is Olinda's native village. Olinda is a 26-year-old young mother who, thanks to her effort and willpower, is helping her family get ahead, in partnership with her husband Leonardo. Olinda operates a mobile vegetable cart in the Tupac Amaru market of the city in which she currently lives. When she realized that the income from her business was insufficient to cover her needs, she decided to buy two tricycles that she could rent out in order to obtain extra income to maintain her home and, above all, to educate her two youngest children. Thanks to the investment she made, she is improving her economic situation and hopes to expand her vegetable stall. Olinda believes that with this change, she and her family's quality of life will improve even more.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

El distrito de Conima, es el pueblo natal de Olinda, joven madre de 26 años de edad, que a fuerza de empeño y voluntad viene sacando adelante a su familia junto a su querido esposo Leonardo. Olinda se dedica a la venta de verduras en forma ambulatoria en el mercado Túpac Amaru de la ciudad en la que ahora radica.Al ver que los ingresos que obtenía con su negocio no cubrían todas sus necesidades decidió comprar 2 triciclos para alquilarlos y obtener ingresos extras para el sustento de su hogar y sobre todo para la educación de sus 2 menores hijos.Gracias a la inversión que hizo está logrando mejorar su situación económica y tiene proyectado ampliar su puesto de venta de verduras, Olinda cree que con este cambio mejorará aún más su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Capital increase to improve her workspace

loans.name: If God Agree Group

texts.en:
Fatmata S., the leader of the group is 40 years and married with 3 children. The group members live in Senekedugu village and it is their home land. Faming is their occupation, but they could not grow enough, due to lack of loans to enable them purchase farm inputs.

When Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) introduced agricultural loans for subsistence farmers to increase food production, the group approached the institution for a loan of Le.2, 500,000 ($875 USD) , Le.500,000 ($175 USD) for each member, to purchase farm supplies. Their future plan is to develop an agribusiness.

The group needs to improve their agribusinesses so that they can feed their families and pay for family expenses. In order to do so they need a loan to buy inputs and pay labourers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pay labourers

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.en:
Arcenia Y., 42, is a single woman who has a daughter living abroad. Paraguayans tend to emigrate from Paraguay to countries such as Spain and Argentina in order to produce more income. For these people, there is no other solution than migration, because they cannot find jobs in our country. Remittances are a very important source of income in the whole country. 
Thanks to the money her daughter has sent, Arcenia opened a mini bar-restaurant, where people usually go to have a quick lunch, dinner, or just to have a few drinks. 
Nowadays, the business is running successfully.  Arcenia’s daughter is returning to Paraguay to help her mother with the mini bar-restaurant. Both are saving a considerable amount of money to build their own house in the future. 
The money provided by the credit would be used in order to buy a freezer for the mini bar-restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica N. is 37 years old. She is married with 4 children, and they are in school. She sells used clothes and corn dough. Corn dough is produced from milled maize grains, and it is used to prepare local foods like porridge and banku. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize and bales of used clothes to increase her stock. This she believes can help her to expand her business and make more income. Veronica is a member of the community group called Adoration Trust Group. The group members guarantee that each member repays her loans and act as a form of social collateral.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and bales of used clothes

loans.name: Sinisie Group

texts.en:
Kormaslaia is a village in the Koinadugu district of Sierra Leone where most of the country's vegetables are grown. Sinisi group members have been engaged in vegetable and other food production, but at a very small scale.

Sarah D. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She is the group leader and a very active member of the community.

The group members would like to increase their productivity and are, therefore, requesting for a loan of Le.2, 500,000 ($875 USD) to purchase farm inputs and hire labour. The Sinisie group intends to use the loan to buy inputs and hire labourers that will help them to increase their production of vegetables.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and hire labourers to increase their production of vegetables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a woman who comes from a family of artisans. Thanks to the special gift that she has in her hands, her work is exceeding that done by her parents and coworkers in the city. With great skill and agility, she designs different models of piggy banks and decorative miniature adornments, which will be sold in several weeks at the Puno and Juliaca markets. She and her family are planning to increase production volume, but need your help to buy raw materials like plaster and a wider variety of paint to put the finishing touch on her works of art. She is certain that with your help, her will and hard work she will be able make these plans a reality.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Elizabeth, es una dama que proviene de una familia de artesanos, gracias al especial don que posee en las manos está logrando superar el trabajo que venían realizando sus padres y sus compañeros de labor dentro de su ciudad.En estos momentos con suma destreza y agilidad viene diseñando diferentes modelos de alcancías y adornos decorativos en miniaturas que serán ofertados dentro de algunas semanas en las ferias de las ciudades de Juliaca y Puno.Ella y su familia tienen planeado aumentar el volumen de su producción, pero requieren de tu apoyo para adquirir materia prima como yeso y mayor variedad de pintura que le da el toque final a estas verdaderas obras de arte.Está segura que con tu apoyo, su voluntad y fuerza de trabajo logrará concretar sus planes.

loans.use: Inject capital to increase production

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 46442

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin has always shown himself to be an enterprising young man with a lot of potential for the future. Shortly after graduating from high school, with the support of his beloved mother, he decided to open a dry goods store in an effort to pay for his college studies and reach his dreams of being a great professional. He began with very little merchandise and only sold basic goods, but as requests mounted he began to increase the quantity and variety of his products. Currently, his little bodega serves the needs of hundreds of neighbors; this is why the young entrepreneur has taken his clients' suggestions into consideration and decided to broaden the selection of products he offers.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Edwin, siempre ha demostrado ser una joven emprendedor con muchas proyecciones para su vida futura, poco después de concluir sus estudios secundarios con apoyo de su querida madre decidió abrir su bodeguita de abarrotes con el fin de tener ingresos seguros para cubrir los gastos que demanda la carrera que ahora estudia y así cumplir sus sueños de ser un gran profesional.Inició con poca mercadería y sólo vendiendo insumos de primera necesidad, pero conforme incrementaban sus solicitudes fue ampliando y aumentando la variedad de sus productos, actualmente su bodeguita trata de satisfacer las necesidades de centenares de vecinos, es por ello que este joven emprendedor tomando en cuenta las sugerencias de sus clientes desea aumentar la gama de sus productos.

loans.use: Capital increase to offer a wider selection of products

loans.name: Candido

texts.en:
Candido B. started his own business a few years ago with a loan from his brother. Since then, the business has grown every day. Candido sells chocolates, candies, and tires in a store located in the shopping center of Ciudad del Este. His frequent clients include other sellers in the zone as well as people from town who know about the good quality of his products.

Candido’s family always helps him with the business. The earnings generated by the sales is an essential source of income for the whole family. As a result, Candido’s business has brought many benefits to his family.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of products that include tires and chocolates.

loans.use: Purchase of choclates, candies, and tires.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila is a cheerful, enterprising and hardworking woman. Ever since she started her family, she has strived and persevered in life in order to offer security, peace and wellbeing to her beloved children. For this reason, she has worked doing innumerable activities to earn extra income to add to her husband's and thus has improved her quality of life and that of her beloved family. Currently, as her teenage children begin high school, her household spending has increased and therefore she saw the need to increase her income. With this in mind, she decided to open a store to sell cell phones, the indispensible communication tool that earns her important income. Cirila sees a great deal of need for these devices among the general population. She hopes to acquire phones in greater quantities in order to keep them in stock, and also begin to sell recharge cards for cell phones.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Cirila, es una alegre, emprendedora y trabajadora mujer. Desde que formó su familia sólo tenía en mente esforzarse y perseverar en la vida para ofrecerles seguridad, tranquilidad y bienestar a sus queridos hijos, es por ello que trabajó en innumerables actividades para generar ingresos económicos adicionales a los de su esposo y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su amada familia.Actualmente con sus hijos adolescentes iniciando estudios secundarios se incrementaron los gastos de su hogar, es por ello que se ve en la necesidad de aumentar aún más sus ingresos económicos, con ese proyecto en mente decidió abrir su tienda de venta de teléfonos celulares, herramienta indispensable de comunicación que le genera importantes ingresos.Percibiendo gran acogida de la población por estos equipos, Cirila tiene pensado adquirirlos en mayor cantidad para tenerlos en stock y adicionalmente a esto vender tarjetas de recarga para celulares.

loans.use: Increase capital to acquire more cell phone brands and models

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos G., 47, is married to Margarita Cubilla and is the father of four university-age children. Five years ago, Carlos started selling outfits house-by-house in his neighborhood. The business did not succeed, but Carlos did not give up. He continued looking for business opportunities. That is when he saw one--he realized that the maize market was a very profitable business in the area. So, five years ago, Carlos decided to buy maize and then sell it to his customers.

Carlos’ family is very close and they all help him run the business. Carlos wants to buy a motorcycle to cover more regions and thus increase the number of sales. With this increase in earnings, he would bring prosperity to his family by sending his sons to college.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of maize to its further sales.

loans.use: Purchase of maize (corn)

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Despite of being quite old, Celso Martinez (65) has the energy of a young boy and works very hard every day. Celso is married to Lidia Godoy and the couple has four sons, each one of them married living with his own family.

Since 1999, Celso has run his own business. He owns a Despensa (grocery store), where he sells everything from food and drinks to cleaning products for the house. Despensas are considered a very profitable investment in Paraguay, since it is like a tradition to buy things from a Despensa.

The Despensa gave Celso the money to invest in his sons’ education. From his point of view, education is the main tool to reaching prosperity.

Nowadays, Celso’s sons are older and each one of them is on his own way. So Celso works very hard for himself; he loves to feel active and do not want to depend on his son’s income. Celso says that he deserves a good quality of life.

The money provided by KIVA will be used for the purchase of products for Celso’s Despensa. Products include: sugar, oil, rice, pasta, cereals, and flour.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, oil, rice, pasta, and cereals.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce K. is 40 years old. She is a wife and mother of 3 children, who are in school. She sells clothing materials, female slippers, and dressing bags. Joyce is very hard working and a good homemaker too. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of clothing materials, dressing bags, and female slippers. She wants to make use of this opportunity to expand her business and increase her family income. She belongs to the community group called Adoration Trust Group. The group members guarantee that each member repays her loans and provide social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of clothing materials, dressing bags, and female slippers

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando is a young man who, from a very young age, supported his father in raising livestock and buying and selling red meat. Now that he has decided to join his father in pursuing his passion he hopes to turn the business into the most prosperous of its kind in his native Santa Rosa. This 25-year-old father buys lambs and alpacas on market days in his small village. He then feeds and fattens them before killing them to sell their fresh, nutritious meat. This business, which he runs along with his wife, allows him to improve his day-to-day quality of life and that of his beloved children. At this time, after evaluating the demand for his business, Fernando turns to your generous heart to help him increase his investment and, through his hard work and your support, improve his economic situation.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Fernando, es un muchacho que desde muy pequeño apoyó a su padre en su actividad de producción de ganado y compra y venta de carnes rojas. Ahora que ha decidido unirse a su gran amor anhela convertir su negocio en el más próspero de su tierra natal Santa Rosa.Este joven padre de 25 años de edad compra corderos y alpacas los días de feria en su pueblito, luego de alimentarlas y engordarlas debidamente procede a degollarlas para vender su fresca y nutritiva carne, este negocio en el que se desempeña junto a su esposa le permite mejorar día a día su condición de vida y la de sus queridos hijos.En estos momentos, evaluando la demanda que existe en su negocio recurre a tu generoso corazón para que le permitas aumentar el monto de su inversión y así con su esfuerzo y tu apoyo mejorar su situación económica.

loans.use: Increase wokring capital

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46449

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es:
Danilo, who is the oldest of 4 siblings, has been enterprising, diligent and collaborated well with others since he was a child, virtues which he inherited from his dear parents who always struggled to improve their lives and offer educational opportunities to their children. Approximately 3 years ago Danilo, seeing the need of his family, proposed to his father the idea of opening a veterinary store is their hometown of Santa Rosa and together they now offer a wide variety of food and medicine for animals. This little store is very busy because it is one of the few businesses that exists in their city. But now, observing the great number of requests they have received, they see the need to expand their products with the goal of pleasing their loyal and demanding customers and he requests a loan in order to expand their offerings.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Danilo, es el mayor de 4 hermanos, desde niño fue muy colaborador, emprendedor y diligente, esas virtudes las heredó de sus queridos padres que siempre lucharon par salir adelante y ofrecerles estudios superiores a sus hijos.Hace aproximadamente 3 años, Danilo viendo la necesidad de su familia propuso a su padre abrir una tienda veterinaria en su pueblo natal Santa Rosa y ahora en sociedad ofrecen una inmensa variedad de alimentos y medicamentos para animales. Esta tiendita es muy concurrida porque es uno de los pocos espacios que existe en su ciudad, pero ahora, observando la gran cantidad de solicitudes se ve en la necesidad de aumentar sus productos con el propósito de complacer a sus fieles y exigentes clientes solicita un préstamo para ampliar sus ofertas.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy has always felt a special love for animals and agricultural work, which is why he decided to stay in his birthplace, Santa Rosa, and make a living from what he learned and inherited from his father, cattle production. He is married to Vianet, a very enterprising and diligent woman, and they have two wonderful children who have become their greatest happiness and reason for their labors. This happy couple has dedicated their lives to the care and feeding of their cows that generously provide them with around 40 liters of nutritious milk, which is used for the production of delicious cheeses. This creative and enterprising father also would like to produce yogurt, for which he requires materials and tools for transformation to this nutritious product. With the sale of these products he will obtain extra income to ensure the welfare of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Willy, siempre ha sentido un especial cariño por los animales y el trabajo en el campo, es por ello que decidió quedarse en su pueblo natal Santa Rosa y sacarle provecho a la actividad que aprendió y heredó de su padre, la producción de ganado.Actualmente está casado con Vianet, quien es una mujer muy emprendedora y diligente, fruto de su amor nacieron 2 encantadores niños quienes se convirtieron en su mayor alegría y la razón de su esfuerzo. Ésta feliz pareja dedica cada uno de sus días al cuidado y alimentación de sus tiernas vaquitas quienes muy generosamente les proveen alrededor de 40 litros de nutritiva leche, que luego de obtenerlas cuidadosamente ofertan para la elaboración de deliciosos quesos.Este creativo y emprendedor padre adicionalmente a su actividad desea elaborar yogurt, para ello requiere obtener insumos y herramientas para la transformación de este nutritivo producto y con la venta de estos productos obtener ingresos extras para el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Injection of capital to establish a new economic activity

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia, is the second of 6 siblings, and as an exemplary daughter and sister she decided to help her humble mother in the purchase and sale of delicious cheeses. This small but indispensable occupation is allowing her to cover the most urgent needs of her dear family. She is 23 years old and acquires her merchandise from the industrious residents of her hometown of Santa Rosa in order to sell them in the markets of Cuzco and Arequipa, where she already has a guaranteed clientele to whom to sell her nutritious and tasty cheeses. Seeing the demand that exists for her merchandise she has decided to increase the amount of her investment, but she does not have enough capital to solidify her plans. She wishes to gain help from your generous and noble heart through your loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Yesenia, es la segunda de 6 hermanos, como hija y hermana ejemplar decidió apoyar a su humilde madre en el negocio de compra y venta de deliciosos quesos, este pequeño pero indispensable ocupación le está permitiendo cubrir sus necesidades más urgentes y la de su querida familia.Tiene 23 años de edad y adquiere su mercadería de los laboriosos pobladores de su ciudad natal Santa Rosa para ofertarlos en los mercados de los departamentos de Cuzco y Arequipa, en donde ya tiene clientela asegurada a quien vender su nutritivos y agradables quesos. Ahora, viendo la demanda que existe por su mercadería decidió aumentar el monto de inversión, pero no cuenta con suficiente capital para concretar sus planes y desea alcanzar la ayuda de tu bondadoso y noble corazón a través de un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to be able to offer a greater quantity of cheeses.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
The little village of Santa Rosa is a true Eden for agriculture and cattle production and Juanita’s family improves their lives and gets the greatest benefits possible from mother nature. In the company of her beloved husband she works in agriculture, cattle production, and cheese production, which is her latest economic activity thanks to the milk that her sweet calves produce. Her performance of these noble activities allows her to offer security, well-being and education to her 7 dear children, who are the motor that pushes her to move forward. While Santiago takes care of the animals with the help of their children, Juanita works selling the delicious cheeses that she produces with much care and patience for the satisfaction of her clients’ tastes. Now this happy couple would like to buy a calf to expand their milk supply in order to increase the volume of their cheese production.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

El pueblito de Santa Rosa, es un verdadero Edén para la agricultura y ganadería, la familia de doña Juanita sale adelante y saca el mayor provecho posible a la madre naturaleza. Ella en compañía de su amado esposo se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y a la producción de quesos ésta última actividad gracias a la leche que les genera sus tiernas vaquitas. Su desempeño en estas nobles actividades le permiten ofrecer seguridad, bienestar y educación a sus 7 queridos hijos, quienes son el motor que los impulsa a salir adelante.Mientras Santiago con apoyo de sus hijos se dedica al cuidado de sus animalitos, doña Juanita se dedica a vender los deliciosos quesos que elabora con sumo cuidado y paciencia para la satisfacción del paladar de sus clientes.Ahora ésta feliz pareja con el fin de aumentar la cantidad de leche para acrecentar el volumen de su producción de quesos desea comprar una vaquita.

loans.use: To purchase a calf.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46453

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene A. is 31 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 children, who are in school. She trades in multiple products, which include cosmetics, maize, meat, and vegetables. She is convinced that the sale of multiple items can enable her to generate more income as a result of variety. She wants to use the loan to buy more cosmetic products, maize, and meat to increase her stock and make more income. Irene is a member of the community group called Adoration Trust Group. The group members guarantee that each member repays her loans and provide social collateral to repay the loan. Irene was at a group meeting when this photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, meat, vegetables, and some cosmetics

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
After forming her family with Alejandro, Irma, a woman from a humble home, decided to work in trading cattle and the sale of red meats. With great commitment, will and diligence they acquired their cattle (sheep and alpacas) at market days in their birthplace of Santa Rosa and neighboring cities. After fattening them, they sell them at a higher price and in some cases they butcher them to sell the fresh meat in the markets of the city of Cuzco. This activity is allowing them to offer greater security and education to their beloved children. The wish of this couple is to construct their dwelling with the goal of offering their own safe home for their 4 children.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma, es una dama que proviene de un humilde hogar, tras formar su familia junto Alejandro decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado y a la comercialización de carnes rojas. Ambos con sumo empeño, voluntad y diligencia adquieren su ganado (ovejas y alpacas) los días de feria de su pueblo natal Santa Rosa y ciudades limítrofes, luego de engordarlas las venden a mayor precio y en algunos casos las degollan para vender su fresca carne en los mercados de la ciudad de Cuzco, con esta actividad están brindándoles seguridad y educación a sus amados hijos.El deseo de esta pareja es construir su morada, con el fin de ofrecerles un techo propio y seguro a sus 4 hijos.

loans.use: To increase working capital to be able to offer a greater quantity of animals.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46455

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is a diligent and exemplary mother of 10 children, 4 of them still minors and dependents. Like her husband, she persistently works hard in her daily activities so that their children do not experience economic limitations; thanks to the good example that they inculcated in their children they work hard in their studies and in their free hours they help their parents in their respective economic activities. While her loyal husband works raising cattle, Alejandrina diligently and patiently makes crafts and creates decorations from sheep skin with her children’s help. Everything was going fine in her family and her daily activities when unfortunately one unexpected day her youngest daughter had a tragic accident. Since then, her entire family has worked to pay for the medications that her daughter requires. At this time, Alejandrina turns to your heart and solidarity to ask for a loan to purchase the raw materials required to continue creating her excellent crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina, es una diligente y ejemplar madre D. 10 hijos, 4 D. ellos aún menores D. edad y dependientes, ella al igual que su esposo se esfuerza persistentemente en sus actividades cotidianas, con el fin D. que sus retoños no pasen limitaciones económicas; gracias al buen ejemplo que inculcaron en sus hijos les corresponden debidamente en sus estudios y en sus horas libres les apoyan en sus respectivas actividades.Mientras su fiel esposo se dedica a la ganadería doña Alejandría diligente y pacientemente con apoyo D. sus hijos se dedica a la artesanía y elabora hermosos adornos a base D. cuero D. oveja.Todo marchaba bien en su familia y en su actividad diaria, desafortunadamente un inesperado día la menor D. sus hijas sufrió un trágico accidente, desD. entonces con apoyo D. toda su familia se desvela trabajando para cubrir los medicamentos que requiere su querida hija.En estos momentos, doña Alejandrina recurre a tu solidario corazón para pedirte un préstamo con el propósito D. comprar materia prima para seguir elaborando sus excelentes trabajos.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of raw materials.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
The business of buying and selling groceries is profitable for Eusebia, an intelligent young entrepreneur. Eusebia is an industrious 26 year old who has dedicated herself to this work since she finished high school. She buys merchandise in the city of Juliaca for distribution among the various small stores in her hometown of Santa Rosa. She also works as a cashier in the municipality of Santa Rosa and with these two jobs she is able to support her parents and 3 younger siblings. She is now turning to you and hopes to receive your support.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes le resulta muy rentable a Eusebia, joven inteligente, emprendedora y hacendosa de 26 años de edad que desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios viene dedicándose a esta labor.Ella adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Juliaca para distribuirlas al por mayor a las diferentes bodeguitas de su pueblito natal Santa Rosa.Adicionalmente a esta labor trabaja como cajera en la municipalidad de dicho pueblito y con estas dos actividades está logrando apoyar económicamente a sus padres y a sus 3 menores hermanos.En esta oportunidad recurre a vosotros con la esperanza de recibir tu apoyo y le permitas aumentar el monto de su inversión.

loans.use: Increased capital to purchase a larger quantity of products.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 46457

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa is a humble and persevering mother of 5 children. In spite of her age she continues to grow her business in vegetable sales in the small towns around her native city of Juliaca. While this diligent and enterprising mother dedicates her time to her business, her hard-working husband drives a bicycle taxi. Thanks to their combined labors, they were able to purchase their home. Now that they have been able to fulfill their parental duties, they'd like to invest in the repair of their home. It is with this proposal they ask you for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Justa es una humilD. y perseverante madre D. 5 hijos, a pesar D. su avanzada edad sigue desarrollando su negocio D. venta D. verduras en los pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad natal Juliaca.Mientras esta diligente y emprendedora madre se dedica a este negocio su laborioso esposo trabaja brindando servicios D. movilidad en su pequeña herramienta D. transporte (triciclo), gracias al esfuerzo D. ambos finalmente pudieron adquirir su pequeña vivienda y ahora que ya cumplieron con su deber D. padres desean invertir en la refacción D. su domicilio, con ese propósito recurren a ti para solicitarte un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase work capital to increase their sales and start to repair their home.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Coumba C. is 45 years old, married with 9 children and 4 other family members in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané Viviane Wade in the Kolda region for the past 5 years. To promote her business selling peanut paste and catering, she wants to buy bags of peanuts to make peanut paste and to obtain a supply of rice and condiments for the preparation of ready-to-sell platters. Her income will allow her to contribute to the well-being of her family. The loan requested will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Coumba C. 45 ans, mariée, 09 enfants et 04 autres personnes de sa famille en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané Viviane Wade dans la région de Kolda depuis 5 ans. Pour promouvoir son activité de vente de pâte d’arachide et de restauration, elle veut acheter des sacs d’arachide pour faire de la pâte d’arachide et s’approvisionner en riz et condiments pour la préparation des plats à vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer au bien être familial. Le prêt sollicité sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, peanuts, and condiments

loans.name: Damas Unidas De Remancito Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program run by Fundación Paraguaya that targets groups of enterprising women. These women create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to perform economic activities that enable them to live with dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. Moreover, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women committee members the energy and motivation to reach success.

In a remote area of Ciudad del Este called B Remancito, Alicia Gomez contacted her friends and neighbors and told them about the committee. She shared with these women her desire to change their world for the better by working very hard. Alicia’s hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a committee.

The group includes 18 women with the following businesses: Despensas (grocery stores, a very profitable market in Paraguay, since we consider it a tradition to buy from a Despensa), sewing workshops, and businesses selling clothing, cosmetics, bijouterie, and cutlery. Their target customers are the other women in the area that know and admire them. The committee is well-known in the town and everybody tries to help them by buying their products.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of products such as: clothing, cosmetics, fabrics, thread, elastic bands, sugar, oil, pasta, cereals, milk, and cutlery.

loans.use: purchase of products such as: clothing, cosmetics, fabrics, thread, elastic bands, sugar, oil, pasta, cereals, milk and cutlery.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente comes from a humble family, but has a strong will to better himself. With hard work and dedication he finished his technical degree in dental prothesis. Thanks to his outstanding grades and vast knowledge base he easily gained recognition for his dental firm. Now he is happy with his work and has high aspirations. Vicente would like to purchase materials and tools to improve his work and clients’ satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Vicente, proviene de una familia humilde pero con mucha voluntad para salir adelante, con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo concluir sus estudios técnicos de prótesis dental, gracias a sus destacadas notas y a su amplio conocimiento y entrega en su labor fácilmente encontró reconocimiento en su consultorio dental.Actualmente se siente muy contento con su puesto de trabajo, por lo que tiene muchos proyectos de vida, Vicente tiene pensado adquirir materiales y herramientas de trabajo con el fin de mejorar su trabajo y sentir la satisfacción de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to continue his work.

loans.name: Proyecto Rima Group

texts.en:
Yoni is a 39-year old woman who lives in a very poor community called Proyecto Rima, or Project Rima, on the outskirts of the capital Santo Domingo.

Yoni is a Haitian immigrant, and lives with her husband and four children in a small home.  She recently started a small business selling fresh fruit to her community members She is requesting a loan so that she has can buy larger quantities of higher quality fruit and travel to heavily transited areas to sell her wares.  In the Dominican Republic, it is very common for people to buy pieces of fresh fruit on the corners as they walk to work, their homes, or simply when they are out and about.  The money from this loan will help her make more money by enabling her to sell in a different location and  to buy enough fruit to meet the demand she will face.

She hopes that her business will continue to grow with the help of this loan, and that with the profits she realizes, she will be able to help her children study more.  It is her goal to always have a steady job, and to always work to provide for her family.
 
On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Yoni herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To purchase of higher quality fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
to purchase cloth for re-sale

CE FONDS LUI PERMET D'ACHETER DU TISSU POUR LE REVENDRE

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is an examplary woman, and very dedicated to her family. She’s known the value of hard work since childhood, as she comes from a humble home and was required to earn her keep at a very young age. Now she is a caring mother and hard-working spouse, putting her all into each activity. She sells clothing and beautiful weavings and accessories. With these jobs she earns essential income for her beloved family. Elena would like more than anything to provide security, stability, and education for her children. She is sure that expanding her handicrafts business would considerably improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena, es una dama ejemplar y consagrada a su familia, desde niña sabe el verdadero valor del trabajo, ya que proviene de un humilde hogar y la necesidad la obligó a ganarse el sustento diario desde muy pequeña.Actualmente es una madre cariñosa y una laboriosa esposa, que trata de poner su mayor esfuerzo y voluntad a cada una de las actividades que realiza como: la venta de ropa americana y hermosos tejidos de prendas de vestir, con estos trabajos genera indispensables ingresos económicos para su querida familia.El deseo de esta valiosa dama es brindarle seguridad, estabilidad y educación a sus queridos hijos, esta segura que ampliando su negocio de artesanía mejorará considerablemente sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Increased capital to purchase a wider variety of products

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46464

loans.name: Palave En Accion Group

texts.en:
Nancy is a 36-year old woman who lives with her husband and three children in the community of Palave, a small and impoverished area on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo.

Nancy has a small business selling shoes and clothes to her community. She is requesting a loan so she can have enough capital to buy more merchandise in bulk, and  be able to better meet the needs of her clients.  Without the loan, she is limited in her ability to buy enough merchandise to earn marginal amounts of money that don’t allow her the room to invest in her business, much less accrue savings for her family.

She hopes this loan will help her move her life forward, so that by the end of the year she will be able to have a much bigger business, help proviD. better education and school supplies to her three children, and maybe even save enough money so that she and her husband will be able to buy their own home.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Nancy herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To invest in the expansion of her shoes and clothing business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Mrs. Resalía belongs to the Community Bank Villa Turística de Catac II, and is dedicated to the sale of clothes and stuffed animals. Her business is located in her house in the district of Catac of the province of Recuay and “departamento” of Ancash.

With a loan of S/. 700,00 soles (US $275.00), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy three dozen stuffed animals, two dozen polo shirts for women, and a half-dozen pairs of slippers.

She is 25 years old, single, and with the profits she makes she will help her parents with the household expenses. La señora Resalía, pertenece al Banco Comunal Villa Turística de Catac II, se dedica a la venta de ropas y peluches, su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio del distrito de Catac y provincia de Recuay, departamento de Ancash.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Con el préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses , comprará 3 docenas de peluches, 2 docenas de polos para damas, ½ docena de zapatillas. Ella tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, con las ganancias obtenidas ayuda a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
to purchase thread wholesale for re-sale retail

ACHETER DES FILES AU GROSSISTE ET LE REVENDRE EN DETAIL

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Florencia belongs to the Community Bank San Martín de Porras and is dedicated to the sale of cosmetics. Her business is located in her house in the district and province of Huaraz, in the “departamento” of Ancash.

With the loan of S/. 1,500.00 soles (US $550.00), which will be paid in 8 months, she will buy perfumes, deodorants, colognes and cooking supplies.

She is 47 years old, married and has four children. Her husband has temporary work and they both work to support the expenses of the home.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Florencia, pertenece al Banco Comunal San Martín de Porras, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, su negocio sé ubicado en su domicilio en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 8 meses, comprará perfumes, desodorantes, colonias, servicios de cocina. Ella tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo tiene trabajos eventuales y ambos se apoyan con los gastos de hogar.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: El Buen Futuro ( A Good Future) Group

texts.en:
Silverina lives with her two children and husband in a small rural town in the Dominican Republic.  She runs a small business selling new and used clothes from her home, and occasionally she sells her merchandise on the streets of her community.  She also sells gasoline by the gallon to her community members -- people often buy gasoline in smaller quantities here because  it is so expensive -- which is a profitable business.

She is requesting a loan to buy a better selection of clothes to sell, and a to buy a larger quantity of gasoline.  It is her goal to own her own store where she can sell a variety of clothes, and operate a real gas station.

She hopes her children will continue studying and that within a few years she will have saved enough to buy their own home.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Silverina herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To invest in the improvement of her used and new clothing business

loans.name: Natividad Adela

texts.es:
Mrs. Natividad belongs to the Community Bank “Mujeres al Progreso,” or Women for Progress, and is dedicated to the sale of bread and cakes. Her stand is located in the central market of the district and province of Yungay, in the “departamento” of Ancash. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 soles (US $375.00), which will be repaid in six months, she will buy 15 sacks of flour and 3 boxes of butter. She is 56 years old, married and has five children. Her income allows her to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Natividad pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, se dedica a la venta D. panes y pasteles, su puesto D. venta esta ubicado en el mercado central del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará: 15 sacos D. harina y 3 cajas D. manteca. Ella tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada tiene 5 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for the preparation of her products

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda is originally from the district of Putina, but since starting a family she has lived in Juliaca. Her only source of income is the carpenter’s workshop her husband inherited. Since acquiring the shop, Nilda has focused all her effort, creativity and patience on design of each individual piece of fine furniture she manufactures.

Given her children’s small bedrooms and her limited workspace, Nilda needs to expand and refurbish her home. With this goal in mind she is trying to save enough money and finalize plans. She is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase a greater number of raw materials to continue making wonderful furniture. Not too long after that she also plans to finish refurbishing her home.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

Nilda, es natural del distrito de Putina, desde que formó su familia decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, teniendo el único medio de sustento en su taller de carpintería que por herencia adquirió su esposo. Desde entonces pone su mayor esfuerzo creatividad y paciencia en cada una de las piezas que elabora para el diseño de sus exclusivos muebles.

En esta oportunidad observando la incomodidad de sus hijos por el reducido espacio de sus habitaciones y el pequeño espacio de su taller se ve en la necesidad de ampliar y refaccionar su vivienda, con ese objetivo en mente se esfuerza para ahorrar lo suficiente y concretar sus planes y solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima y seguir fabricando sus excelentes muebles, y en un tiempo no muy lejano terminar de refaccionar su morada.

loans.use: Increased capital to continue making furniture

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Economic hardship and hunger have motivated Maritza to work hard and persistently all her life. Her efforts have resulted in operating a notions store, which also has enabled her to increase her income and provide for the education and well being of her children.

A selfless and diligent mother, Maritza sells notions (e.g., buttons, thread, ribbons, etc.) at local fairs in towns neighboring her hometown of Juliaca. Her business activity has improved her quality of life. Unfortunately, a week ago a large part of her merchandise was stolen. The incident has jeopardized her children’s future, as Maritza is no longer able to earn an income to support her family. For this reason Maritza is turning to your generosity and asking for your support in recovering from this horrible incident.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

La necesidad y el hambre la incentivaron a esforzarse y a perseverar en su actividad de toda la vida. Su negocio de venta de mercería fue posible gracias a su esfuerzo y le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos económicos, la educación y el bienestar de sus queridos hijos.

Esta abnegada y diligente madre vende sus mercaderías los días de feria en los diferentes pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad natal Juliaca, gracias a ello ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida, desafortunadamente hace una semana sufrió el robo de una buena cantidad de mercadería, en estos momentos sus hijos se ven perjudicados con este incidente, porque ya no está logrando obtener buenas ganancias para el sustento de su hogar, es por ello que doña Maritza recurre a tu generoso corazón para solicitar tu apoyo y recuperarse de este desagradable suceso.

loans.use: Infusion of capital to relaunch her business

loans.name: Vilma Hermelinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Vilma belongs to the Community Bank “Mujeres al Progreso,” or Women for Progress, and sells groceries. Her stand is located in the central market of the district and province of Yungay, in the “departamento” of Ancash.

With a loan of S/. 3,000,000 soles (US $1,100.00), which will be repaid in eight months, she will buy 6 cans of oil, 10 sacks of rice, 15 sacks of sugar.

She is 43 years old, separated, and has four children, working by herself to move her children forward.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Vilma pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su puesto de venta esta ubicado en el mercado central del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará 6 latas de aceite, 10 sacos de arroz, 15 sacos de azúcar. Ella tiene 43 años de edad, es separada, tiene 4 hijos sola trabaja para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a modest mother. Since starting her family and becoming a widow, she has worked constantly and in different jobs with the goal of supporting her children financially. She feels very proud and fulfilled now that her kids are living on their own.

Despite her age, Juana feels she has enough strength to continue as a street vendor of little candies at the Mariano Melgar market in Juliaca. Thanks to her little business, Juana has been able to afford her basic needs. However, she believes that enhancing the number of goods she sells will increase her income even more. That’s why she is reaching out for your generosity and awaiting your reply.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

Juana, es una humilde madre. Desde que formó su familia y enviudó, trabajó constantemente y en diversas labores con el fin de que sus hijos no pasen limitaciones económicas, ahora que sus retoños ya son independientes se siente orgullosa y realizada como madre.

Doña Juana pese a su avanzada edad siente que tiene suficiente fortaleza para seguir desenvolviéndose en su actividad de venta de golosinas en forma ambulatoria dentro del mercado Mariano Melgar de la ciudad de Juliaca.Gracias a este pequeño negocio está logrando cubrir sus necesidades más urgentes, pero esta diligente madre cree que aumentando su mercadería mejorarán aún más sus ingresos, es por ello que toca vuestros generosos corazones para recibir tu respuesta.

loans.use: Additional capital to offer a greater number of products

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne P. est âgée de 38 ans et mariée. Elle opère en salon de coiffure à Adèta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle coiffe, tresse et lave les cheveux de beaucoup de femmes dans la localité. Son salon de coiffure est très populaire dans cette ville. Pour cette raison, elle désire ce crédit pour agrandir son établissement de beauté. Spécialement avec ce premier crédit, elle veut acheter les produits de beauté (mèches, tissages, perruques, savons liquides etc.…) afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle a tenté sa chance pour améliorer sa vie

loans.use: Acheter les produits de beauté

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Mrs. Daysi belongs to the Community Bank “Mujeres al Progreso,” or Women for Progress. She is dedicated to the sale of groceries and her business is located in the central road of the district and province of Yungay, in the “departamento” of Ancash.

With a loan of S/. 1,500.00 soles (USD 550) which will be repaid in four months, she will buy 50 packages of 3-liter sodas, thirty boxes of biscuits and ten dozen yogurts.

She is 38 years old, married and has three children. Her husband supports her in this business, distributing groceries at home; they work together to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Daysi, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su negocio esta ubicado en la carretera central del distrito de Yungay, provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 50 paquetes de gaseosa de 3 litros, 30 cajas de galletas y 10 docenas de yoguth. Ella tiene 38 años de edad, es casada tiene 3 hijos, su esposo la apoya en este negocio, distribuyendo abarrotes a domicilio, ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her small store

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald is a diligent and enterprising father. Since starting a family, he has persevered in his trade of carpentry. With the support his loyal and loving wife, he is managing to build beautiful and distinctive furniture. This happy couple cherishes their young child, who is their greatest motivation. Currently, Ronald and his family are living with his sister at whose home he opened his carpentry workshop where he gets many orders. He has a problem because he does not have enough raw materials to fulfill his orders, which is the reason he seeks to obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ronald, es un diligente y emprendedor padre. Desde que formó su familia trabaja perseverantemente en su oficio de carpintero, con apoyo de su fiel y querida esposa está logrando construir hermosos y distintivos muebles.Esta feliz pareja alberga en casa a un encantador niño quien es su mayor motivación para esforzarse.Actualmente Ronald y su familia se encuentran viviendo en el domicilio de su hermana, lugar donde abrió su taller de carpintería y en donde tiene gran cantidad de solicitudes, pero tiene un problema, no cuenta con suficiente materia prima para cumplir sus pedidos, es por ello que recurre a ti en búsqueda de un préstamo.

loans.use: Capital to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
His work as a master carpenter makes Jesús very happy, and he is one of the most hard-working persons in this trade because he puts in such effort, patience and dedication to each and every piece of furniture he makes. Thanks to this, his customers are very satisfied and his client base increases considerably. Currently, with the help of two other youngsters, he creates a wide variety of designs with intricate finishes and beautiful details as requested by his patrons. Thanks to his patience and ability, he is managing to keep up with orders. However, he still requires raw materials such as lumber, varnish, and a few tools that he lacks.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Su trabajo de maestro carpintero tiene muy contento a don Jesús, quien es uno de los mejores trabajadores en este rubro, ya que pone su mayor esfuerzo, paciencia y dedicación a cada uno de los muebles que elabora, gracias a ello es que sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos y su número aumenta considerablemente.Actualmente con apoyo de otros 2 jovencitos elaboran una inmensa variedad de modelos con finos acabados y bellísimos detalles de acuerdo a los requerimientos de sus clientes.Gracias a su paciencia y habilidad está logrando cumplir satisfactoriamente con sus pedidos, pero aún le falta materia prima como: madera, barniz y algunas herramientas que aún le hacen falta.

loans.use: Purchase additional quantities of raw materials.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente comes from a humble home in the city of Juliaca. Since childhood, he has endured many hardships and financial difficulties due to the fact that his parents had few economic options. Currently, he lives in a small dwelling next to his dear siblings. They inherited the home due to the sad death of their parents a few years ago. To try to increase his income, Vicente bought a cycle and with a great deal of physical exertion he provides transportation services to the population of Juliaca. In addition, in his free time he works as a bricklayer. Thanks to his diligence, devotion and, most of all, his immense desire to get ahead, he has in mind purchasing other tools to earn extra income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Vicente proviene de un humilde hogar de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde niño tubo muchas privaciones y dificultades económicas, debido a que sus padres tenían muy bajos recursos económicos.Actualmente vive en un pequeño domicilio junto a sus queridos hermanos, morada que heredaron de sus padres quienes desafortunadamente fallecieron hace ya varios años.Para tratar de generar sus ingresos económicos, Vicente adquirió un triciclo y a fuerza de mucho esfuerzo físico logra brindar servicio de movilidad a la población Juliaqueña, adicionalmente a esta labor en sus horas libres trabaja como maestro albañil, gracias a su diligencia, entrega y sobre todo a sus inmensas ganas de salir adelante, tiene en mente adquirir otra herramienta de trabajo similar para generar ingresos extras.

loans.use: Purchase tools for additional work.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46479

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
Yola is a decisive and diligent woman who with a great deal of effort has been able to implement her small but well-stocked grocery store. Thanks to her excellent service, her varied and well-priced products manage to capture more patrons each day. Yola’s wish is to make improvements to her store, with the aim of providing more comfort for her customers and better safeguarding her merchandise since she is located in a busy commercial sector in the city of Juliaca. With this project in mind, she comes seeking your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Yola, es una mujer muy decidida y diligente, con mucho empeño ha logrado implementar su pequeña pero surtida tiendita de abarrotes, que gracias a su excelente servicio, variados y económicos productos logra captar a diario un número muy grande de compradores.El deseo de Yola es ampliar su local, con el fin de brindarles comodidad a sus clientes y seguridad a sus productos, debido a que su tiendita está ubicada en un lugar de mucho movimiento comercial de la ciudad de Juliaca, con ese proyecto en mente recurre en búsqueda de vuestra ayuda.

loans.use: Increased capital to be able to offer a greater number of products.

loans.name: Dazmilia

texts.es:
Dazmilia is a young 26-year old mother who, from an early age, learned and inherited her handmade plaster crafts trade from her parents. This labor is her daily occupation which she carries out with patience, while it allows her to improve her situation and that of her four year old daughter, Danyely. Thanks to her able and dexterous hands she manages to create a large quantity of various plaster piggy banks to be offered at the crafts fairs in her native town of Juliaca. May is a popular month for the Alasitas Fair, where Dazmilla’s lovely crafts are in high demand by the general population. For this reason, this hardworking young woman would like to purchase additional raw materials to be able to continue making her beautiful items. With your support, she will be able to fulfill her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dazmilia, es una joven madre de 26 años, desde muy niña aprendió y heredó la labor de sus padres, el trabajo artesanal en yeso. Su desempeño diario en esta labor con suma paciencia y entrega le viene permitiendo mejorar su condición de vida y la de su pequeña niña Danyely de 4 añitos de edad, gracias a la agilidad y destreza de sus manos está logrando fabricar una gran cantidad y variedad de alcancías de yeso, que luego serán ofrecidas en una feria artesanal de su ciudad natal Juliaca.El mes de mayo es la popular feria de alasitas, en donde los bellos trabajos de Dazmilia son muy demandados por la población, es por ello que esta laboriosa joven desea adquirir materia prima, para seguir moldeando sus novedosos y hermosos trabajos.Con tu apoyo desinteresado podrá concretar sus planes.

loans.use: Increase of capital to continue making her lovely plaster piggy banks.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla A. is 25 years and married. He is a motorcycle taxi driver. He has passengers ride on his motorcycle, drops them off at their destination, and charges them for the trip. He taxis people in the area of Adéta, a city located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this first FECECAV loan, he wants to buy a new motorcycle to improve the trip (for his passengers). This opportunity will enable him to earn more money in order to provide for his future.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Komla A. est âgé de 25 ans et marié. Il est conducteur de taxi - moto. Il fait monter les passagers sur sa moto les dépose à leur destination et prend les frais de déplacement. Il fait le taxi – moto dans la localité d’Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, il veut acheter une nouvelle moto pour améliorer les conditions de déplacement. Cette occasion lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent afin de subvenir à ses besoins futurs

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Magui

texts.fr:
Magui A. is 39 years old and married. She sells grain at the market in Adéta, a city located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She buys corn, wheat, sorghum, flour, etc. ... to sell retail to people. These grains are used in making foods that keep well. With this first FECECAV loan, she wishes to buy grains in sufficient quantities to provide for people's needs. This will enable her to earn more and to meet her spouse's needs. She has tried her luck to improve her life.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Magui A. est âgée de 39 ans et mariée. Elle est revendeuse de céréales au marché d’Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle achète du maïs, du blé, du sorgho, des farines etc.… en vue de revendre à la population. Ces céréales sont utilisées dans la préparation des aliments stables. Avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, elle souhaite acheter les céréales en quantité suffisante pour subvenir aux besoins de la population. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus et répondre aux besoins de son époux. Aussi elle a tenté sa chance pour améliorer sa vie.

loans.use: To buy grain in sufficient quantities

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosalina belongs to the Community bank “Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso”, or Yungaina Women for Progress, and is dedicated to the sale of food. Her stand is located in the central market of the district and province of Yungay, “departamento” of Ancash.

With the loan of S/. 2,5000.00 soles (USD 900) which will be repaid in eight months, she will buy three sacks of rice, three cups of oil, one sack of sugar, three bags of noodles, board games and a blender.

She is 31 years old, married and has two children. Her spouse is a taxi driver and they both work to cover the costs of the home and for the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith , Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosalina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso, se dedica a la venta de alimentos, su puesto de venta esta ubicado en el mercado central del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará 3 sacos de arroz, 3 cajas de aceite, 1 saco de azúcar, 3 bolsas de fideos, y juegos de mesa y una licuadora. Ella tiene 31 años de edad, es casada tiene 2 hijos, su esposo es taxista ambos trabajan para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy supplies for the preparation of her products

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.es:
Mrs. Raymunda is 47, married, with four children. Her husband is a farmer and she belongs to Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial (“Women Fairground Workers’ Community Bank”) selling foodstuffs in the market at Yungay District and Province, State of Ancash. She and her husband work to financially support their children who are in higher education.

With this loan, repayable over four months, she will purchase a cooker, four tables and 16 chairs.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Raymunda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras del campo Ferial,se dedica a la venta de alimentos en el mercado del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 4 mesas con 16 sillas y una cocina. Ella tiene 47 años, es casada con 4 hijos, su esposo es agricultor ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos que están en educación superior.

loans.use: Loan for the purchase of tables, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Dofe

texts.fr:
Dofe D. is 40 years old and married. She sells tubers at the market in Adéta, a city located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She buys cassava, taro, chips, sweet potatoes, etc... to sell retail to people. These tubers are used in making traditional foods. With this second FECECAV loan, she hopes to increase her sales and to meet customer needs, thus clearing more profit to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Dofe D. est âgée de 40 ans et mariée. Elle est revendeuse de tubercules au marché d’Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle achète du manioc, du taro, de la causette, des patates douces etc.… en vue de revendre à la population. Ces tubercules sont utilisés dans la préparation des aliments traditionnels. Avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, elle espère augmenter ses ventes et répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et par là dégager plus de profits pour améliorer les conditions de sa famille.

loans.use: To increaser her sales

loans.name: Sara Martha

texts.es:
Mrs. Sara is 34, married, and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver and she belongs to the Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial (“Women Fairground Workers’ Community Bank”). She sells vegetable at the market in Yungay District and Province, Ancash State. They both work to financially support their children with their schooling.

With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to purchase 5 boxes of tomatoes, 2 sacks of cassava, 2 sacks of dried chili, 5 sacks of potatoes, a hundred dumplings, and 3 sacks of onions.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras del campo Ferial, Se dedica a la veta de verduras en el mercado del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 5 cajas de tomate, 2 sacos de yuca, 2 sacos de ají seco, 5 sacos de papa, un ciento de wantan, 3 sacos de cebolla. Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es casada tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es chofer, ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Florinda is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. She belongs to the Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso (“Progressive Women's Community Bank”) and sells foodstuffs from a site in the central market, Yungay District and Province, Ancash State. The income she and her husband earn enables them to educate their children.

With this loan, repayable over four month, she plans to buy 2 cans of oil, 2 sacks of rice, 32 packets of noodles, and 1 kilo of meat.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Florinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, se dedica a la venta de alimentos, su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado central del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 latas de aceite, 2 sacos de arroz, 32 paquetes de fideos, y 1 kilos de carne. Ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada tiene 4 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food preparation and sales

loans.name: Lamania Group

texts.en:
The Lamania group members are all subsistence farmers in Koromasilai Village. Ansumana F. is the group leader.  Other menbers of the group members include: Mohamed  C., Mohamed F., Yangie C., and Lebaneh F.(Not Pictured).

The main problem for the group is that it could not grow enough food for sale and for consumption due to lack of farm inputs. The group would like to increase their food production and engage in agribusiness in the near future and is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2, 500,000 ($875 USD). The members of the Lamania group need financial assistance to improve the productivity of their agribusinesses.

loans.use: To buy supplies for their farm

loans.name: Clara Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. E. is 58 years old, divorced, and has four children. Her income enables her to pay for her children’s education.

She belongs to Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay. She sells items of clothing in the Central Market in Yungay District and Province, Ancash State. With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to buy a dozen pairs of pants (trousers) and half a dozen shirts.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora E. pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, se dedica a la venta de ropas en el mercado central del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará una docena de pantalón y ½ docena de camisas. Ella tiene 58 años de edad, es divorciada , tiene 4 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Felipa Leonarda

texts.es:
Mrs. Felipa is 54 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a teacher and she belongs to Grupo Mientras Tanto Señor de los Milagros de Yungay. She sells items of clothing in the Central Market, Yungay District and Province, Ancash State. They work to pay for their children’s education.

With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to buy 2 dozen school sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Felipa pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Señor de los Milagros de Yungay, se dedica a la venta de ropa, en el mercado central del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 2 docenas de chompas de colegio. Ella tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es profesor ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Mrs. Sara is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She belongs to Banco Comunal Señor de Mayo and makes and sells ice cream in a school and in some of the busiest areas of the Catac District, Recuay Province, Ancash State. Her husband supports her in the making and selling of her ice creams and they both contribute to their household expenses and the cost of educating their children.

With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to buy six boxes of ice cream wafers, two large bags of sugar, 10 kilos of ready-made milk for ice cream, 2 sacks of sticks for ice cream on a stick, 2 sacks of ice cream containers, and ice cream flavouring and coloring products.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor de Mayo, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de helados, el lugar de venta es en el Colegio y en lugares de mayor movimiento del distrito Catac, provincia de Recuay, departamento de Ancash.
