Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará: 6 cajas de barquillos, 2 sacos de azúcar, 10 kilos de leche, 2 sacos de palitos para chupetes, 2 sacos de paletas para helados, esencias y colorantes. Ella tiene 34 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo la apoya en la elaboración de los helados y venta, así ambos comparten los gastos de la casa y educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the preparation of their ice creams

loans.name: Kotiban Group

texts.en:
Bamba C. is 46 years old and is married with 6 children. She is the leader of the Kotiban group in the Koromasilaia village of Sierra Leone. The group has been working together to help individual members with their farms. The group has also started a rotating savings club, but they have very little money to invest in the club. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875) to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and for hiring labourers.

The Kotiban group members are dedicated to helping each other improve the quality of their agribusinesses as well as working together as a group to achieve their individual goals. They need a loan so that they can purchase all of the inputs necessary to have a successful planting and harvesting season.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and for hiring labourers

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Mrs. Ida belongs to Villa Turistica of Catac II Communal Bank, she dedicated herself to the sale of clothing in her home in the district of Catac, province of Recuay, city of Ancash. With her loan of 1500 soles which will be repaid in 8 months, she will purchase 1/2 a dozen of jackets for children, a dozen pants for women, a dozen jackets for women, a dozen polos for women, and underwear for women and children. She is 35 years old, she lives with her boyfriend, they have 2 children, her husband has seasonal work and they both work and share the expenses of the home.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ida pertenece al Banco Comunal Villa Turística de Catac II, se dedica a la venta de ropa en su domicilio del distrito Catac, provincia de Recuay, departamento de Ancash. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará: ½ docena de polos para niños, ½ docena abrigos para niñas, 1 docena de chompas para niños, 1 docena de pantalones para damas, 1 docena de polos para damas, 1 docena de chompas para damas, ropas interiores para damas y niños. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo tiene trabajos eventuales y ambos trabajan y comparten los gastos de hogar.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Yankafissa Group

texts.en:
The Yankafissa Group has been growing vegetables and cassava. Due to lack of sufficient farm inputs, the members could not produce enough to sell. The members are, therefore, requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000 ($700 USD) to hire labourers, to increase the size of the farm, and to purchase rice seed and fertilizer.

The members of the group need to increase their crop yields so that they can begin to profit from their farming practices. In order to do this, they need a loan that they can use to purchase inputs and labourers.

loans.use: To hire labourers, to increase the size of the farm, and to purchase rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Plan De Lucha (Plan Of Attack) Group

texts.en:
Hilaria is a fun and vibrant woman, who, in spite of all of the hardships she has faced, continues to be optimistic and hardworking.  She lives with her eight children in a small and rural town in the interior section of the island The children range in ages from 4 to 19 years old, and she is raising them by herself!

Hilaria runs a small colmado, a kind of grocery store from her home. She also sells a small selection of used clothing.  She says she is planning to use this loan to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar, salt, jeans, blouses, and undergarments.  The loan will enable her to buy all of these items in bulk, and as a result she will be able to slightly increase her profit margin.  

She dreams that with the help of this loan, she will be able to give her children a good education, go back and finish school herself, expand her business into a big grocery store, and to one day own her own home and a motorcycle.  Before she never dreamed of achieving these things, but now she says she believes they are possible.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Hilaria herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To purchase larger amounts and a better variety, of used and new clothing.

loans.name: Kamafelen Group

texts.en:
Kamafelen is primarily a group of youth whose aim is to engage in agriculture as a business. With their leader, Sundu M., they help each other by working in individual farms. Sundu is 42 years old. Her dream is to produce crops for sale. This group is from Koromasilaia, a village where most of the vegetables are grown.

The group is requesting a loan of Le.2, 500,000 ($875 USD) for growing vegetables, pigeon peas, rice and for purchasing fertilizer.

Led by a seasoned farmer, the Kamafelen group hopes to achieve scale in their farming operations so that they can begin to sell their produce for a profit and to provide an income for their families. The group needs a small loan to purchase the inputs necessary for achieving this goal.

loans.use: For growing vegetables, pigeon peas, rice and for purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: El Shaddai Group

texts.en:
Nancy lives with her four children--ages 15, 13, 10 and 8 years--old in a small, rural town in the Dominican Republic.  She runs a small business selling new and used clothing to her community members and is asking for this loan so she can improve the selection she is able to offer and purchase a larger quantity of product. 

Her goal is to grow her business so that she both increases the amount she earns as profits, as well as increases the number of reliable and consistent clients she has.  Although things in her community are often very hard, and it’s a challenge to improve one’s life economically, Nancy believes that this loan is going to help her immensely. It will be the first time she has had the opportunity to move her business and goals to the next level.

 On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Nancy herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of used and new clothing

loans.name: Dalamoiya Group

texts.en:
Bockary C. is 38 years old and is married with 4 children. He is the leader of this group, whose livelihood depends on farming. The group is happy that Kiva can provide loans for agricultural activities.

The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000 ($700 USD) to increase their farm activities. The loan will be mainly used for purchasing rice and vegetable seeds, fertilizer and hiring labourers. Bamba M. and Hawa K. would like to grow vegetables to sell.

All members of the Dalamoiya group are engaged in farming as their source of income. They all want to improve their yields and expand their farms and hope to use a loan from Kiva to do so.

loans.use: To buy rice and vegetable seeds and fertilizer and to hire labourers.

loans.name: Allankion Group

texts.en: Maneh C. is 36 years old and is married with 5 children. She is the group leader. The group members grow cassava, chilli paper, carrots and rice. They would like to increase their productions and a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875 USD) will help them to purchase seeds and other farm inputs. The Allankion group needs additional funding to grow their farms and increase their yields.

loans.use: To buy seeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Benkoma Iii Group

texts.en:
Mohamed Makie J. is the leader of the Benkoma group. He is 57 years old and is married with more than 7 children. He is well respected in the community for his efforts to encourage youth to engage in agricultural production.

The Benkoma III group wants to increase their production of rice this coming season and needs additonal capital to do so. The group members are also the members of the village bank. To increase their rice production, the group is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875 USD) for farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Benkoma Iii Group

texts.en: Mohamed Makie J. is the leader of Benkoma group.  He is 57 years old and married with more than 7 children.  He is well respected in the community for his efforts to encourage youth to engage in agricultural production.  The group members are also the members of the village bank.  To increase their rice production, the group is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 for farm inputs.

loans.use: The Benkoma III group is wanting to increase their production of rice this coming season and need additonal capital in order to do so.

loans.name: Benkoma Iii Group

texts.en: Mohamed Makie J. is the leader of Benkoma group.  He is 57 years old and married with more than 7 children.  He is well respected in the community for his efforts to encourage youth to engage in agricultural production.  The group members are also the members of the village bank.  To increase their rice production, the group is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 for farm inputs.

loans.use: The Benkoma III group is wanting to increase their production of rice this coming season and need additonal capital in order to do so.

loans.name: Benkoma Iii Group

texts.en: Mohamed Makie J. is the leader of Benkoma group.  He is 57 years old and married with more than 7 children.  He is well respected in the community for his efforts to encourage youth to engage in agricultural production.  The group members are also the members of the village bank.  To increase their rice production, the group is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 for farm inputs.

loans.use: The Benkoma III group is wanting to increase their production of rice this coming season and need additonal capital in order to do so.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu B. is 40 years old and is married with 4 children. She sells cotton materials in Kabala town of Sierra Leone and has been doing the same business for 3 years.

She is requesting a loan of Le.1.500,000 ($525 USD) to increase her stock and rent a place for the business. Isatu needs to find a convenient location for her shop and to purchase additional stock of cotton materials for selling.

loans.use: To rent a place for her business and buy more cotton material to sell

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman K. sells plastic sandals and t-shirts in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone. With his previous loan from SMT, he diversified his business.

He is now requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 ($350 USD) to increase his stock of shoes and shirts so that he can meet his customers demand and provide a steady income for his family. Osman is 40 years old and married with 5 children.

loans.use: To increase his stock of shoes and shirts for sale

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu B. sells wheat flour to bakers and other retailers. With previous loans from SMT, she increased her stock by 10 bags of wheat flour and her income also increased. Ramatu now has more customers, but cannot meet their demand on time. Due to lack of capital, she has to sell all of the stock she has before travelling to buy more.

She is requesting a loan of Le.3,500,000 to increase her stock. Ramatu wants to buy a larger quantity of flour in bulk so that she can meet her customers demands without running out of supplies. Ramatu is 40 years old and is married with 6 children.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of flour to sell

loans.name: Morlain

texts.en:
Morlain is 47 years old and is married with 7 children. His business is the main source of income for his family. With his previous loan, he increased his stock by 40 gallons of palm oil and earned more income. He is now requesting another loan for Le.1,000,000 ($350 USD) to purchase 75 gallons of palm oil. This will increase his stock and income.

Morlain has been able to generate sufficient business to require him to purchase additional gallons of palm oil. He needs a small loan to help him with that purchase.

loans.use: To buy palm oil to sell

loans.name: Maine Santa

texts.es:
Mrs. Mainebelongs to Villa Turistica of Catac II Communal Bank, she dedicates herself to the sale of food in her home in the district of Catac, province of Recuay, in the city of Ancash. With the loan of 1800 soles which will be repaid in 8 months, she will purchase: 4 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of sugar, 4 cans of oil, 2packates of noodles, 3 cans of milk, 1 packet of salt. She is 35 years old, she lives with her boyfriends, their 2 children, and both work and share the expenses of the home.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maine pertenece al Banco Comunal Villa Turística de Catac II, se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio del distrito Catac, provincia de Recuay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1800 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará: 4 sacos, de arroz, 3 sacos de azúcar, 4 cajas de aceite, 2 paquetes de fideos, 3 cajas de leche, 1 paquete de sal. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, ambos trabajan y comparten los gastos de hogar.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase supplies for the preparation of her foods.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Lavana Group

texts.en:
The Lavana Group members are subsistence farmers who grow vegetables and corn in Gbawuria village near Kabala town. With their previous loan, the members had an opportunity to grow vegetables near the swamp where they irrigated their crops. They increased their production by 25%, their income improved, and they have completed their loan repayments.

They are now requesting for a loan of Le.5,000,000 ($1750 USD), Le.1, 000,000 ($350 USD) for each member, to increase their production and they would like to include the production of rice.

The group members want to increase their production of vegetables and corn and begin to include rice. They each need a loan to purchase the seeds and inputs necessary for this transition.

loans.use: To increase their production of vegetables and corn and begin to include rice

loans.name: Angelica Virginia

texts.en:
Angelita Virginia G. M. has a general store in the village of Salpo, high in the sierras of La Libertad Region.  Her store in located next to the high school, so she has a great location and many loyal customers.  She sells the students  their favorite treats.  

Angelita is 57-years old, married with 5 children.  Two of her children are studying at Universities so she is happy to have an income to help them out.  Nothing would make Angelita happier than to see her children finish school and become professionals.

A member of the community bank, Virgen de Las Mercedes, Angelita is requesting a loan of $1,100 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to restock her store with sodas, candy, rice, and more.

loans.use: To restock general store with sodas, candy, rice, and more.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa M. is 26 years old and is married with 3 children. She sews mainly women’s clothes. With her previous loan, she purchased sewing materials and a second hand sewing machine to start the business. She has many customers, but has no capacity to employ some one to assist her. She is, therefore, requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000 ($700 USD) to purchase 2 more sewing machines and to hire two more people to help with the sewing.

Hawa needs to expand her operations and hire people to work with her so that she can meet her production targets. She needs a loan to be able to do this.

loans.use: To buy 2 sewing machines and hire 2 employees

loans.name: Luisa Julia

texts.en:
Luisa Julia L. E. has a general store in the village of Salpo located high in the sierras of La Libertad Region.  Her store is located in the center of town on a major street, so it’s easily accessible.  She sells fresh vegetables, sugar, oil, rice, chicken, pork and much more.

Luisa is a 57-year old widow with 3 children.  Her children are grown, so she is all alone.  She’s happy to have her business because she is very social and loves helping to pay for her grandchildren’s education.

A member of the community bank Virgen de Las Mercedes, Luisa is requesting a loan of  900 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to buy oil, corn, rice, and more.

loans.use: To buy oil, corn, rice, and more.

loans.name: Mallesa

texts.en:
Mallesa sells fresh fish in Kabala town of Sierra Leone. With her previous loan, she increased her stock and income. With the profit, she was able to purchase a cell phone to contacti her customers and suppliers. She is now able to communicate to more potential customers and is now requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000 ($350 USD) to increase her stock.

Mallesa needs to purchase a greater quantity of fish now that she has been able to more effectively communicate with customers and suppliers. She needs a loan from Kiva in order to do so.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Norvy Daniela

texts.en:
Norvy Daniela Z. R. runs a general store in the village of Salpo located high in the sierras of La Libertad Region.  The store is located in the center of town, so it can be accessed easily.  The town is a stop along a bus route, and many of Norvy’s clients include commuters.  She is always friendly and stocks her store with the popular products clients want.

Norvy is 25-years old, married, and has one child.  She is happy to have her store because she never had the opportunity to study and become a professional.  She loves building relationships and saving for her child’s future. 

A member of the community bank Virgen De Las Mercedes, Norvy is requesting a loan of $550 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to restock her store with her best selling goods such as sugar, corn, and oil.

loans.use: To restock general store with goods such as sugar, corn, and oil.

loans.name: Sajor

texts.en:
Sajor has been with the program for a year and a half. With his previous loans, he renovated his grocery store and increased his stock.

Sajor has a plan for diversifying the business by selling agricultural produce, in addition to the grocery items. Sajor wants to try diversifying his stock of grocery items to try and attract new customers to his business. He is requesting a loan of Le.2, 000,000 ($700 USD) to pursue his dream. Sajor is 32 years old and married with two children.

loans.use: To add produce to his grocery store items

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta lives in the village of Senekedugu where she runs her grocery business. Fanta started her business at a very small scale and, with her previous loans from SMT, she expanded the business. With the profit, she managed to expand her farm land.

She is now requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 ($350 USD) to increase her stock. Fanta is 39 years old and married with 5 children. Fanta needs to expand her stock of grocery items further to continue to increase her income and improve her farm.

loans.use: To expand her stock of grocery items

loans.name: Feremba

texts.en:
Feremba sells food in the town of Kabala. Feremba is 36 years old and married with 6 children.

With her previous loan, she built her own capital and was able to meet some of her family's expenses. Now, she would like to expand her business and is requesting a loan of Le.1.500, 000. Feremba wants to be able to purchase a larger variety of food to sell and needs a loan to do so.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of food to sell

loans.name: Sarrah

texts.en:
Sarrah M. sells palm oil in outskirts of Kabala town. Sarrah is 46 years old and married with 6 children.

With her previous loan, Sarrah was able to increase her stock of palm oil. Sarrah said that, with the profit, she renovated her house and was able to pay her children’s school fees. Now, she would like to purchase 75 gallons of palm oil to increase her stock and income.

Sarrah needs to purchase an even larger quantity of palm oil to meet the demands of her customers. She needs extra capital from Kiva to do so.

loans.use: To buy palm oil to sell

loans.name: Rosa Consuelo

texts.en:
Rosa Consuelo R. G. has a business selling bulk sugar, rice, and wheat.  Her business is located in Salpo, a village high in the Sierras of La Libertad Region.  She’s had her business for two years and has patiently acquired a group of loyal customers.

Rosa is 42-years old, married, and has 5 children.  She is happy to have her business and help her family.  Rosa looks forward to growing her business and giving her children more opportunities in life than she had.

A member of the community bank Virgen de Las Mercedes, Rosa is requesting a loan of $375 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to restock her business with sugar, wheat, and corn.

loans.use: To restock business with sugar, wheat, and corn.

loans.name: Malimba Group

texts.en:
The Malimba Group has three members who have been working together in each others’ farms. They grow vegetables and cereal crops in the swamp during the dry season and move to the upland during the rainy season.

To increase their cereal crops, especially rice and corn, the group is requesting a loan of Le.1,500,000 ($525 USD), Le.500,000 ($175 USD) each.

Zainab K. is the group leader. She is 55 years old and has 5 children. The members of Malimba are dedicated to each other's success. Each member of the group guarantees the others. They need a small loan from Kiva to help them with their current crops, and to also help them expand into vegetable production.

loans.use: To produce vegetables on their farms

loans.name: Comite Esperanza Del Este Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program run by the Fundación Paraguaya that targets groups of enterprising women. These women create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities that enable them to live with dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. Moreover, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women committee members the energy and motivation to reach success.

Ida R., member of the committee called “Rosa Blanca” in Asuncion told her sister Gladys R. who lives in San Jose in Ciudad del Este about the program Fundacion Paraguaya offers. Gladys, excited with the idea, contacted her fiends and neighbors and told them about the committee. She shared with these women her desire to change their world for the better by working very hard. Ida’s hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a committee.

The group includes 16 women from different neighborhoods in the city. Their businesses include: despensas, (grocery stores, a very profitable market in Paraguay, since we consider it a tradition to buy from a Despensa), confectionaries, sewing shops, as well as sales of natural medicines, clothing, bijouterie, and jewelry. Some of the women offer services such as housekeeping.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of products such as: clothing, fabrics, thread, elastic bands, sugar, oil, pasta, cereals, milk, sugar and natural medicines

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like clothing, fabrics, thread, elastic bands, sugar, oil, pasta, cereals, milk, sugar and natural medicines

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Mrs. Luz Angelica L. S. is 61 years old; she studied until the 6th grade. She is a single woman and does not have any children. She lives in the district of the Future in the province of Trujilo in the city of La Libertad, Peru. The business she has dedicated herself to is the sale of stuff for different sizes of shoes, furthermore she sells food and cooks for different events but now she doesn’t do this anymore because of her poor health. Nowadays she continues with the sale of things and decorates corrospun materials, together with her cousin she makes these works to the different schools for their celebrations that they have during the year. She is the member of the God’s Blessing Communal Bank where she received her first loan of 3000 soles with this money she purchased a variety of meats, ham, hot dogs, chorizo, and cheeses. With the loan of 1100 soles which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase corrospun material, starch, decorations, paints, etc. Mrs. Luz dreams of putting a costume workshop now that she has a better understanding of these types of work. Previously, she decorated clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz Angélica León Solórzano tiene 61 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Es una mujer soltera y no tiene hijos . Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad- Perú. El negocio al que se ha dedicado siempre es la venta de embutidos por los diferentes talleres de calzado, además vendía menú y cocinaba en diferentes eventos pero ya no lo hace debido a que se puso mal de salud. Actualmente sigue en la venta de embutidos y también elabora adornos de material corrospun, junto con su prima hacen estos trabajos para los diferentes jardines y colegios de acuerdo a las celebridades que se presenten durante el año. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Bendición de Dios” lugar donde recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 3000.00 con este dinero compro una variedad de embutidos entre jamonada, hod dog, chorizo, mortadela y quesos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1100.00 el cual será cancelado en cuatro meses,comprará varias planchas de material corrospun, escarcha, ojitos, pinturas, etc. La señora Luz sueña con poner un taller de costura ya que tiene conocimiento sobre como hacer este tipo de trabajos. Anteriormente elaboraba algunas prendas.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase products for her business

loans.name: Kurumomo Group

texts.en:
Mbalu is 47 years old and is married with 4 children. She is the group leader and both members assist each other in their farms. They grow peanuts, corn, rice and vegetables for sale and consumption, but in a very small scale.

The Kurumomo group has decided they would like to expand their production so that they can increase their incomes. They need a small loan to do so.

The members would like to increase their rice farm and are requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000 ($350 USD), Le.500, 000 (half) to purchase fertilizer and the remainder to hire labourers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers for their farms

loans.name: Maria Luzmila

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Luzmila Z. E. is 70 years old. She studied until the second year of high school. She has 2 sons in total but none depend on her. She lives in the City og God section in the district of the Future in the city of La Libertad, Peru. She began her business with a few products, when she was living in the desert, she had a small store in her home, she was always maintaining this business, later she came to live in the coast of La Libertad because she wanted to give her sons a better education. With a lot of effort she began selling products of necessity, with time she has been increasing her business. For 10 years she has belonged to the institution, the first bank that she belonged to was in the desert of La Libertad, later she became a member of the Victor Raul Communal Bank in the city of Trujilo. She obtained her first loan of 300 soles, money she used to purchase all the necessities to begin her store. With this loan of 1000 soles which will be paid in 4 months she will purchase 3 sacks of rice, 2 cans of oil, one bag of sugar, a carton of noodles, and other products. Mrs. Maria has the great idea of becoming independent, to say that she has her own capital and in this manner she can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Luzmila Z. E. tiene 70 años de edad. Estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria. Tiene dos hijos en total pero ninguno depende de ella. Vive en el sector Ciudad de Dios en el distrito El Porvenir en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Su negocio se inicio con pocos productos, cuando vivía en la sierra ambientó una pequeña bodega en su casa, siempre ha mantenido ese negocio, posteriormente se vino a vivir a la costa de La Libertad debido a que quería darle mejor educación a sus hijos. Con mucho esfuerzo empezó vendiendo productos de primera necesidad, con el tiempo ha ido incrementando. Hace 10 años que pertenece a la institución, el primer banco al que perteneció fue en la sierra de La Libertad, posteriormente ingreso al Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl” en la ciudad de Trujillo. Obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 dinero con el cual compro todo lo necesario para implementar su bodega. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprará: tres sacos de arroz, dos latas de aceite, una bolsa de azúcar, un paquete de fideos, y otros productos. La señora Maria tiene el gran anhelo de independizarse, es decir tener su propio capital, de esa manera hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Elvio

texts.en:
Elvio B. is married to Dominga Bogado and the couple has two school-age children. Since 1997, Elvio has owned a despensa (a grocery store) purchased with some money he had been saving for a period of time. 
The couple works efficiently as partners. While Elvio works as a taxi driver, Dominga stays at the despensa attending clients. At the same time, both generate incomes for the house. 
Thanks to the different sources of income, Elvio’s sons have the chance to attend school. According to Elvio, the key to a brighter future is education. 
The credit provided by Kiva will be used to repair Elvio’s car. That would give him the opportunity to reach more areas and thus increase sales and earnings.

loans.use: Purchase equipment to repair a car.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Mrs. N. Z. Rosario is 27 years old, she completed high school. She had one daughter who depends on her still. She lives in the City of God section in the district of The Future in the province of Trujilo in the city of La Libertad, Peru. After finishing high school she was studying a technical career but she couldn’t finish for personal reasons, because of this she decided to begin a business so that she could be useful and survive. Mrs. N. travels constantly to the city of Lima to buy presents like: stuffed animals, decorations, etc. Furthermore she has a grocery store in her house where she offers products that are useful for offices. She belongs to the Victor Raul Communal Bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles with this money she purchased a lot of things to better her store. With the loan of 2300 soles that she will repay in a period of 4 months she will travel to the city of Lima and purchase decorations, costume jewelry, etc. She will also be to purchase groceries in variety. Mrs. N. dreams of purchasing a stand in the center of Trujilo where she can offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora N. Z. Rosario tiene 27 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene una sola hija que aun depende de ella. Vive en el sector Ciudad de Dios en el distrito de El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad- Perú. Después que termino de estudiar la secundaria estuvo estudiando una carrera técnica pero no pudo culminarla por motivos personales, así que decidió poner un negocio en el que obtenga utilidades y de esa manera sobrevivir. La señora N. viaja constantemente a la ciudad de Lima para comprar regalos tales como: peluches, portarretratos, adornos y otros. Además tiene una bodega en su casa en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad así como también útiles de escritorio que aprovecha en vender por campaña escolar. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl”lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro de todo un poco para surtir su bodega. Con el préstamo de S/. 2300.00 el cual será pagado en un periodo de cuatro meses viajara a la ciudad de Lima para comprar adornos, joyas de fantasía, cuadros, etc.. Así también comprara abarrotes en variedad. La señora N. sueña con comprar un stand en el centro de Trujillo en donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.en:
Hipolito is the owner of a repair workshop in a well-known market called Mercado de Abasto in Ciudad del Este. A few years ago, Hipolito started selling different types of products house-by-house in his town. There, Hipolito gained experience and learned essential lessons about how to treat customers. Moreover, from the earnings of this business, he was able to save a considerable amount of money to invest in his present repair workshop.

Hipolito employs a boy who helps him when necessary.

In order to prosper, Hipolito wants to enlarge his repair shop. The expansion will benefit him, since he will have more space to work, and he will be more comfortable. Therefore, the money provided by the credit will be used in the amplification of his business.

loans.use: Amplification of shop.

loans.name: Juana's Group

texts.es:
Nelly, Vilma and Juana have been members of Banco Comunal Urubamba for 2, 3 and 3 years respectively. They come from the Urubamba community, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

Nelly is 27 years old, lives with her partner and has one child. Vilma is 29 years old, lives with her partner and also has one child. Nelly and Vilma are employed in the raising of pigs, which they slaughter and sell in the city of Ayacucho. On Sundays they sell local food in Huascahura.

Juana is 48 years old, is married and has 7 children. She travels to the markets where she purchases small animals, which she slaughters and sells in the city of Ayacucho. She also purchases chickens which she then sells at the markets.

Nelly, Vilma and Juan need a group loan of $1,025 to invest in the purchase of goats, sheep and chickens.

Nelly, Vilma and Juan have three dreams: to proviD. their children with a good education, to have sufficient capital for their business and to have their own grocery store.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Nelly, Vilma y Juana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Urubamba hace 2, 3, 3 años respectivamente. Ellas son D. L. comunidad D. Urubamba que esta ubicado a 30 minutos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Nelly es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo. Mientras que Vilma es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Nelly y Vilma se dedican a L. crianza D. ganado porcino, que benefician y venden en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho y los días domingos venden comida típica en Huascahura.

Mientras que Juana es casada, tiene 48 años y 7 hijos, Juana viaja a las ferias donD. compra animales menores que luego beneficia y venD. en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Juana compra pollos bebes que venD. en las ferias.

Nelly, Vilma y Juana necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 300 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. ganado caprino, ovino y pollos.

Los sueños D. Nelly, Vilma y Juana son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener capital para su negocio y una tienda D. abarrotes.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of goats, sheep and chickens

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Mrs. Norma C. R. is 26 years old, she studied until the 5th year of high school. She has 2 daughters that still depend on her. She lives in the City of God section in the district of the Future in the province of Trujilo in the city of La Libertad, Peru. Her business began together with her husband, making footwear of all types and for each season. She began making them in small quantities; bit by bit she has been progressing and increasing the quantity of the footwear. Previously she dedicated herself to the sale of clothing traveling in the desert of La Libertad but she left this business because her daughter was small and she needed to watch her. Nowadays she has various clients that make diverse requests, especially from the city of Lima and Trujilo. She belongs to the Victor Raul Comunal Bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles with this money she purchased clothing at wholesale. With the loan of 400 soles which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase two dozen plants, various cleats, leather, glue, studs, decorations and dyes. Mrs. Norma has big dreams of seeing her daughters as professionals and bettering her business.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma C. R. tiene 26 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Tiene dos hijas que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector Ciudad de Dios en el distrito de El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Su negocio inicio junto con su esposo, con la fabricación de calzado de todo tipo y para cada temporada. Empezó fabricando en pocas cantidades, poco a poco ha ido progresando e incrementando la cantidad de calzados. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa viajaba por la sierra de La Libertad pero dejo ese negocio ya que su hija estaba pequeña y tenia que cuidarla. Actualmente tiene varios clientes que le hacen diversos pedidos, especialmente de la ciudad de Lima y Trujillo. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro ropa al por mayor. Con el préstamo de S/. 400.00 el cual será pagado en cuatro meses, comprará dos docenas de plantas, tacos en variedad, cuero, pegamento, tachuelas, adornos y tientes. La señora Norma tiene el gran sueño de ver a sus hijas profesionales e implementar mas su negocio.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more materials to make her products.

loans.name: Juliana's Group

texts.es:
Maribel and Juliana have been members of Banco Comunal Urubambe for 2 and 4 years respectively. The come from the Urubamba community, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

Maribel is 25 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. She produces woven texties, such as blankets, and sells them at the market in Santa Clara. She also weaves sweaters.

Juliana is 29 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. At the weekend she sells food in her district. She also sells delicacies from Monday to Friday.

Maribel and Juliana need a loan of $525 to invest in the purchase of thread, wool, biscuits, chocolates, cigars, chewing gum and sweets.

Maribel and Juliana have two dreams: that their children do well in their careers to expand their factory and to have a grocery store.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Maribel y Juliana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Urubamba hace 2, 4, 4, años respectivamente. Ellas son de la comunidad de Urubamba que esta ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Maribel es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Maribel realiza tejidos en telar como frazadas, pasadizos y lo vende en el mercado Santa Clara. Además Maribel teje chompas.

Mientras que Juliana es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Juliana vende comida en su distrito, los días sábados y domingos. Además Juliana vende golosinas de lunes a viernes.

Maribel y Juliana necesitan préstamos de 450 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos, lanas, galletas, chocolates, cigarros, chicles y caramelos.

Los sueños de Maribel y Juliana son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su taller y tener una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of thread, wool, biscuits, chocolates, cigars, chewing gum and sweets.

loans.name: Semilina

texts.es:
Semilina has belonged to the Communal Urubamba Bank for 4 years. Semilina comes from the Urubamba community located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

Semilina is a 40-year-old single mother with one daughter. Semilina has a store in the Huaytara District, which is 4 hours away from the city of Ayacucho. She sells clothes and varied footwear, and also buys tara powder, leathers, and cochinilL. dye, which she sells to intermediaries in Ayacucho. Additionally, Semilina weaves skirts according to order.

Semilina requires a loan toward the purchase of pants, polo shirts, skirts, shoes, slippers, tara powder and cochinilL. dye.

Semilina dreams of offering a good education to her daughter and hopes that her business prospers.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Semilina pertenece al Banco Comunal Urubamba hace 4 años. Semilina proviene D. L. comunidad D. Urubamba que esta ubicado a 30 minutos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Semilina es madre soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hija, Semilina tiene una tienda en el distrito D. Huaytara que esta a 4 horas D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, donD. venD. ropa, calzados variados y también compra tara, cueros, cochinilL. que venD. a intermediarios en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Semilina teje chompas D. acuerdo al pedido.

Semilina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. pantalones, polos, chompas, zapatos, zapatillas, tara y cochinilL..

Los sueños D. Semilina son brindar una buena educación a su hija y que su negocio prospere.

loans.use: Purchase of pants, polo shirts, skirts, shoes, slippers, tara (a powder used in tanning) and cochinilla (a red dye)

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 46532

loans.name: Teresa  Maria

texts.es:
Teresa Maria R. C. is 43 years old and has finished secondary school. She has four children who still depend on her. She lives in the Víctor Raúl area, in the El Porvenir district of La Libertad province. She started her business with very little merchandise and traveled to the city of Lima to sell bread made in the mountains of La Libertad, manjar blanco (a sweet paste similar to dulce de leche) and other sweets. Thankfully, she had family in that area and has become known among their neighbors and others in nearby area. These days, since she brings bread and other things to Lima to sell, she brings back clothing and other products from there to sell in Trujillo and El Porvenir to her neighbors and friends.

Teresa is a member of the Víctor Raúl communal bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 Nuevo Sol (Peruvian currency) and with this money purchased a variety of bread, sweet rolls and sweets. With this loan of 1300 Nuevo Sol ($475), which she will repay in four months, she will travel to Lima to purchase clothes, gift items, and sweatshirts in large quantities as in this season they are the most requested items. Teresa dreams of opening a store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Teresa Maria R. C. tiene 43 años de edad, estudio secundaria completa. Tiene cuatro hijos en total que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector Víctor Raúl en el distrito de El Porvenir en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Cuando la señora Teresa inició su negocio lo hizo con poca mercadería, viajaba a la Ciudad de Lima para vender pan elaborado en la sierra de La Libertad, manjar blanco y dulces; gracias a que tiene familiares por esa zona ya se ha hecho conocida con los vecinos y con varias personas de otros lugares cerca de su barrio. Actualmente así como lleva a vender pan a Lima trae ropa y otros productos de allá para venderlos en el distrito de Trujillo y El Porvenir, a sus vecinos y conocidos. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con ese dinero compro una variedad de pan, rosca y dulce. Con el préstamo de S/. 1300.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses viajara a la ciudad de Lima para hacer sus compras de ropa, regalos, polares en mayor cantidad ya que por esta temporada le han hecho mayor pedido. La señora Teresa tiene un sueño que es el de ambientar una tienda en su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Nery Luz

texts.es:
Nery belongs to the Mujeres Coraje communal bank, located in Salaverry 499, in the Calleria district of the Ucayali province. Nery is 65 years old and has five children. Her husband is a chauffeur. When Nery received her loan from the Manuela Ramos group for 300 Nuevo Sol (Peruvian currency), she decided to invest in a business selling food. Currently, Nery attends to her customers in her home, where she provides food. She gets ups very early and with the help of her children she prepares the meals. At noon, they are ready to serve. With this loan of 2,500 Nuevo Sol ($900), which she will repay in four months, she will purchase supplies such as a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, meat, oil, eggs, and vegetables. Nery is very pleased with the communal bank, she is happy with her work and is progressing with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Nery pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Coraje, ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry 499, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 65 años es madre D. 5 hijos, su esposo es chofer. Nery con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. comida. En la actualidad atienD. a sus clientes en su domicilio donD. ofrece sus comidas, y tiene sus pensionados, para ello se levanta muy temprano, y con la ayuda D. sus hijos preparan su comidas, y a las 12 pm. están listos para servir. Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará víveres como: 1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, carnes, aceite, huevos, verduras, etc. Nery se siente muy contenta con su banco comunal, trabaja con mucha tranquilidad y esta progresando con su negocio.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase supplies used in preparing the food she provides

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Martiza belongs to the Mujeres Coraje communal bank, located in Amazonas 998 in the Calleria district of the Ucayali province. She is 43 years old and has three children. Her husband is a police officer. With her first loan form Manuela Ramos of 300 Nuevo Sol (Peruvian currency), she invested in a beauty shop. She currently has a great clientele, because of her friendliness and the excellent treatment she offers her customers. Martiza is able to get her housework done while she runs her salon and is able to spend pleasant evenings with her family. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevo Sol ( $375), which she will pay back in four months, she will purchase hair coloring, permanent solution, hair crème, combs, clippers, and rollers. Martiza tells us that the loans she has received are a great help to her and give her the opportunity to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Maritza pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Coraje, ubicado en el Jr. Amazonas 998, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es policía. Maritza con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un salón de belleza. En la actualidad su salón de belleza cuenta con mucha clientela por el buen trato y amabilidad que ofrece, las tareas domesticas las comparte con su negocio, y por las noches comparte momentos agradables con su familia. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará tintes, líquido ondulador, cremas para cabello, peines, maquina para cortar pelo, bigudíes. Maritza manifiesta que los préstamos recibidos son un gran apoyo para ella y le da la oportunidad de seguir adelante

loans.use: With this loan she will purchase various products to use in her business

loans.name: Raida's Group

texts.es:
Rufina, Raida and Reyna have been members of the Communal Urumbamba Bank for two years.

Rufina is 38 and married with 3 children. Rufina sells animals that she buys at fairs. Additionally, Rufina sells farm-bought chicks.

Raida is 32 and married with 2 children. Raida weaves blankets, runners and carpets that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Raida also sells meat door-to-door in Ayacucho.

Reyna, 33, is also married and has 6 children. Reyna buys and sells animals. In addition, Reyna makes decorated blankets that she later sells in the city markets in Ayacucho.

Rufina, Raida and Reyna each require loans ranging from approximately $100 to $350 dollars, to be invested in the purchase of chickens, wool, dyes and cattle.

Rufina, Raida and Reyna dream of having their own homes, of offering a good education and nutritious food to their children, and of improving their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Rufina, Raida y Reyna pertenecen al Banco Comunal Urubamba hace 2 años.

Rufina es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Rufina vende animales que compra en las ferias. Además Rufina vende pollos bebes que compra en la granja.

Por otro lado Raida es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Raida hace tejidos en telar como frazadas, pasadizos, tapices, que vende en los mercados de la ciudad Ayacucho. Además Raida vende carne de casa en casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Reyna es casada, tiene 33 años y 6 hijos, Reyna compra y vende animales. Además Reyna hace elaborar frazadas que luego vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Rufina, Raida y Reyna necesitan préstamos de 300 soles, 1000 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pollos, lana, tinte y ganado vacuno.

Los sueños de Rufina, Raida y Reyna son tener casa propia, brindar una buena educación y alimentación a sus hijos, mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: Purchase of chickens, wool, dye and cattle

loans.name: Susan Carolan

texts.es:
Susan is 24 years old and mother to one child. Her husband is a merchant, but the money he makes is not enough to make due. This is why Susan, with her first loan of 300 Nuevo Sol (Peruvian currency), decided to invest in a small store selling soft drinks, popsicles, and cakes. Susan used her profits from the store to install an oven for roasting different kinds of meats and baking cakes, while still attending to her existing business. With this loan of 800 Nuevo Sol ($300), which she will pay off in four months, she will purchase soft drinks, ingredients for her cakes, popsicles, milk, sugar, gelatin, and more. Susan says that the Manuela Ramos group gives its members an opportunity to grow with their small businesses and feel more independent and successful.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Susan pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en la Calle Paita 121, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Susan con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de gaseosas, chupetes y tortas. En la actualidad Susan con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio implemento un horno artesanal para el asado de diferentes tipos de carnes y tortas, pero sin descuidar su otro negocio. Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: gaseosas de diferentes precios, insumos para sus tortas, chupetes, leche, azúcar, gelatinas.. Susan dice que Manuela Ramos nos da una oportunidad de surgir en nuestros pequeños negocios para poder sentirnos mas independientes y realizadas como empresarias.

loans.use: With this loan she will purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Brigida's Group

texts.es:
Sonia and Brígida have been members of the Communal Artisan Bank for 6 months and one year, respectively. They are from the Huascahura District, 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

Sonia is a 24-year-old single mother with two children. Sonia weaves fabrics and blankets that she sells in the city of Lima. Sonia also sells cheeses and meats in the city of Lima.

Brígida is 43 and married with one child. She has a store where she sells groceries and produce. Additionally, Brígida sells meat that she distributes house-to-house in Ayacucho.

Sonia and Brígida will divide loan proceeds to invest in wool, dyes, pasta, rice, sugar and oil.

Sonia and Brígida dream of building a house, improving their businesses, and educating their children.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia y Brígida pertenecen al Banco Comunal Artesanos hace 6 meses y 1 año respectivamente. Ellas son del Distrito de Huascahura a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Sonia es madre soltera, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Sonia realiza tejidos en telar como individuales, frazadas que vende en la ciudad de Lima. Además Sonia vende quesos y carne en la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Brígida es casada, tiene 43 años y 1 hijo, Brígida tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras. Además Brígida vende carne que reparte de casa en casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Sonia y Brígida necesitan préstamos de 900 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, tinte, fideo, arroz, azúcar, aceite.

Los sueños de Sonia y Brígida son construir su casa, mejorar sus negocios y sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Purchase of wool, dyes, pasta, rice, sugar and oil

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 46538

loans.name: Florentina's Group

texts.es:
Florentina, Marcelina and Emilia have belonged to the Artisan Communal Bank for 6 months.

Florentina is 39 and married with 4 children. Marcelina is 31 and is also married with 4 children. Emilia, 19, lives with her partner and has two children.

Florentina, Marcelina and Emilia weave fabrics, an activity they learned from their families. Their products are sold in different markets in the city of Ayacucho.

Florentina, Marcelina and Emilia will invest loan proceeds in the purchase of wools, dyes, and threads.

The dream of Florentina, Marcelina and Emilia is that they improve their business and have more capital, and that their sons and daughters become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Florentina, Marcelina y Emilia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Artesanos hace 6 meses.

Florentina es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, por otro lado Marcelina es casada, tiene 31 años y 4 hijos, mientras que Emilia es conviviente, tiene 19 años y 2 hijos.

Florentina, Marcelina y Emilia realizan tejidos en telar como frazadas, pasadizos, individuales, actividad que aprendieron de sus familiares, sus productos son vendidos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Florentina, Marcelina y Emilia necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 300 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra lanas, tintes, hilos.

Los sueños de Florentina, Marcelina y Emilia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios y tener más capital.

loans.use: Purchase of wools, dyes, and threads

loans.name: Verónica Del Socorro

texts.es:
Verónica del Socorro is receiving her first loan from AFODENIC to carry out home improvements. This will enable her to fulfill her dream of having a pleasant, comfortable home that meets the basic needs of the family and allows them to live decently. Her house was recently constructed—it is built of concrete and has a metal roof. She needs this loan so that she can finish the construction work, since she wants to build a kitchen and divide the bedrooms.

Verónica works for the Minister of Education teaching in the Dolores Urtecho center, which is located in the Carlos Delgado area about 5 km from the Rio Plata neighborhood. She devotes her free time to agricultural activities, growing staple grains along with crops that are non-native to the region, along with raising birds and pigs. Her husband makes his living as a social worker in the communities of Nueva Guinea, where he works for the ADENG organization. The couple has two children. Their son is 18-years-old, has graduated and is teaching—he helps provide educational opportunities to adults in the Rio Plata neighborhood—while also studying mathematics at URACCAN university’s Nueva Guinea campus. Their daughter is 13-years-old and is in her second year of secondary school.

Verónica is an exemplary woman, one who is dedicated and self-sacrificing as she works for a better future for her family. She is both a mother and a leader of her family, who energetically shows her children the way and is able to provide a decent home. Verónica has confronted every challenge in life, graduating with a degree in teaching primary education, and has thus provided an example for her children. She very much hopes to complete her construction work.

Translated by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Verónica del Socorro solicita su primer crédito AFODENIC, para realizar mejora en su vivienda, así poder cumplir su anhelo de tener una vivienda cómoda justa bonita en la sociedad, con las condiciones básica que requiere la familia y poder vivir como ser humano, su vivienda es de concreto, techo de zinc recién construida, requiere este crédito para finalizar esta obra de construcción, pues desea construir una cocina y dividir los dormitorios.

Labora para el Ministerio de Educación como docente en el centro José Dolores Urtecho, comarca Carlos Delgado localizado a 5 km de colonia Rio Plata, y en sus tiempo libres labora en actividades productivas del campo, establecimiento de granos básico y cultivos no tradicionales en la zona, también se dedica a la crianza de aves y cerdo; su esposo aporta en los gasto del hogar, él labora de promotor social en las comunidades en la institución de ADENG Nueva Guinea, tienen dos hijos, uno de 18 años, es docente graduado, brinda servicio de educación de adulto en la colonia de Rio Plata, también estudia Lic. Matemática en al universidad URACCAN Nueva Guinea, y una hija de 13 años de edad que estudia segundo año secundaria.

Verónica es una mujer ejemplar, luchadora, abnegada al trabajo por un futuro mejor de la familia, esta mujer es madre jefa de familia, emprendedora para salir adelante con sus hijos, y poderle dejar un vivienda digna, Verónica ha enfrentado todos los desafíos de la vida, se gradúo en sus carrera de docente educación primaria, de esta forma a salido adelante con sus dos hijos, esta clienta sueña de tener finalizada su obra de construcción.

loans.use: Home improvements

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the Las Dalinas 2 communal bank, located in the Human Alana Sisley settlement, Block Ñ, Lot 5 in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali province. She is 29 years old and has two children. With her first loan through the Manuela Ramos group of 300 Nuevo Sol (Peruvian currency) she decided to invest in a business to sell refreshments and popsicles in different places in the area. In the morning she prepares her products and in the afternoon she goes out to sell them. She enjoys what she does and has fun getting to know people who become her customers. With her business she is able to educate her young children who still need a great deal from her. With this loan of 800 Nuevo Sol ($300), which she will pay back in six months) she will purchase ingredients for her products, local fruit, sugar, lemon, barley, and ice. Rosa is both mother and father to her children and with this small business she is able, with a great deal of effort, to move forward in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalinas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Human Alana Sisley Mz. Ñ Lt. 5, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años es madre de 2 hijos. Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de chupetes y refrescos. En la actualidad vende sus refrescos y chupetes en los diferentes grifos de la región, por las mañanas prepara sus productos y en las tardes sale a vender, le gusta lo que hace se divierte mucho y así conoce mas gente, y puede educar sus menores hijos que aun necesitan mucho de ella. Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: insumos para sus chupetes, bolitas, frutas de la región, azúcar, limón, cebada, hielo. Rosa es padre y madre para sus hijos y con el pequeño negocio que tiene esta sacándolos adelante con mucho esfuerzo y empeño.

loans.use: With this loan she will purchase ingredients to make her products

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial V. Roman (35) is married and has a daughter. Tired of working as a security guard, Marcial decided to create self-employment. In 2005, he opened a Despensa (a grocery store) in a neighborhood called Monday in Ciudad President Franco. The town is located in the border between Paraguay and Brazil.

Nowadays, both Marcial and his wife work at the Despensa. In rural areas in Paraguay, the Despensas are considered a meeting point, where people not only buy products but also gather and gossip. That is why they are very profitable in Paraguay.

The money provided by the credit will be invested in the purchase of products such as meat, flour, sugar, pasta, and oil.

loans.use: Purchase of meat, flour, sugar, pasta, oil.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar is 51 years old widow and the mother of six children. With her first loan (300 Nuevo Sol, Peruvian currency) from the Manuela Ramos group, she invested in a small shop. These days her shop is well-stocked – she sells groceries, handicrafts, ribbons and other adornments. Her children help her tend the store and on the weekends Pilar likes to go for walks with them. With this loan of $300 (800 Nuevo Sol) she will purchase one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, milk, pasta, canned foods, cooking oil, bread, and more. Pilar opened her shop with the future of her children in mind. She wanted them to be able to continue studying and have good jobs in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy

La señora Pilar pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Américas, ubicado en el Jr. 23 de Febrero 179, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años es madre de 6 hijos, es viuda. Pilar con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega esta mas surtida, vende abarrotes y productos de pasamanería, con la ayuda de sus hijos atienden su negocio y los fines de semana le gusta salir a pasear con ellos. Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas, aceite, pan, etc. Pilar salió adelante por sus hijos, decidió poner la bodega pensando en su futuro para que mas adelante puedan seguir estudiando y ser buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga O. Martinez is a single mother. Her son is a school-age child and Olga does her best in order to give him a good level of education. She says: “The reason why I work very hard every day is my son.” 
Olga used to work as a house cleaner. A good financial administrator, she saved a considerable amount of money from her housekeeper days and invested it in a Despensa (a grocery store). 
Nowadays, the Despensa is running successfully, custmers are increasing every day, and sales are growing. The credit provided will be invested to purchase products in order to offer a wider range of goods. Products include flour, rice, meat, sugar, and other products.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, rice, meat, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Yanapampa Group

texts.es:
The Communal Yanapampa Bank recently opened with 15 partners, all of whom are from the Community of Yanapampa belonging to the District of HuamanguilL., 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The inhabitants of this community work in agriculture, care of livestock, and livestock trading.

The partners are involved in agriculture; care of livestock; sale of tara tree agricultural products, pigs, sheep, goats and cattle; and carpentry service.

The partners require different levels of loans, comprising the total loan amount for the Communal Bank.

The loan proceeds will be applied toward the purchase of fertilizer, sheep, goats, piglets, and tara trees.

The dream of the partners is that their business will grow, that they will have more capital, and that their sons and daughters will have a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Yanapampa es un Banco que recién inicia con 15 socias, todos ellos son L. D. L. Comunidad D. Yanapampa que pertenece al Distrito D. HuamanguilL., que se encuentra a 40 minutos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Los pobladores D. esta comunidad se dedican a L. agricultura, crianza D. animales, L. compra y venta D. animales.

Las socias realizan diversos negocios como L. agricultura, L. crianza D. animales, venta D. tara, cochinilL., animales menores, ganado vacuno y el servicio D. carpintería.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 6300 soles en el Banco Comunal.

Sus préstamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. abonos, ganado ovino, caprino, tara, cochinilL..

Los sueños D. las socias es que sus negocios sean más grandes, sus hijos tengan una buena educación y tener más capital.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, sheep, goats, piglets, and tara trees

loans.name: Antolin

texts.es:
Antolín is requesting his second loan from the AFODENIC organization so that he can invest in his small business. He is a dealer in a variety of medicine products, which he distributes wholesale to neighborhood general stores in the towns of Nueva Guinea and El Almendro. His wife also works selling products, and thus the two of them are working to make ends meet. Antolín’s dream is to set up a business as a wholesaler, to improve his business and satisfy the needs of his customers; this is the way his business will grow financially. The work Antolín does each day is a worthy economic choice that supports his family, since he knows how to manage their financial resources.

Antolín is a very responsible and honest man who is dedicated to his work. He and his wife have three young children: a five-year-old son, a nine-year-old daughter who is in her fourth year of primary school, and a fourteen-year-old daughter who is in her first year of secondary school. Antolín and his family live in Zone 7. He wants very much to help his family, and works hard so that he can offer his children better opportunities for the future and more support in their studies; he provides his deserving family with an example of good principles and values. Antolín is very grateful for the assistance he has received from AFODENIC.

Translated by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Don Antolín solicita a la institución de AFODENIC su segundo crédito para invertido en su pequeño negocio este cliente es comerciante de diversidad de productos de medicina humana, él entrega por mayor a las pulperías de las colonia del municipio de Nueva Guinea y El Almendro, también su esposa trabaja vendiendo producto, de esta forma ambos aportan para los gastos en el hogar. El mayor sueño de don Antolín es de tener una distribuidora, superar su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, de esta forma su negocio va tener mejor desarrollo empresarial, la actividad que realiza día a día es una alternativa económica digna hacia su familia pues sabe administrar sus recurso económicos.

El señor López es un hombre muy responsable, honesto, entregado al trabajado, es casado tiene tres hijos menores de edad, un niño de 5 años de edad, una niña de nueve años que estudia cuarto grado de primaria y otra niña de 14 años cursa primer año de segundaria, esta es familia habitante de la zona numero 7. Tiene como aspiracion beneficiar a su familia, trabajando duro para brindarle a sus hijos mejores opciones para un futuro mejor apoyandolos en el estudio y dandoles una ejemplo a la familia digna con buenos principios y valores en la sociedad. El Sr. Antolín se encuentra agradecido por los beneficio que ha recibido por AFODENIC

loans.use: Purchasing products for his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Manzanayocc Group

texts.es:
The Communal Manzanayocc Bank is a newer bank that has 4 cycles and 13 partners. The partners are from the Manzanayocc community that belongs to the Socos District and is 3 hours outside of the city of Ayacucho. The inhabitants of the community mainly raise cattle and produce milk, in addition to agriculture.

The partners are involved in diverse businesses such as raising cattle, milk production, livestock sales and agriculture.

The partners need different levels of loans ranging from approximately $100 and up, making up the total in the Communal Bank.

The loan proceeds will be invested in the purchase of medicine for livestock, rennet (a curdling agent), fertilizer, and smaller animals.

The dream of the partners is to have a great stable, to produce more, and to offer a good education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Manzanayocc es un Banco joven que tiene 4 ciclos y 13 socias. Las socias son de la comunidad de Manzanayocc que pertenece al Distrito de Socos y queda a 3 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Los pobladores de esta comunidad se dedican principalmente a la crianza de ganado vacuno y la producción de leche, además a la agricultura.

Las socias realizan diversos negocios como crianza de ganado vacuno, producción de lácteos, venta de animales y agricultura

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total de 4800 soles en el Banco Comunal.

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de medicina para su ganado, cuajo, abono y animales menores.

El sueño de las socias es tener un establo grande, producir más, y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of medicine for livestock, rennet (a curdling agent), fertilizer, and smaller animals.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo Sebastián R. is married and father to 5 children. He and his family live in and own their house in the city of Ñeemby.  Hugo sells leather-covered thermos bottles for mate or tereré, which are the most popular drinks in Paraguay.

Tereré is the most common drink in Paraguay – so common it’s practically a symbol of the country.  Paraguayans drink tereré in part because of the hot weather throughout most of the year.  It’s made of very cold water mixed with refreshing or natural curatives, each with different purposes such as diuretics, weight reduction, treatment for high blood pressure, digestion, etc.

Mate is similar but is prepared with hot water.  Both tereré and mate use thermos bottles for the water and “guampas” for the yerba mate (the dried leaves used to make tereré or mate).  “Guampas” are generally made of wood, metal or cow horns.  Lately it’s become fashionable to use leather-covered thermos bottles with unique designs, engravings and colors.

Hugo has a vehicle that he uses primarily for delivering his products and for purchasing materials.  He is applying for a loan to purchase thermos bottles, leather and “guampas.”

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Hugo Sebastián R. es casado y padre de dos hijos; ellos viven en una casa propia en la cuidad de Ñeemby. Hugo se dedica a la venta de termos forrados en cuero para mate o tereré que son las bebidas mas consumidas en nuestro país.

El tereré es la bebida más típica de nuestro país, es prácticamente un sello que nos caracteriza, el mismo es consumido ya que en nuestro país las altas temperaturas son muy comunes en la mayor parte del año, es por ello que se toma el “tereré” que consiste en agua bien fría a la cual  se le adiciona remedios refrescantes o naturales que poseen distintos tipos de propiedades como diuréticos, adelgazantes, para la presión sanguínea alta, para la buena digestión, entre otros.

El mate por otra parte es lo mismo pero se toma con agua caliente. Para ambos casos se utilizan termos para el agua y “guampas” hechas de madera, metal o del mismo cuerno de los vacunos, en donde se coloca yerba para luego ser tomada con el agua, por lo que está muy de moda utilizar termos forrados en cuero de vaca y que pueden tener distintos diseños, gravados y colores.

Hugo posee un vehículo que lo utiliza principalmente para hacer entregas de sus mercaderías y para la compra de sus materiales. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de termos, cuero, y guampas.

loans.use: Purchase of leather, thermos bottles and “guampas”

loans.name: Consesa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Consesa is soliciting a second loan to build a bedroom and meet the needs of the family. She is an exemplary and enterprising woman in her community of Almendro. She is a mother, caring for a twelve-year-old child who is in secondary school at the Padre Lucinio Institute. She works selling cosmetic brands such as Avon, Zermat, and Oriflame, at which she generates a satisfactory income. Her husband also helps with the household expenses, working as a salesman and bricklayer. Both are very hard working and have a great desire to get ahead and provide an education and dignified place to live for their child. The dream of this client is to have a proper dwelling with the basic necessities required by the family. She is very responsible, honest and dignified in her tasks as head of household and her goal is to get ahead and have a brighter future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Concesa solicita su segundo refinanciamiento para construir un dormitorio y poder satisfacer la demanda de la familia, es una mujer ejemplar emprendedora en su comunidad del Almendro, es madre de familia, tiene un niño a su cargo, de 12 años de edad estudia primer años de segundaria en instituto padre Lucinio M; labora como agente vendedora de las empresa de cosmético de Avon, Zermat, oriflame, donde obtiene ganancias satisfactoria, él marido también colabora en sus gasto del hogar, es comerciante y albañil, ambos son personas trabajadoras que desean poder salir adelante con la educación de su hijo y así poder dejarle una vivienda digna humana ante la sociedad. Son los sueños de esta clienta tener una casa justa con las condiciones básicas necesaria que requiere la familia, es muy responsable, honesta, digna de sus valores y principios como jefa de familia, su aspiración es de superar por un futuro mejor

loans.use: Make improvements to her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
The client Samuel S. is soliciting his fourth loan to invest in improvements to his home, which is located in Zone #3 of Nueva Guinea. With the loan, he intends to build a porch. He has worked at UNION FENOSA for five years as a distributor of invoices, where he carries out his tasks with much responsibility and honesty. He is a father of three children, the oldest of whom is fourteen years old and in secondary school. A second child, ten years old, is in 5th grade and his youngest, a daughter, is three. His wife takes care of the children and is a homemaker. This man has been a responsible father who has fought to provide for his family. His wishes are to find stable employment, good health for his family and an education for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El cliente Samuel S. esta solicitando su cuarto refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda ubicada en la zona # 3 de Nueva Guinea, don Samuel con este préstamo pretende construir un porche en su casa, es trabajador de UNION FENOSA, desde hace 5 años se desempeña como distribuidor de Facturas donde desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad y honestidad, es padre de tres hijos su hijo mayor de 14 años de edad estudia 2do año de educación secundaria, el otro de 10 años de edad estudia 5to grado de educación primaria y la niña menor de 3 añitos, su esposa se encarga de cuidar a sus hijos y hacer los quehaceres del hogar, este hombre ha sido un padre responsable que ha luchado para que a su familia no le falte lo básico en el hogar. Su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, salud para el y su familia y que sus hijos estudien

loans.use: Make improvements to his house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mercedes Adilia

texts.es:
Mercedes Adilia is 35 years old and the mother of five children.  She dedicates herself to purchasing and raising pigs, conducting her business as a traveling salesperson to help out her husband, Mr. Argling Suarez, who works as a gold miner in the town of La Libertad.  She is interested in this third loan to continue making improvements to her home.  This time, in particular, she wants to make repairs to her kitchen and add a living room floor and in this manner improve the living conditions in the house.

 Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer. 

La Sra. Mercedes Adilia, de 35 años de edad, madre de 5 niños, que se dedica a compra y engorde de cerdos y hacer venta ambulante para apoyar a su marido el Sr. Argling Suarez, que trabaja de pequeño minero en la mina de extraccion de oro del poblado de La Libertad, esta interesada en un 3er credito para continuar haciendole mejoras a su casa, esta vez en reparacion de su cocina y poner el piso de la sala y brindar mejores condiciones de vida en el hogar

loans.use: Make improvements to her home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli, 38 years old, is single and has a 5-year old daughter who is in preschool. She lives with her daughter and her sister in a house inherited from her mother. Her previous loans have served to help with her preparation for a teaching degree and for making some improvements to her home. This loan would help her build a wall that would add more privacy and security for the dwelling. She has ten years of experience in education, and she is known as a person who has managed to improve her standard of living through her own hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Araceli de 38 años de edad, soltera con una niña de 5 años estudiando el preescolar, habita con su hija y una hermana en su casa heredada de su mama, los creditos anteriores le ha servido para su preparacion como Licenciado en Pedagogia y realizar algunos otras mejoras en su vivienda , este credito lo solicita para levantar una pared para privacidad y seguridad de su hogar , tiene 10 de experiencia en el magisterio es reconocida como una persona que ha logrado su superacion personal con esfuerzo propio.

loans.use: Make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Nimia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nimia, a 50-year old teacher, has worked in various pre-school levels in the Caracolitos Negors. She is a single mother of four children (three girls and one boy).
